title: Complete Bicycle Chain Maintenance Kit
text: This excellent kit comes with a nice, hard-shell case that helps keep all the tools conveniently organized. It includes a chain, a chain scrubber, a variety of brushes, a bike link plier, chain breaker, chain link checker, and a pair of gloves. All of the items are well-made and easy to use. The chain features a quick link that makes it convenient to install. This is a well-organized and effective maintenance kit that will help you keep your bicycle running smoothly.

title: A Huge Fan of Wyze Devices
text: After purchasing several Wyze cameras (because they're so affordable), I went with the Wyze scales, and now the Wyze Band, and they all work wonderfully.  These are innovative devices at amazingly affordable prices.  Come on, Wyze, bring out the next thing because I already want it.

title: Crazy fast to blow up AIR ONLY Balloons.  LOVE IT
text: Game Changer for parties.  But watch the Video now.  The directions for knotting them is not in the booklet. The box comes with two KNOT makers. Cord is about 5 feet.  So it's great to plug in near an outlet and use on a table. Rocket fast. The photos and videos show some nice decorating ideas. It really is 5 stars.  I know that some may NOT like that it ISN'T a HELIUM one  but the ideas in the photos were fun and creative.  I live on the Coast so we can't use those type of balloons anyway. Believe it or not Helium is banned here. So this was AWESOME to have. I will never go back to the Flower shop and buy them.  I used big balloons for my first project. 6 inches flat from package.  Super nice look.  Strong too. Lasted for days!

title: PERFECT!!! text: As we set up our sports bar in our new house, I just knew we needed MORE hockey items. Now to find some amazing stickers to put on them.

It's truly what our bar needs. Not really what they were intended for.

title: Comfortable and Effective Swim Vest
text: This flotation vest is both comfortable and effective. It has straps that run over the shoulders, around the waist, and under your legs. These straps allow you plenty of adjustment to ensure a secure and comfortable fit. My wife likes this vest because it is not bulky around the shoulders yet it is extremely buoyant. There is even a small zip pocket over the left breast that would be perfect for storing something like car keys. This is a very nice item that will allow you to have a safe and comfortable day out on the water.

title: Cushy and Comfortable text: I have three yoga mats and this one is the most cushy and comfortable. I find I like to turn the yoga mat over as I find it has better sticky properties used that way. I like that this has extra thick memory foam so when you are on your knees it is less painful. This is a very lightweight mat, unlike some of my other mats. So it would be great for anyone who is transporting it to yoga class. If you have cats, watch out because they will love to scratch on this mat when you are not looking. It is so tempting for them. If you are allergic to latex this mat may also appeal to you. It is latex free.

~The Rebecca Review

I received one free mat for review purposes. This review is my honest opinion.

title: Easy to slip your boots in, pivot mechanism for foot, and sturdy design… text: [[VIDEOID:fea6c11340210a3a2ce38bdebf594999]] Nice lightweight, but built solidly for snow and ice terrain. The aluminum held my weight of 220 lbs with ease. Your shoes have full range of pivoting to allow easy climbing uphills. I have tried snowshoes without a pivoting foot and they were very uncomfortable, limited my foot movement, and caused muscle cramping. But, these prevented all those aggravations. These make walking on snow and ice enjoyable and they help to provide a good source of exercise in these Winter months. The walking poles don’t collapse with weight and are easy to adjust the length.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Fast assembly and pretty roomy for smaller people text: It took me a little bit to figure out how it all works, but once you get it I'm pretty confident that the "60 second" claim is accurate. It's insanely fast to pop up this tent! I thought that would mean it is insanely hard to put it away as some other pop-up-style tents seem to be. But surprisingly it wasn't hard to all to put away once you understand how it unbuckles. At first I think I almost broke it trying to figure it out- You don't force it to bend, you have to pull up on the joint to unlock it otherwise it might snap and break. The instructions weren't clear on that, but once you get it, honestly, it's pretty fast and simple. I'm impressed.
It's also pretty roomy inside. We all know when a tent says "3-4 Person" they mean really more like 2, but more can squeeze like sardines if they are skinny. Well, I had 3 kids stay in here, age 4 to 11, and they did NOT feel cramped (see picture- the sides weren't even spread out all the way since it was indoors and a couch was in the way). I climbed in to hang out with them for a bit, and I can honestly say one roughly 190lb dad and 3 kids fit inside and it didn't seem too crazy in there. It's also pretty tall for a small tent- my kids can stand inside easily and not hit the ceiling.
Would easily recommend!

title: Pilates Reformer.  This is great and all the items included were a plus.
text: Pilates Reformer.  This is great and all the items included were a plus.  Wife loves it. says it works for her. I hope she was happy to get it.  now lets see how happy she is to use it.

title: Five Stars
text: my kids love these for their home school chairs!!

title: Amazing table - great idea!
text: This 1/4th sized ping pong table is a great idea - it sets up in a smaller space, obviously, and will deliver just as much fun as the full size (which I can have by buying three more!) In the meantime, we can see just how popular the game is with the family without the full-size commitment!  I have seen too many tables gathering dust in garages when the novelty has worn off.  I wish it had come with paddles and balls, but, with Amazon's fast shipping, they'll be here by the weekend - and let the fun begin!  With all I've accumulated to entertain my grandchildren, the "game room" has become exactly that - and the addition of this table will really be a hit!  I like that this table does not feel like a "toy'.  It's sturdy and has a perfect surface for ping pong - it's amazing, really.  A full-size table, just shrunk!  Can't wait til the paddles get here.  Grandma needs to practice!

title: Very good, as expected
text: Ball is exactly as expected.

title: This works!
text: What a convenience this tote bag is!  It does carry as many as 30 cans, keeping them cool with ice - and no leaking!  We used it for a day trip to a lake, and we had nice, cold beverages all day long.  The bag never leaked even when all the ice finally melted.  This is a full-time part of our camping gear now - it’s good for day trips and for much longer ones.  The lack of leaking is amazing, as the bag just looks like a regular black fabric tote bag.  Great choice!

title: Great addition to any survival kit or camping gear.
text: Husband was very impressed with the fire starter. It was easy to use & works well. Lanyard is a nice feature to keep track of all the pieces. Great addition to any survival kit or camping gear.

title: Very decent set for the price text: We got these for the end of the pool season and a snorkeling trip to the Keys. My hope was to get a workable pair for my fifteen year old and I couldn't be happier. Obviously these are not pro level, but they are a very workable lower mid range set of mask and snorkel.

The best thing about it is comfort and fit. He had no problems with them on his maiden dive in our backyard pool. The mask has a fairly tight view but again, very workable. It was easy to size it for him and he is very happy with it. We are now all equipped and ready to go.

For the price this is a very decent set and you could do a lot worse and not a whole lot better.

title: Purchased by Dad but Reviewed by Mom & Son! text: My son decided to wrestle this year for his middle school. I was surprised! In the past he has leaned towards other non-contact sports. He has played baseball competitively (on various travel teams) since he was 5. He even tried his hand at rec football (yeah I was surprised by that one too) but he announced that he didn't think he would be pursuing football at his middle school. So when he came home and announced that he was "trying out for wrestling" I was baffled, but decided not to worry UNTIL he made the team. So when he came home and said that he MADE the 8th grade wresting team, I immediately had visions of people with "cauliflower ear and other wrestling injuries". So the only way I was going to feel better about his decision (after all I am supportive) was to make sure that he has the best possible headgear (safety equipment) available. His father and I read some reviews and searched on-line for various opinions/options, and finally decided that this Cliff Keen F5 Tornado Headgear seemed like the perfect place to start. It appeared to be reliable, or as reliable as something protecting your head can be while playing a contact sport. So although I knew that I would still worry, what could I do besides have faith that a product (recommended by some who have been involved in the sport for a lot longer than I), would do what it is suppose to do, protect my 13-year-old son during his matches?

I must say after observing several middle school wrestlers grapple and grab at each other (some with no headgear at all), I decided that the $40 investment was well worth it. I have only seen my son's headgear slip once, and that was because the kid he was wrestling grabbed on to it for extended amounts of time. And while it did slip some, it remained firmly on his chin, with only the top belt slipping onto his forehead. But once he was able to push away for his opponent, he was able to cooly slip the top strap back in place (quickly and easily). Otherwise, no matter the hold or the force used, the Cliff Keen F5 Tornado Headgear appears to stay in place.

What I like about them.... Well, first of all, his ears are extremely protected! I don't really worry since I have never seen it come off completely during a match (but remember I have seen it slip once onto his forehead). All in all, I think those are some very good odds, especially since I see a lot of kids lose their headgear or not wear any at all (which I still don't understand). Second, the Tornados are somewhat stylish (hey I am a Mom but I am also clearly a girl). I was able to order these in all black which coordinates with his wrestling singlet (I affectionately call it an onesie) and shoes. And finally, I also like the fact that this headgear is easy to clean. I simply put a small pack of Clorox wipes (in his bag) and told him to wipe them off following their morning and afternoon conditioning. And if he is worried that he used too much, I told him to wipe them off again with a slightly damp cloth and let them dry. So far there has been NO discoloration or ANY SMELL! They have held up pretty well to be used daily.

What my son likes about this headgear.....after all he is really the consumer. He says that they are light weight, and extremely comfortable. He said that there is a lot of room for his ears, which are surrounded by soft padding/material, and that he can barely tell that the chin strap is on. But most importantly he feels that his ears are safe. All in all, I think that we got our money's worth. While they may not have been the cheapest out there or the most expensive, they definitely have the features that I think are essential for any young wrestler. My son's health is definitely worth the extra money! Afterall, he is my biggest investment. I wholeheartedly give this product a 5.

title: A fun way to get in your daily water!
text: I laughed when I got this product. For some reason I didn't expect it to be so big but it is HUGE!  I like the wording on the bottle, its a fun way to get all your water in. It does not leak and is certainly easy to clean.The down side is its not that portable for me as it's so big and heavy. It is a great product for staying home. My friends loved it when they saw it !

title: Decent for the price paid text: Time will tell if this holds up to the way I will use this bag. I chose it because it can hold 2 spare e-bike batteries and if needed, can hold all 4 batteries in the side pockets.
My wife and I ride Lectric bikes and we have a trail/train path in Akron, OH we like to ride. You ride 20+ mile one way and you can ride the train back. Problem is we needed a way to pull all the batteries out of the bike to even get close to the weight limit for the train crew to lift the bikes on the train. They required all batteries to be removed, safety and lift weight. This bag easily holds the 2 spares for everyday rides, and can carry all four batteries for train transport (quite heavy). Plus enough room to spare for medical and bike kit. We like to be prepared. People always seem to get hurt on trail and rarely have supplies to patch themselves or their bike.

title: Good Protection
text: Bike helmets are a necessity, especially with kids. This one seems to offer good protection. The straps are adjustable and there's a knob on the back that you can adjust for an even better fit. The material seems good. Overall, it seems comparable to other kids bike helmets out there.

title: Very Versatile Weighted Vest!
text: This vest is truly for both men and women, as it fits my husband as well as myself. It's comfortable and easy to put on and take off. It's also slim and compact to store away. The material is smooth and the entire vest is well constructed, with all the seams tight. The clasp buckle lock is sturdy and holds fast. I like that there is a small padded flap that lays under the lock so that the lock doesn't irritate or cause friction while wearing and moving. I have already had to spot clean the vest and it was extremely easy to do. The weight at 12 lbs may not sound like much, but after wearing this vest for a short amount of time, one can really feel muscles working harder, so it's a great vest to start with.

title: Excellent Bike Lock text: [[VIDEOID:a01d3ba760ef93ce761cf0c0cf53d265]] I bought the 35" model. I can hang it at the center of the handlebars while riding, with the lock at the bottom. The weight keeps it from flopping around. I also have the option of wrapping around the stem directly under the seat. I like the handlebars option better since it is instant off and on.

This is a heavy chain, and it appears like it would be difficult to quickly cut. I really like the magnetic connection as you insert the end of the chain into the slot in the lock. I like that it's an all-in-one chain bike lock with the lock attached, and that the entire chain is covered. Locking and unlocking is easy and fast. They provide 3 keys. You cannot just simply get extra keys at a locksmith store. You would have to order the replacement keys via the company.

title: Great for muscle therapy
text: A few months ago I pulled a muscle in my arm and for a while after that it would hurt a little when I made a fist. A PT friend of mine suggested, among other things, that I should do repetitive exercises to strengthen it back up. These are PERFECT for that. Before using these, it hurt to open a clamp to hold up a backdrop at work. After a couple of days of using this at my desk, I'm already feeling better and stronger. Since it is a 2 pack, I can leave one on my desk and keep one in the car or by my bed. They are easy to hold, have a solid rubberized grip, and adjustable tension strength, which is welcome for people like me who want to start off easy then turn it up as I feel better. I recommend it.

title: works as promised
text: My husband bought this rack because it says it works with nearly any vehicle.  We have it in a storage unit on Maui and rent cars when we are there... not knowing exactly what we will get for a car, but still needing to get our bikes out the storage unit to our condo was a challenge.  We've used the rack several times and not a single issue. It takes my husband about 3 minutes to attach it and about the same to detach. After spending nearly an entire day on the island and visiting about 8 speciality bike stores, I found this one on Amazon in about 2 mintues.  Should have checked Amazon first!  Especially when the bike stores wanted to sell us stuff at 20 times the price and were NOT "universal."  One of the better items I've purchased on Amazon.

title: PERFECT starting point for any age!!! Solid set and price! text: Wow.. awesome beginner set!! Perfect for those interested in trying their hand at the trendy pickle ball rage. Great idea for a family gift or something to send off with your college kiddo, equipped for x4 players makes it a great social activity.

Compared next to a pro racquet that cost us x2 the price- Im not seeing much of a difference!? This feels solid yet still lightweight.. which is nice for wrist fatigue. Nothing cheap or fragile in structures and offers a firm comfort grip- complete with protected edges. What’s crazy- is for this price you receive x4 racquets of this same caliber..

Icing on the cake is the included storage bag. Very nicely made- this lets you transport and store safely.. We leave set in trunk of the car- So, whenever a game can be played we’re ready! Everything inside bag is nice, neat and contained. For price point you’ll get a solid starter set.. one that can step up. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Attractive, sustainable & does what it promises, but too large for me text: I wanted a larger water bottle for use at my workplace because I found that I was running low on water too often and was too busy (or, admittedly, too lazy) to take the 2 minute walk to refill my water bottle, leaving myself thirsty and dehydrated at my desk for hours. In doing my research for a worthy substitute, I was really attracted to this water bottle. I loved the company's sustainable values and how well-made their product seemed.

When I received the water bottle, I was surprised how lightweight on it is on its own; of course, it gets heavy when you fill it with 40 oz of water, which I wish that I had the foresight to realize before I made this purchase. It is so heavy and wide that I need to use two hands to pick up and drink out of when it is full. The other noticeable thing about the bottle is its beautiful color. I bought it in aqua and it is so eye-catching that I got two compliments on it in my small office during its first day of use.

I did not like the style of the cap which the water bottle came with, so after doing research, I purchased another brand's water bottle cap which was HydroFlask-compatible, which I also thought should be compatible with this one. Unfortunately, it is not. The cap screws on, but it leaks. Of course, this is not the fault of the brand or the water bottle, but it was disappointing to me, and if you are considering buying the bottle and swapping out the cap, this might be worth taking note of.

When I first bought this water bottle, I intended to use it all the time to replace my current water bottle. However, due to its hefty size and weight, I have decided to keep this bottle strictly at the office, as it is even too heavy and unwieldy to bring back and forth to my car, gym, and/or home. I drive a little sedan and it does not fit in my cup holders. I might be bringing it to the gym on my heavy cardio evenings, but it definitely staying in the office for pilates and barre. And it is definitely useful to have around for camping or hiking!

Overall great water bottle and very pleased with the product; unsure how practical it is for daily hydration use when commuting (unless you commute with a backpack).

title: Fun game for party text: I like when my kids play games because it so much better than staring at a screen. This was a very fun game for my kids. They really enjoyed it. It kept their interest. I really like that it gets them playing with others. It is great for them to play with each other or with us.

This game wasn’t too hard for them to learn. The quality was very good. It held together fine. I really think it’s a lot of fun for them. I also like to give games as gifts. I would recommend this one.

title: Great Air Mattresses
text: Great Air Mattresses, Love the bag at the end to wrap around and tie up when you are done. Actually stayed inflated for 4 days straight without having to add any air.

title: Great product

title: Works but has drawbacks text: Pros:
Ambidextrous holster
Fits wide array of guns
Seems to hold fairly securely

Cons:
As others have said, it's thick

Here's an attempt to do just about everything, and to some extend, it does. It's IWB and OWB combined that can work for right or left-handed draw. It'll fit in most locations (back, hip, front) and fits an impressive array of guns. It seemed to work well with a Bersa Thunder CC .380, SW 437 .38 (J-frame snubbie), Kel-Tec P-11, Springfield XDE (9mm) and Sig P-226 (9mm). It feels better with the larger guns, I think, as the holster is then smaller in total carry volume. With .380's, the holster feels as hefty as the weapon. So, it works, but is not my first choice. For the price, I will keep it as seems well made and it can be widely used.

title: Does not work, don't waste your time/money. text: I used this a bunch of times on my dirt bike goggles. It might provide a very marginal amount of fogging protection, but my goggles still fog up if I'm riding in the rain, or get any sort of significant moisture behind the lens. You might as well just use dish soap, it will probably work as well if not better.

UPDATE: Downgrading to a 1 star. I tried to use this a few more times on goggles and motorcycle visors. If anything, it seems to make things worse by creating a film on your visor for moisture to adhere to. I tried buffing it with no rinsing, rinsing and not buffing, and all sorts of combinations of quantities and methods. Might as well wad up the dollar bills you spend on this product and use them as a rag to wipe the fog off.

title: FANTASTIC RAIN JACKET!!
text: I am 5'4" and a 34DD. This jacket fit me like it's tailored. It goes almost to the bottom of my bum and the sleeves hit just below the wrist. There are so many things that are top quality about this jacket. The material is totally rain proof (yes, this makes it crinkle when you walk) it's insulated so it keeps you really warm. The hood has a small visor so it does a fantastic job of not only warming your head but keeping the rain put of your eyes. The hood tightens with a toggle if you need it tighter. The cuffs have velcro closure. No rain can sneak up your cuffs as a result. The zipper is a YKK and pulls smooth everytime. There are 5 velcro tabs along the zipper line too for extra security. The 2 side pockets have zipper closures. There is no inside pocket. I am loving it and it looks like it will last many many years.

title: Quickly Cleaned Surface Rust, Gunk From Corroded Metal Commode Frame text: STAR BRITE XTREME CLEAN ALL-SURFACE CLEANER/DEGREASER is terrific stuff! It solved a problem that had defeated everything I tried. It quickly removed all the surface rust and gunk from a metal commode frame that had developed rust spots where water splattered and corroded the chrome tubing. Not even Windex would clean that chrome frame; but this Xtreme Clean worked in seconds! Now the chrome looks shiny and new where it's not already corroded, and the entire metal frame surface is clean.

Xtreme Clean comes in a plastic bottle with a spray top (Off, Spray, Stream). You don't want to get it in your eyes, and you should wash it off if you get it on your hands, but in general it seems to be safe and non-toxic. Most household cleaners that are as effective as Xtreme Clean one have a multi-page label with lots of scary use and storage warnings.

This is a product that I'll be reordering often, because it does an excellent job on that previously-impossible-to-clean commode frame. I'm sure that I'll find lots of other uses for it, too.

title: There Are Some Issues text: This arrived today and I was very anxious to try to set it up. We camped a lot when I was a child and setting up the tent always involved a lot of cussing on someone's part. This wasn't too different an experience in some ways.

Pros:

Fairly easy to set up the first time out of the box. I did it by myself.
Lightweight enough for a woman to carry
Large floor space and tall enough for a 6' 2" man to stand up in.
Lots of vents and windows
Nice rainfly

Cons:
Impossible directions. You don't need them too much to get set up, but you need some guidance to get the tent down and back in the bag. It took 3 tries to finally get it in there
The center beam on the top that keeps the tent stretched out, did not lock in place for us. I don't know if this is a defect or just poor design
Because of the lightweight nature of this, the floor and walls are very thin material. The floor reminds me of one of those really cheap plastic tarps that you can get.
The metal stakes that are used to hold in the feet of the poles bend very easily if you hit a rock or an obstacle.
Not very secure when set up. I think this would need some serious tent stakes to hold it down in any kind of wind. It was windy here today and I'm not sure this would have stayed together too long.
The zippers are not going to take much use, in fact the whole thing might be good for one season of regular camping and use/abuse.

All in all, I was hoping for better. At least something that kids visiting us could use. Maybe with a little tweaking we can get it stable.

title: Peaceful Settings text: Your first observation might be similar to mine. The outdoor setting is calming and just gorgeous. The colors in this video are beautiful and the river creates a calm, quiet and peaceful setting for your workout.

I enjoyed the workout, but didn't realize how many muscles you needed to perch yourself atop a balance ball. You start off just rolling over the ball and then progress to some pretty tough balancing acts. There are some stretches which will stretch out your spine in new ways. I realized I'm not as flexible as I thought I was.

I'd advise watching this video at least once before proceeding because it sometimes difficult to follow the workout while attempting to focus on not hurtling towards the floor if you are not totally focused on what you are doing.

The kit includes:

Medium inflatable exercise ball (green, 26"/65cm)

Full-length workout video (35 minutes)

Air pump

The Air pump is "ok," but I found that an electric pump was much more efficient. If you use the air pump, you might want to do that "workout" the day before. The instruction scare you into worrying about inflating the ball too much, but never fear, with that pump, it might be impossible.

The medium exercise ball is "ok" but had I realized there was a larger balance ball, I'd have ordered the larger one since I'm taller. If you are 5' 9" and above, I'd say go for the blue balance ball (large size). I think weight also counts. If you are above your recommended weight (ideal weight and all that), then you might want a larger size.

On the side of the box it says:

Small Purple Balance Ball - Height 5' 0" to 5' 5" - Ball Size 22"/55cm

Medium Green Balance Ball - Height 5' 6 to 5' 11" - Ball Size 26"/65cm

Large Blue Balance Ball - Height 6' 0" to 6' 3" - Ball Size 30"/75cm

The exercise video is combination of shorter segments from three balance ball workouts. You really have to concentrate on making smooth and steady movements.

The way I found this workout to be most effective was to place the ball on top of a yoga mat. This prevents slippage of the ball on a carpet and also prevents you from getting injured because the yoga mat provides an additional level of protection from your hands and feet slipping on a carpet.

You will be doing three workouts.

Upper Body

Abs

Lower Body

There are times when you are either sitting, leaning over the ball or on your back, balancing and stretching out your spine. The hardest part of this workout is when you are on you back and you are rolling on top the ball. It is easier once you make full use of your powers of concentration.

The video is a nice introduction, but is really only an introduction. While you can get a good beginner's workout, I'd imagine it is more effective to order the three additional videos they recommend. Karen Voight also has a DVD out called BLT (Butt, Legs & Tummy) on a ball.

This workout will take you to new levels of concentration and mind-body awareness. It will work the upper body, lower body and abs. You will be strengthening, toning and conditioning smaller core muscles.

The 45 minutes includes a 5-minute warm-up to learn proper positioning.

If you enjoy this workout, look for:

BalanceBall Fitness Upper Body Workout

BalanceBall Fitness Abs Workout

BalanceBall Fitness Lower Body Workout

~The Rebecca Review

title: X1 of my favorite finds of summer 2022..!!! text: Truly the easiest and most lightweight crossbody butt pack I’ve seen.. A total fav. find for summer 2022! (a title Ive only crowned x3 items all season!) Material is so versatile + hatched thread/stitching lends merit for durability without bulking it down. Dual zips slide like pure butter for easy in/out -and lets not forget the cutest zipper poles.. EVER!! Tiny working compasses (see up close pic.’s above.)

Outer shell holds a loose shape for structure but bag completely opens up to load.. or find what you’ve lost inside! I’ve used many buttpacks in the past and it’s SO rare you can actually “get into the bag” to see just exactly what you’re looking for.. A moment of silence for the perfection of this brand and the end of my 2yr. long hunt…

The few simple perks cover what matters most! An Interior zip pocket for safe keeping of content.. a key tether with clasp sewn into the inside seam to let you find keys in an instant… headphone port option to run a cord thru if still using “old school” style vs. blue tooth.. and a strap that can fit a waist or expand X-body style.. just like I prefer!

Size comparison photos above- one easily fits a cellphone, headphones, minimalistic wallet, girl products, chapstick, travel sunscreen, gum, trusted sharpie and carabiner clip with hand sanitizer! With all my content I’m approx. 80% full. *the trick is.. go travel sizes to carry all items you want!!

At $16- i’m smitten!! The best usability features I’ve found and everything I was looking for at a steal of a deal..! Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

Perhaps the grippy part should be thicker. My shoes can slide around while pedaling, and this should not be happening on a non-slip pedal, and not ones as expensive as these.

These pedals are certainly very easy to install. They turn the bike crank smoothly. The size is nice. I am just disappointed they don't have a stronger grip while pedaling.

title: 100% not a true 0 degree bag. text: My wife and I picked 2 of these up to refresh our camping gear. They were a great price so we figured we would give them a shot.

Well, the weather in northern Michigan this weekend was low 30s during the day and mid-high 20s at night.

I’m not surprised my wife was cold, however, I am usually hot in any weather. I was cold.

My wife was wearing her coat, sweatshirt, leggings, Long johns, and cabin socks. Cold.

I was in my normal camping attire, and with it being a 0 degree bag, I should have been good, right? T shirt, undies, and no socks. I was ice cold.

My 0 degree Coleman bag my parents gave me when I was 15 is far better than these bags, and they don’t suck up moisture like a sponge.

Returning these.

title: Solid 60" Umbrella text: An umbrella is usually one of those things you don’t think about until you need it, and at that point it is often too late to go get one without getting soaking wet. I am in the habit of keeping one in the back seat of my car so I will always have one when I am out and about. The one I keep there has been great but it is nothing particularly special (excepting the color). I was anxious to see if this umbrella would be better for my needs. So far it has worked out well for me.

This is a very large and sturdy umbrella, which is the kind I prefer (I am ok with the little compact ones in a pinch, when I am just trying to keep my head dry). It opens with the push of a button and it snaps open with a loud click, so there is no question it is completely open. Closing again requires two hands, one to hold the handle and the other to pull down the slider to snap it in place, and when it is closed properly it does so with a loud click – again, no question that it is closed properly.

It appears to be very study when open. I have had it get caught in a strong gust and it did not invert on me, which is a very good thing. The handle is solid and is well insulated with a foam grip that is easy to hang onto even when very wet.

One of the features about this umbrella that is prominently placed in the description as well as on the packaging is that it is coated in Teflon. I will confess that I cannot see or feel it on the nylon, but water does bead up and roll off differently than with other umbrellas I have used. This may not seem like it’s all that important – until you are ready to shake it dry and close it. Most nylon umbrellas I have used do not shake dry so nicely, but this one is a little better about that than most.

Finally, the umbrella itself comes in a nice sleeve that serves two purposes. First, it protects the umbrella when it is not in use which is a minor concern but is helpful in some situations like storage in a full closet. The other purpose it has is for carrying – it has a double cord in it so it can be slung over a shoulder, or work like a backpack when closed. This frees up your hands of other things when it is not raining.

This is a nice, large and well-made umbrella. It is constructed to handle windier conditions and it repels water a bit better than most. It is a little more expensive than the typical umbrella, but it is worth it’s asking price and I am happy to recommend it.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at minimal or no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Good Looking, Warm Jacket text: This is a very warm winter jacket that will keep you comfortable in very harsh conditions. I'm an avid cross-country skier, and after a workout it's important to slip into a high quality jacket. This jacket feels like putting on a sleeping bag and it will have you toasty warm in no time. The label says it has a polyester lining, and I haven't seen any signs of down feathers poking out between the seams.

The jacket has a shiny appearance and the shell feels almost slick to the touch. It is good at repelling water, so it won't get wet if you're out in the snow. I liked the lining fabric on the front pockets. There's nothing fuzzy that might get caught on a ring or keys, but your hands feel well insulated. There is also an inside pocket that is ideal for a cell phone or wallet. The hood is large enough to be useful, and covers your head even if you're wearing a hat. An elastic cinch cord extends from either end with a plastic cord lock on both sides.

The zipper is really nice and never gets caught up on the inner lining. It is important to have a quality zipper on a quality jacket because nothing is worse than when your zipper jams up. This zipper has big teeth and smooth action. I also like the cuffs and waist material which are form fitting but not too tight. This is a very nice jacket for skiing, or just staying warm for city winter life.

title: Warm and Mobile
text: I really like the feel of these gloves. The material is like a thick spandex, so they're not clunky like a lot of other winter gloves. They keep your hands warm without limiting what you can do with your hands. I will likely stick with gloves like this from now on.

title: Nice and sturdy
text: This canopy is designed for two people to set it up. It was easy to assemble and put away. Took about 15 minutes to put together. Feels sturdy and It also does not take up much room so you’re free of clutter. Overall, it is a beautiful canopy.

title: Great bag at a fantastic price.
text: I  was looking for a sleeping bag to keep in the living quarters of a horse trailer. This is the perfect bag for extra warmth when a Texas Blue Norther comes through. Very nice bag, well constructed,  with just the right amount of insulation.  Might even take this one to deer camp. Coleman has been around for years, they are known for quality products.

title: Perfect for housing and transporting delicate microphone systems and electronics text: I purchased this from a different source (based strictly on price) to house a [[ASIN:B00HYN7NR4 Audio2000's 6952umh UHF 200 Frequency Portable Wireless Lavalier/headset Microphone]], which consisted of two transmitters, a receiver and two wireless headsets. The entire set fit nicely, along with a hand held microphone, a few patch cables and spare batteries.

The case ships with two 2-inch thick layers of egg crate style foam and a separate 1-inch layer of regular foam that can be cut out. The interior at the widest is 16.5 inches and the width is 12 3/4 inches at the widest and 11 3/8 inches at the narrowest. The interior without foam is about 61/4 inches deep.

This case affords a lot of protection, especially for delicate gear for which I purchased it. I like the fact that it is lockable, and I especially love the capacity and extra foam. From a price perspective it's an absolute bargain, especially when compared to the cost that companies specializing in wireless microphone systems are asking for cases that are nowhere near this one's quality or capacity.

If you are shopping for a case for electronic gear and stumble upon this do not let the fact that it's designed for weapons deter you. It's ideal for a lot more uses.

title: Got a dud at first text: The scooter I got just flat out didn't work. Assembled it, charged it up as instructed in about three hours, hit the throttle and nothing, didn't budge at all. Swagtron customer service said they've heard of Amazon shipping refurbished scooters as new lately, which I'm guessing happened to me because the "new" scooter has a few scratch marks and gouges down near the joint where the handlebars fold up.

Also the rear disk brake is very stiff and you have to manually push the brake lever back into place or else it drags on the wheel, and the screw that fastens the brake lever to the handlebars was almost impossible to turn, I lost some skin on my fingers and stripped the screwhead getting it into place. Now I have to get it off again and pack the whole thing back up.

Amazon customer service is shipping what they say will be a brand new scooter that works, and they're also sending UPS to pick up the old one for no charge. Hopefully this will get resolved but this is all a real disappointing pain in the neck.

UPDATE: Got the replacement from Amazon in a few days as promised. It definitely seems new, since there's packaging and safety stickers that weren't included with the first one I got. No scratches either. The brake lever went on easily and works well. But best of all it actually works. Pick up the front wheel and hit the throttle and it maxes out at 17.9 MPH with no load. Haven't tried it outside yet because of weather but I have been driving around an indoor garage and it hits over 14 MPH no problem, which feels pretty fast. The light works well, the app connects easily. The battery has dropped by 50% just driving indoors so I doubt the range is as advertised.

title: Very Bright and Versatile Flashlight text: [[VIDEOID:97485467a42838457096fc5f5b521c7a]] I work in an area where a good, bright flashlight it often an absolute necessity. I like the brightness of the latest generation LED flashlights even though it can be harsh as they can really light up and area so much better than an incandescent light or cheaper LED lights. This is an exceptionally bright flashlight that works very well and is easy to adjust.

In the package is the flashlight itself, a rechargeable 18650 battery and a battery charger. Everything you need to get going and using this light is in the box and the battery is charged up already so when you open the box you're ready to go. Also included is a holder/adapter for AAA batteries so this flashlight can be used with 3 AAA batteries instead of so desired.

This flashlight has 5 operating modes: high brightness, medium brightness, low brightness, strobe and SOS. When the power button is pressed but not clicked all the way it changes the mode of the flashlight. Pressing it all the way in so it clicks turns the whole thing on and off. The lens can be slid back and forth to move the light between brightness on a concentrated spot and diffused over a wider coverage area.

The flashlight is made of aluminum and it is a solid and durable unit. As a bonus, it comes with a wrist lanyard.

This is the flashlight I carry in my toolbag to work every day. I am very pleased with it and am happy to recommend it. It is exceedingly bright, it is very adjustable and it has multiple operating modes. The icing on the cake is the inclusion of a battery and charger so you never have to be without light.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: NOT FOR HOT LIQUIDS; only keeps liquids cold; it is leakproof text: I am INCREDIBLY disappointed because I ordered this for hot liquids because the Amazon description says "double-wall vacuum insulated to maintain cold or hot temperatures." However, once I received this and saw the plastic / rubberized tip and a similar type straw, I thought there is no way this is for hot liquid. I was right. After reading the attached card (see first photo), it says this is not for hot liquid. I have so many cold liquid containers that I did not want another one. This is also expensive and is not worth the purchase for just a cold beverage container when it was a hot liquid container that was wanted.

Nevertheless, it works very well for cold liquids very well. This comes in three pieces (reservoir, top, straw). The straw gets screwed into the top. The tip is pliable and has to be sipped with strong suction. My water stayed cold all night long. I did put several ice cubes in the container with my tepid water and it felt like it came out of the fridge after about 12 hours.

In addition to its thermal properties, it is also leakproof.

In summary, this is four stars as a cold beverage insulating container but zero stars for hot simply because the straw and tip are not suitable for that. Had this "hot liquid" incorrect claim not been made on the Amazon site (which is how all purchasers make decisions), I would have rated this 4 stars.

title: Sturdy, Stable, and Easy to Assemble text: I have 10, 20 and 30 pound dumbbells and they take up a lot of room and look unattractive when you just stack them in a corner. This rack is an ideal solution for a small set of weights. I assembled it while watching football and it went together easily. The rack comes with a hex wrench, but you will need a wrench to hold the bolts in place for tightening.

The rack has rubber sleeves that fit over the hooks so there is no concern you might scratch your dumbbells. The rack is very stable, however, I wouldn't recommend allowing a toddler or a small child to play near the rack when it is loaded.

There are five slots with wider separation at the bottom. There is enough space where I can put my 30 pound weight at the bottom, and the 20 pound weight on the next slot. The manufacturer recommends a maximum weight of 200 pounds. This is a great rack for getting your personal weights organized.

title: Lasted About Two Weeks
text: My little kids were excited to have their very own trampoline. This trampoline was appropriately sized for my very small toddler (25 lbs.). But my 40 lb. six-year-old was far too big. The net around the trampoline came just below his shoulder. It also had a tendency to tip over. We had to clear the ground under it very well because the smallest stick or bump on the dirt would make it tip. After two weeks, my toddler falling into one of the posts made the post break off, leaving a jagged metal spot where it stood. There was no way to just take the net off the trampoline and keep using it because the posts that hold the net posts in place stick up about 6 inches around the edge of the trampoline, leaving metal posts around to fall on. We ended up having to just disassemble it and throw it away.

title: Sticks to the Basics and Gets Them Right text: I have a pocket knife in my pocket at all times and I have found having one on me is almost always useful. I had not heard of Old Timer until recently, but their knives look nice and I thought I would give them a chance. So far I am very pleased with this particular knife.

This is a no-frills knife that doesn't try to get too fancy. The blades have to be pulled open manually without a spring assist, and it does not have some of the things that other knives frequently have such as a corkscrew, screwdriver and other integrated emergency tools. Instead it has three blades - nothing more. Each blade is different and has different uses, though the thought that comes to mind when I look at the knife as a whole is whittling and carving.

The blades are tight and do not wobble. That's a good thing and says that the knife as a whole is assembled well. The blades feel solid and secure when opened.

I love the bone handle. It feels good in the hand and it looks retro which is a good thing. The texture makes it easy to maintain a grip, even when hands are just a little wet.

This is a smallish knife, so it will fit in your pocket and not take up lots of room. This is a little smaller than most knives I am used to carrying, and that's a mixed bag to me - on one hand I like having a larger knife, probably because I am used to having one, but on the other I like the fact that it is small, compact and lightweight.

This is a very nice knife that sticks to getting the basics right without a bunch of extras that only add weight and take away from the overall package. It looks great and is made well.

title: Works as a taillight but it's practically impossible to open to install or replace the batteries text: This is a 2.4 lux/4 lumen rain proof and splash proof bicycle taillight which takes 2 AAA batteries (not included). These batteries should provide 36 hours of illumination according to the package.

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this light. First, it's practically impossible to remove the cover to insert the batteries. There's a notch at the bottom of the light that is used to open the compartment. I had to use a letter opener to pry it open while squeezing the top a bit. The force that had to be used damaged the plastic around the notch but did not affect the light's functionality. There are four plastic prongs that hold the top reflector onto the base and I can see these prongs breaking when opening or closing the compartment to replace the batteries.

I have a Trek bike and it was difficult to position on my bike because the height of the light got in the way of the reflector that was already there. However, the mounting bracket is a typical bracket that clenches itself around the bike frame. The light clips onto the fastener and can be removed and used elsewhere, such as clipping onto a backpack or hat for use when walking.

The light turns on via a button on the back. Only the top "bulging" part lights up as the bottom acts as a reflector.

Because of the difficulty of opening this light and chance for breakage during battery replacement, I personally cannot recommend this. This is not a light I would purchase after having tried it.

title: Easy to Use, and LOUD!! text: This is the first electronic whistle I have ever seen or used and I have been impressed with it so far. I was not exactly sure what to expect from it and I was curious to see how it would compare to a traditional whistle. It definitely has some advantages over a regular whistle and is very definitely worth some consideration if you officiate outdoor sports.

This is a small and not unattractive device, about the size of a tube to toothpaste (slightly smaller) and bright yellow. It has a lanyard attached to it so it can be hund around the neck like a traditional whistle to secure to a wrist if that is preferred. One end is open and this is where the sound comes out. There’s a single button control on the side for activating the whistle, and a switch that allows for switching between two different tones and turning the whole unit off.

The whistle takes two CR2032 batteries, included in the package. This is a relatively common battery size now so it is easy to find replacement batteries when the batteries are depleted. While AAA batteries would have made more sense to me, they would have added weight to the whistle so button batteries are a good choice.

This is a LOUD whistle! It is a bit louder than I expected. Tone one is a traditional whistle sound and is suitable for officiating at outdoor games like soccer and football. The second tone is slightly lower and has more of a buzz two it; this tone would also work for outdoor sports, but I think it is best suited for when there are two officials and you want to differentiate between the two of them.

I would stop short of calling this whistle waterproof but it is definitely acceptable for use outside in light rain.

The main advantage this whistle has over a traditional whistle is the fact that it does not require any effort. You do not have to blow through it which gets tiring after a while with normal whistles. Also, because you never have to put your mouth on it, it is more sanitary.

If you have need to use a whistle, particularly outdoors, this electronic whistle is a good choice. It is cleaner that a traditional whistle, it is at least as loud, it has two distinct sounds and is semi-waterproof.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no/minimal cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: less for camp more for everyday use (cold or w/ microwave) text: I like the idea. If you are using this for home, office, hotel, on the run. For those applications you are likely to have food that doesn't need to be heated or you will have access to a microwave. Maybe even for camping, or day hike, so long as you are not looking to also cook with it- as it is not meant for flame or direct heat. For that, I prefer to pack a metal bowl and cup set.

There are two "plates" at .75" deep, and a "bowl" (or lid) that measures 1.5" deep. The three items stack.

There are 2 eating utensils. Spoon on one side, and a combo Knife and Fork on the other. The spoon and fork work fine. The knife is best for items you want to cut that don't need a lot of work to get it done. Softer, easier items are best.

There are two cups. The base is a soft silicon that smooshes up inside. The lid/cap is attached. It flicks open easily, yet doesn't snap tight (too bad). Comfortable enough to drink from it with cap open, or can keep it closed and drink from the small opening.

The cups don't stand well on their own empty. They do fine with liquid inside. One of my pictures has the pink cup leaning up against other stuff because it is empty. The green one is standing fine, but I have water poured inside.

Everything stacks and fit together nicely. Needs harness to hold it all together.

Nylon with mesh, draw string bag is just big enough to fit the stacked together and harnessed items.

I tried this set at home with my lunch, so I could see how everything performed. I like the look of it, I like the materials used. I think this set would do well with an additional lid/bowl so there would be 1:1 for each set. Especially as a cup and a utensil fits nice in each plate, it would be nice to have an additional lid for one of the sets. This would allow the set to be parted out (say one for work, one for car) and/or as well as allow each user to have the exact same thing. I don't know why it wasn't arranged to be like that.

I do like the cups, overall, and am considering toss one in my purse.

title: Impressive Mask with Easy to Breathe Snorkel text: I have been diving and snorkeling for over 30 years and when I saw this new design of mask I was excited to try it out - I’m so glad I did.

In comparison to the standard mask and snorkel, the viewable angles are far greater and the ease of breathing is immensely easier. I could not believe just how easy it was to clear this snorkel after diving under water - absolutely remarkable.

I was glad that I opted for the S/M as I’m certain the larger size would have leaked on me. The tri point head gear allows for adequate adjustments which allowed me to make the mask snug and comfortable and not leak.

The most impressive thing about this mask is how clearly you can see under water which is the whole point of wearing a mask in the first place. While most masks limit your vision to a narrow field directly in front of you this is so much more open. You really have to experience this to appreciate just how different it really is.

I have LOVED this mask and have recommended it to several of my friends.

This is a great product.

title: A handsome, well-made, mid-level Little leaguer outfield glove for fair price text: My son is a serious baller for a 12 yr old. Has played baseball since 5 yrs of age. Takes his play - and gear - very serious ( no, I'm not "that Dad" ,fwiw) . He had worn out a fav Mizuno & that coincided w/ him moving to 13-15yr old league. The old 11.5" Mizuno's lack of palm padding was making higher velocity catch sting . It was also too small & lacked web basket stability from wear. He went & researched w/ budget parameters I gave him . 2days l8r, he came to me & said ," this one, Dad" .
We mink-oiled and re-secured the quality laces. He noticed no stings in palm, no longer dropped easy popups and LOVED this glove. We had to ask him to stop professing his love of this glove. The fact that Wilson had a tag w/ Dansby Swanson on this model was an unforseen bonus which solidified it's legitimacy to the young, Braves crazed, baseball living & breathing boy. This is a very well constructed outfielder or 2nd-3rd baseman mitt which should last 2-3 seasons of hard use. Longer if less use. Looks far more $$$ than actually is. graded "A" by a Dad that has bought over 20 gloves in 15 years for 2 kids & over 10 personally in 40 years.

title: Great little ice packs text: They're small enough to be able to layer them however you like in a cooler. I like that they're rectangular.. for standing on end in the door shelves of my freezer. They're easy to wipe down if necessary. They seem to stay cold for a good amount of time. It would be nice if it were longer, but it's good enough!

I use these in a small cooler that I take to craft fairs.. I'm outside all day in 90 plus temps sometimes and these keep my drinks cool. They also fit nicely at the top of my waistband in my lower back. I can sort of tuck it in to my shorts just enough to stay put..over a shirt, and it saves me on those hot summer days. It's invisible unless someone comes up behind me :) I'll go through 2 over a 5 hr event I think? Maybe 3.

title: Rugged construction - Britta filter text: This is a nice water bottle. Dont let the soft powdered finish fool you, you can tell just by holding it that its solidly constructed and will withstand some rigorous use. It has a simple but effective mechanism in the lid to open for a quick drink at the push of a button... then just push the lid closed for an airtight seal. This appears to have been designed with use during an exercise routine in mind.

It claims to keep water cold for 24 hours... so I put it to the test. I put cold water, a long with a couple small ice cubes inside and came back the next day. The ice cubes were gone, and the water was "cool" - not quite as cold as the previous day, but still impressive.

It does come with a Britta filter that needs to be replaced periodically. This brings some added peace of mind as Britta is famous for their filtration systems. I'm sure I'll forget to do change it when I'm supposed to, but otherwise, I think this water bottle is going to get a lot of use.

title: Very nice mid-weight gloves text: Pros and cons of the Burton Men's ember fleece glove:

Pros:
* Excellent silicone grip on palm and two fingers
* Works reasonably well with touch screens (car, phone, etc.)
* Very good fit and feel, comfortable glove
* Very light weight, stays warm if you sweat a bit.

Cons:
* Good for say the 20-40 degree (farenheit) range

Burton makes good gloves, and this is one is quite reasonably priced for what it is and does. It is warmer than the gloves that really are almost liners, say two notches above that, the silicone grip is really effective, very easy to hold things, work a steering wheel, etc. Rest of the glove is some sort of fleece, a bit like polartec, maybe heavier than 100, closer to 200 say, but generally warm. Not totally wind proof, but close. Sizing on me (Large) is about what I would expect, tight across the palm (but they loosen up), fingers a bit long (but mine run short), but not too long. I could maybe do without the label on the back of the hand (or at least something smaller), but I suppose that is branding these days. Well worth the money, this is a top brand when you get down to it.

title: No instructions and cheap quality but still functional resistance bands text: I expected more from this resistance band set but for the current price of $17.99 it is just okay. First, this set comes with absolutely no instructions other than what I found on the Amazon site. Second, one of the clips on the resistant band barely opens and when it does it sticks. Third, the foam on the handles does not extend the full length of the handle. Forth, the internal roll on the door anchor easily slips off.

My biggest complaint is the lack of instructions. Nevertheless, I tried each one of these cables. The resistance is too light for me. I eventually combined all the cables onto the handles and that provides the best resistance. In that mode, this is pretty good.

I personally will not use the door anchor as I never like using door knobs or my house framing for exercise equipment. I always feel damage will be done. In fact, I had loosened a door knob once by using that for resistance bands.

The ankle straps are nice and they are comfortable as well due to the thin internal padding. I find it awkward to use resistance bands on the ankles, but others might like this. Once again, I feel the bands will have to be doubled up to get a good resistance.

IN THE PACKAGE
- Nylon Carry Bag with cinch tie for closure
- A door anchor
- Two cushioned handles
- Two Velcro ankle straps with padding
- 5 bands totaling 100 pounds
--> Yellow band = 10 lbs
--> Blue band = 15 lbs
--> Red band = 20 lbs
--> Green band = 25 lbs
--> Black band = 30 lbs

In general, this is an okay set for upper body work. My main disappointment is the lack of instructions as there was no user manual in my set. I know the Amazon site says it comes with that, but mine did not. My second disappointment are sticky clip and about a 1/4 inch of missing foam on the handles.

title: This Is FANTASTIC! I Am So Thankful For This Amazing Chair text: We have had the chance during lockdown to get to do some work on our yard that we have not been able to keep up with in years past. In a far away spot where we have to walk quite a ways, we started working on old grape vines. I was in a lot of pain and going through exhaustion from the stress of the last few weeks, and I needed to lay down. It would have been impossible, but this made it a whole new experience.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a fabulous chair. It comes in a donut type design. It locks with a clip that has an extra button to keep it locked. When you unwind it, you open the end of it and run around the yard or you can use the stiff plastic board tin inflate it. Then you roll up the end and it stays inflated.

DOES IT INFLATE EASILY?
It took me a few times to get the hang of this, but it did inflate pretty well whipping it through the air. I could not seem to get the hang of the plastic paddle though.

IS IT COMFORTABLE?
This is not only comfortable but it is PERFECT. It is just the right shape, and I am VERY sensitive in my back. Nothing ever feels right on me. The way this feels is PERFECT! It even has a raise area for a pillow. It is comfortable and I don't need to put something behind my neck!

IS IT HOT?
The mesh in the center of this keeps it ventilated and I love it.

DOES IT BLOW AWAY?
This has a little stake that you drive through a loop at the end of the chair to keep it in the ground. It works well. We had some pretty intense breezes and it stayed in place well.

DOES IT LEAK?
This lasts about an hour before I had to tighten it up again. I found that every hour or so, if I tightened up the back just a little bit, it was nice and full of air. It takes some practice to get this to seal well.

IS IT HARD TO PUT AWAY?
This is SO EASY to put away when done. You just undo the back, fold it in thirds, and then roll up with the head last and it rolls up like a donut and snaps shut for storage. It fits perfectly in the sack that comes with it.

ANY POCKETS?
There is one pocket on the side of the chair for a magazine, phone, etc.

ANY PATCHES?This came with four patches in case it needs repair.

HOW DID IT PERFORM?
Having this on the lawn to rest in between working hard was a godsend to me. It is so comfortable that it allows me to recover and go back to work. It does not need any other cushions or pillows to use it. I can not tell you how much I appreciated this.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a great way to bring a lounge chair with you, this is a fabulous product. It is not best for high winds or gravel ground, but for grass or sand with very little wind as sand won't accept the stake well, this stays put well. It is a fantastically comfortable chair and I absolutely LOVE it.

MY RATING
This chair gets FIVE STARS from me. I love this and hope it stays inflated well. I have never had anytyhing perform so well and be comfortable at the same time. I love that I don't have to inflate it by blowing in it or using a pump. This is ingenious and I am thrilled with it.

PHOTOS
Photos are disabled at the time of this review, so I could not post photos for you.

title: Perfect for school spirit… perf. gift for college or long after graduation!! text: As most graduate and move on post college they tend to still feel their pride in their alma mater.. especially on game rival day! Never having a way to shut down all the yucky BYU fans that are oversaturated in the area we live in- this hits the mark boldly and perfectly!! Made of a thick polyester with sturdy reinforced edges and solid grommets to string up a flag pole if desired.. it’s truly made to be displayed in a variety of ways.. hung on a balcony, up inside a window, or.. even as a tapestry on a wall- it’s the perfect size 3x5’ for multi uses- and built to withstand both, indoor or outdoor climate!

Ordering in February.. I cannot speak for sun bleaching on the deep red color- I’m sure it may fade bc deep red usually does.. But, it’s something that could possibly be avoided by taking down at night, finding indirect sun exposure or.. just to be anticipated! Bc of its deep coloring- it seems reasonable that it would take quite a bit of time to fade out the deep color! Letting one get their $ worth.

Big and bold print is nicely displayed with infamous Utes “U” logo and accent colors.. easy to read and see from afar. Loving the simplicity to know who/what it represents. Great for a future or current student.. a solid grad gift, or alma mater scenario- Quality from start to finish! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Fabric is thin and feels rough on the outside. Inside is slippery causing legs to hike up text: After reading such fantastic reviews for the Sunday Oasis Women's Tights Highwaist Sports Yoga Workout Gym Running Trouser, I am perplexed. The product post shows them as full-length yoga pants with an attractive silvery sheen, not matte grey capris. The outer seam is messed up on the right leg and it veers towards the front of my leg.

Usually, I wear a size small in bottoms and have some mediums, but they do not fit as baggy as these. The fabric is thin and feel rough on the outside yet silky, smooth inside.

After turning them inside out, I realized I received a factory second, and they were sewn with the outer fabric on the wrong side with white markings on the material of both legs. Vine reviewers usually receive the very best a manufacturer has to offer and this is the first time I have received a factory second. I am so diappointed.

Sadly, I have to review what I received and not what I thought they would be. I must say that I love the look of the silvery fabric on the inside though.

title: For glass not plastic goggles
text: After reading all the positive reviews, I decided to give this stuff a go.  I use both swim goggles and a scuba mask.  It worked great on the scuba mask, which is glass.  However, it didn't work at all on my plastic swim goggles which, by the way, were brand new.  The problems were: 1) Most swim goggles warn against rubbing the inside of the goggle or you lose the manufacturer's anti-fog coating.  Since I haven't mastered the art of telekinesis and I wasn't about to use my tongue as I otherwise would with spit, I had to use my finger (maybe a q-tip would have worked); and 2) if you rinse it lightly per the instructions, it works a bit better but, as other reviewers have commented, you'll burn the baby cheeses out of your eyeballs.  I've probably now ruined the anti-fog coating on my new goggles and will be returning to the old fashioned method - spit - which is free.  I'll continue to use it on my scuba mask though.

title: Decent but has some issues text: Decent bench but does come with some issues.

Pros- Moves around (on hard floors) easily so you can move it to new workout position in the room. Good black paint job and looks nice, Great weight storage, adjustable slots, curl bar and leg lift apparatus is good. Relatively solid look and feel (minus the bench)

Cons - The bench is wobbly which is incredibly distracting and very frustrating. I have shoved wood shims into the bench shaft and that has helped but I cannot adjust the seat forward or backward with the wood shims in place. Seat attaching to adjustable shaft is also wobbly so both wobbles combined is frustrating and distracting. The bench is not detachable so when doing flat fly's you sometimes hit the barbell rack. Finally the seat does not adjust and pivot up far enough to do some of the exercises. It only adjust flat, medium and a little above medium.

In the main pocket, I'd guess you could fit 3, maybe 4 paddles. Definitely at least 2 without any issues. Also Inside the main pocket, there is a fence hook, which is a nice touch.

In the "middle" pocket (in between the larger accessory pocket and the main pocket, there is room for some balls + more (I'm thinking grip tape, lead tape, etc.). The zippers on all the pockets feel like your average zippers and I would assume they'd hold up well over time.

While this is definitely on the pricier side of pickleball backpacks, I do find it to be pretty nice. Definitely has enough room for all your stuff and feels like a quality bag. I'm expecting this to hold up for a while. Overall, I like it!

title: Great lightweight backpack for simple items; it’s water resistant text: This backpack is a bit unexpected in its design. It folds into the interior pocket. Therefore, the pouch that it came in is actually the inside pocket of the central compartment. All I had to do was unzip the pouch and unfold the backpack from within that pouch. I then had to pull the pouch inside out so that it formed an interior zippered pocket and tuck the loop inside.

I think that the design is really neat. I was able to fit a couple of pounds of mandarins inside along with my wallet and a few other incidentals. I walked around with this a little bit and found it to be comfortable as long as I cinched the shoulder straps tighter. There is no padding in the straps, so walking more than one mile would most likely get uncomfortable. The material reminds me of the baggalini-type bags made of a strong nylon. However, this backpack is thin, so I do feel anything with sharp edges would tear through this after prolonged use. The material is water resistant. I actually put part of the pack under running water and the water just rolled right off.

There are two mesh water bottle pockets on each side and they fit my standard-sized water bottles just fine. There is also an exterior outside pocket. The tiny reflective strips at the edges of the outside pocket are a nice safety touch; however, the strips they put on the top interior of the water bottle pockets are useless unless those pockets remain empty. Someone did not think out that design.

Overall, for the current price of $15.99 plus 5% off with a coupon savings, I feel this is a very good deal. It packs small and light and is perfect to carry around for when an extra backpack is needed. This 20 (or 22L - depending on which part of the Amazon ad one reads) size is like a full-sized backpack without any cushioning. I would not put a laptop in here unless it is protected with a padded sleeve or otterbox type case.

title: Enjoy Your Workout text: Working out can involve many different types of equipment. I tend to prefer the workouts that need as little equipment as possible and jumping rope is a good way to workout using something that is simple and can be taken and used most anywhere. A good choice for your next jump rope workout is TINEMET Weighted Jump Rope.

Weighing more than the typical jump rope, this heavier rope is not really a rope at all, and that is good because it can’t get tangled like an actual rope. It’s also easier to jump over than a traditional jump rope so you are less likely to trip while you use it. The cable glides across the floor with ease, in contrast to an actual rope which can sometimes cause friction when it touches the floor.

There is more weight with this jump rope and you will notice it in the handles, which include a weight in each. If you like, you can unscrew the ends of the handles and remove the weights. I think it’s best to leave them in place, since the added weight can improve a workout. Besides, they are quite light and are certainly not heavy enough to make jumping rope uncomfortable. Another cool feature is that you can pull the rope through the handles and trim it down to size. This is great because it means that shorter individuals can adjust it to fit their needs.

Jumping rope is a good activity to add to any workout. This TINEMET Weighted Jump Rope is a handy addition to your exercise needs. It glides and turns easily and the adjustable feature makes it usable by just about anyone. It’s a good gift idea for the exercise fans among your family and friends.

title: Amazing for beginners and kids too!
text: I have chronic thoracic pain and purchased this for stretching out my mid and upper back. It arrived in perfect condition. With no prior yoga experience I looked up a few yoga wheel YouTube videos. I hopped on and while my back felt tight, it felt amazing to have something stretch out in such an isolated way this hard to reach spot. In the same session I was doing strength exercises and even did an assisted headstand! When my three kids came home from school (ages 3, 6, 8) they too were all having a blast with this simple fun tool. My eight year old was doing head stands, my six year old was doing backbend kick overs, and my three year old was rolling her spine as well as pikes! This wheel was such great quality at such an accessible price point. So grateful to have it in my home for daily use!

title: Flashlight Geek's Dream text: I was highly impressed with this flashlight. It is a nice, clean design, and the adjustable tripod allows you to put the light right where you need it, especially in tight places such as in the interior of a computer. The rear switch is perfect for carrying the light in your fist and working with your thumb. A real plus: it has flat sides so when you put it down it does not roll away!

The light itself is very bright (I almost want to advise "Do not look into light with remaining eyeball"), especially on the highest setting. You can adjust the aperture for a wide or a narrow beam. We have inadequate lighting in our back yard, which extends back at least 15 yards (probably more), and using this flashlight in almost total darkness I could see the details of the trees and back fence while walking our dog.

USB charging is very convenient, since it is now such a universal technology. When plugged in to charge, the unit glows blue until done, so it's very easy to know when its finished. This is an excellent piece of equipment for use in an emergency kit or just for plain everyday use.

Downsides: the rear cover over the charging port and the switch seem flimsy, and there's no way to change out the battery that I can find (nor is it mentioned in the manual). However, I would still highly recommend this product.

title: Tough, fire-resistant cord text: This is a particular kind of cord for particular uses. I needed it for a high-heat application, the cord had to resist temperatures of about 400F and retain its strength. This will certainly do that.

Some notes, though - this is Kevlar, so it frays at the ends. To seal it, you'll want to use an epoxy or the equivalent, you cannot melt the strands together, they just glow or turn to ash. This cord is fairly abrasive compared to many other synthetics, so if it is going to be in rubbing up against other materials (or skin) damage may result. It also doesn't seem to hold knots quite as well as I'm used to, but that may be technique.

Anyway, it worked for my purposes, so if you specifically need the characteristics of Kevlar, this is a good way to go, the quality of the product seems to be quite good. Otherwise, I'd go with a different material.

title: Wow, much better than ice! text: We spend a lot of time in the car and always have a cooler packed with drinks and snacks. Needless to say, this got my attention. So I ordered this set and am very happy with them.

First I went to fill one up as a test. Maybe I should have measured the amount of water I put in but I guessed. When I fill the second and third ones, I will measure the amount of water going in.

These are a large size and will require a decent size cooler.

My first test was put in the freezer for 48 hours. Next, I put it my new soft-sided cooler, in the house, at room temperature with nothing else inside. I shut the cooler and left it alone for 24 hours. After 24 hours this frozen pack was still about 90% solid. I was impressed. I closed the cooler and left it for another 24-hour test. After 48 hours it was getting pretty soft, yet was still doing a good job of staying cold.

My frequent car trips last 10-12 hours and these will definitely keep my drinks and snacks cold for those trips. I am certain that if I used two of these and had my cooler filled that things would stay cold for days.

I am impressed with these and highly recommend them. Give them a try, I think you will like them too.

title: It's held up to my abuse, champ of a reel text: Got the size 5000 reel from a bait and tackle over a year ago and I have to say this reel has really held up to my saltwater abuse. It's a beautiful slick looking reel and even after a year of saltwater use it still works silky smooth. Be careful not to lose the dust cap that connects to the handle because I lost it on the jetty and never saw it again. Reel is still well sealed despite that.
The reel takes braid straight to the spool, casts like a charm especially when spooled with braid and a nice graphite surfcaster. It's hefty enough to balance out a 10ft ugly still bigwater but light enough to cast artificials with a 10ft tsunami airwave if you plan to be on the water casting all day. The conflict II is now the lightest reel penn makes, and it uses machined gears instead of cast gears, but it does cost about $70 more than this original conflict.

I have nothing but good things to say about this reel, it's reliable without breaking the bank and doesn't have failures or shortcomings like some of the cheaper Penn reels

title: Hurts my tush. Had to remove. text: I've been wanting a Brooks saddle for a few years now and was excited when I was given a chance to try this non-leather variant (though leather would've been much preferred, yet beggars can't be choosers). I measured my sit bones and, according to my home tests and several online charts, the C17 should be right in my ballpark.

I put it on my Trek 7.1 hybrid bike. I bike about two to three times a week during the warmer months here in Chicago and used to have a comfort seat that eventually I found much too large for when I like to ride hard and fast.
I didn't know what made the C17 different from the B17 at first, but after a wee bit of research I read that, because it's made of rubber, the C17 is easier to "break in" compared to other Brooks saddles.

That being said, I found this to be much more *uncomfortable* than the stock seat my Trek 7.1 came with. After about two weeks' worth of riding, I found absolutely no comfort on my rear whatsoever. I could feel the seat's metal posts bearing roughly into my rear, and the breaking-in period nearly was non-existent. I'm not sure whether this is the case for all Brooks saddles or this one (or even if I've received a singularly errant model), but the seat really provides zero comfort for me.

I like to (shamefully) boast that I have a modest tush. My rear doth extend toward the upper edge, many thanks to the number of squats I do per week. And so I feel I have an appropriately muscled bottom. But as I've never asked experts I cannot fully commit to those claims, but still I feel that the Brooks saddle causes me more discomfort than another. I've since been using a Selle saddle that costs about half the price and is far more comfortable.
