title: Excellent Emergency Source for Vegetables With No Added Ingredients text: Where I live it is important to have back up food sources. Sometimes we get severe weather and that can mean an inability to go to the grocery store, no electricity, or sometimes snowed in for a while. I always try to have some different foods on hand that are easy to fix for such times as that, but one thing I have not had is vegetables for long term storage, should we have to go through an extended time of roughing it.

WHAT IS THIS COLLECTION LIKE?
WHAT SIZE BUCKET?
First of all, it comes in a four gallon sized bucket which is square. That means it will fit on the shelf more easily and be easier to stack. This baby was SEALED tight. It has a tab that you pull which starts a plastic strip coming off from around the entire rim of the bucket. The size is 13 1/2 inches high and 10 inches square.

HOW WAS THIS BUCKET TO OPEN?
I have to say that this bucket was VERY difficult to open. If you are older, or have a weak grip, this might be very difficult to open- especially in an emergency. Of course, being hungry might motivate you enough to push through, but honestly, I am pretty strong and this particular bucket was so hard to open I had to get pliers and then pull with all of my might many times to work it off of the bucket.

WHAT IS THE BUCKET LIKE INSIDE?
Inside the rim is a rubberized seal. I would assume that the way this was sealed that it would withstand reasonable water around it- perhaps not for a really long time, but enough to keep the contents dry for a bit should you need to be in the rain or have a flood in your storage area. There is a little crunched up bunch of powder inside which I am thinking was at one time a moisture control tab, but I can not say for sure.

There is a bit more space in the bucket so that you could keep other freeze dried pouches in here, or perhaps plastic dishes or other things you want to put in with it for saving space, such as vacuum sealed spices, or other mixes you might have accumulated or made. It is important that they are sealed, however as you don't want to have bugs get into the bucket over time from just loosely bagged foods. Also I would avoid grains in a bucket like this as they can still hatch bugs which will eat through vacuum sealed bags- ask me how I know..

WHAT IS IN THE BUCKET?
This is where I was a bit disappointed. The outside clearly lists what is in the bucket, but for the price, I expected to have a little better quality than this. There are metallic bags in this bucket most of which are vacuum sealed. Two of them are not, however. One of them is onions, but the other was not even labeled. It turned out to be potatoes, but there was not anything on the bag at all to indicate that it was potatoes. I would have thought that it would be labeled and vacuum sealed for the onions and potatoes. Perhaps there is a reason why they are not.

HOW PRACTICAL IS THIS KIT?
This kit has 109 servings in it. That is a lot, but the problem is that each package of vegetables is the entire contents of the bucket. For instance, it might have 15 servings of peas in one pouch, but let's say you do not want to have peas all of the time. Perhaps you have a quick emergency for a few days and then it is over. The problem is that once you open the bag of peas, the shelf life goes down quickly.

So, once you open a bag, you have to finish it in a reasonable amount of time and keep ti sealed in a jar perhaps for longer storage. It will NOT last 20 years as advertised however once opened.

HOW IS THIS KIT BEST USED?
This kit is best used as a 1 week supply for food. A few weeks at best. That means if you buy this kit, then you will have to plan on using what is inside all at once- at least each vegetable that you open. That means you should buy multiple packs if you want to have a long term storage that you can rely on over an extended period.

DRAWBACKS
I would have liked to see the pouches broken down in thirds or even halves. That way if you open one, you still have another for future use, up to 20 years. I also was not sure why the potatoes and onions were not vacuum sealed and why the potatoes are not labeled. They are a part of the kit, so they should have been labeled like the rest of the bags in the bucket.

QUALITY
The vegetables tasted good- they are freeze dried which means that you can eat them as a crunchy snack food without breaking your teeth as you would with dehydrated food. You can also cook with them, but honestly they were so good as snacks that is how we enjoyed them. It is important that you drink plenty of water when eating freeze dried foods, however. We would always have them right out of the bag at our house which is the best way to have the most nutrients.

I love that this has no added sugar or other ingredients like most "survival" food does. It is just vegetables and that fits our family perfectly as we do not eat sugar or highly processed foods.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although the bucket is very difficult to get into (at least this one was), the food inside is well protected from weather and elements. The food is sealed in large bags of each type, so you need to use up what you open in a reasonable amount of time. Not all of the bags were vacuum sealed and one was not marked, so I give this four stars for that.

As for the purchase and having it handy, it is an excellent kit to have on hand, especially if you live in an area that is prone to severe weather. I would reiterate that it would be best to have a collection of these handy as this one will only feed a small family for a short period of time.

I will update with more information should I have anything else to report in the future.

title: Least favorite Wise Owl purchase. Thin cheap cover. text: Avid camper and climber here - I've been exploring Wise Owl's products after receiving an awesome hammock as a gift last year. It feels incredibly cheap for being a $25 pillow and does not feel durable at all. The stuff sack it comes in is great but also feels flimsy. It's nice that you can remove the cover, but it's so thin and cheap and the stitching looks like it will wear out fast.

I love packable gear but I don't want something that I'll have to worry about being "gentle" with after a long day of climbing with my raggedy hands.

On a positive note, the size and amount of stuffing seemed appropriate but definitely doesn't outweigh the negatives.

title: Great cleaning kit & includes a hydration bag & nice bite valve. text: For the price this is a cleaning kit with a free hydration bag. The cleaning kit is very complete, it has a brush on a long spring that is stiff but flexible for scrubbing the hose, a large brush with handle for cleaning the bag & a smaller brush for the mouth piece & bite valve. It also comes with an expandable hanger that holds the bag open for drying.
The kit is complete & works well. There is really no other way to get the hose clear without the long, spring brush. I cleaned out one of my other bags with the kit & the results were satisfying if disgusting.
The included water bag is made of thick material which I like. The fill opening is large & internal threaded like most of the newer ones I have used. The large opening is easier to fill but hard to get full without spilling. The cap threads tightly & seals well but the strap attaching the cap is very short & pulls out every time I use it.
The hose has a nice quick disconnect on the bag end & a pressure fit on the bite valve end. The bite valve is the larger sort (I prefer the smaller, flat valves) which flows well & it has a pull-on switch & a cap.

title: nice concept but somewhat awkard in practice. text: The Apollo Walker Camping Chairs Folding Portable Beach Chairs are quite durable. The nylon fabric on this chair is quite thick when compared to the cheaper chairs that I purchased to use at my kids' sports events. The main chair has a reclining feature and the foot stool/chair is made just as well.

The concept for this chair is that you can lean back and put your feet up on the foot stool. When necessary, the stool can be used as a separate chair. They do work as intended as you can see from the pictures, what you see is what you get.

What you can't tell from the pictures is that because of the thicker nylon and the fact that there are two chairs, this is a fairly heavy product. The chairs are joined together with a clamping system, which means they aren't as easy to separate as a system that can clip the two together. Also because of the two chairs, they are awkward to fold together and compress small enough to fit back into the bag easily.

So the concept is quite good but when actually using it, you'll find that these chairs do require a little more work and have to deal with the extra weight... that's on top of all the other stuff you're already carrying when you go to sports events or picnics.

title: We LOVE this Pedometer! text: My wife and I are "seasoned citizens" who just got back into a workout program at the local YMCA. To keep our motivation at the highest level, I thought it would be a good idea to be able to chart our progress on a regular basis -- enter two pedometers! We are also able to post our daily results online by way of a major drug store chain, so that helps with motivation as well!

Now to the pedometer:
1. to us, it is excellent in every way. It keeps track of your daily steps, it resets itself to zero at midnight, and it saves seven days' worth of results for your review;
2. it clips to your belt or pants very securely thanks to the clip into which the pedometer fits. So far we have found no need to attach the small strap that comes with the pedometer;
3. although the pedometer is "always on" once you insert the battery, that does not seem to be a problem; it takes the CR2032 battery readily available in stores;
4. the numbers are easy to read if you have "older" eyes;
5. the pedometer is a little longer than 2" -- not large at all, just the right size;
6. the pedometer keeps track of routine walking AND specific aerobic movement, such as walking on a treadmill; the total number includes the aerobic steps, but the aerobic steps are shown separately -- a nice feature.

We are very glad we have our pedometers. I think you will be very happy with this investment in your health and well-being!

text: I normally dont buy emergency meals like this, even on sale they are pricy. But I decided to buy it on a whim. I usually have very good experience with buying basic packets of pasta dishes. Some I have just let sit on my shelves for several years, and then when I made it it tastes fine. Some have had reduced flavor, but still edible. Then I have done some where I repackaged in mylar (no special preparation), and that boosted the freshness. So more or less this is reason why i have avoided the emergency containers. But, I have been adding various ingredients to my long term storage, and have been buying when on sale. This was on sale, and so I just decided to add one container on a whim. I like that it contains a few mylar pouches as opposed to opening the canister and it just being an open container of a pasta meal. For that, I really found it worth buying.

title: Regular quality golf ball with a unique twist! Perfect for night golf activity..!! text: One of those “what will they think of next” type items! Totally fun and unnecessary.. and why not! Living on 7th hole of a golf course.. I’ll let you in on a secret, shsss.. My teens/college kids grew up here- and love to play around on the groomed grounds after dark- usually a lot of silly cart-wheeling and ball hunting! Yep, it’s a real thing!! Ball collecting only to hit them frivolously off into to the darkness.. all bc, they cant see where they went to get them back! Troublemakers- I know! But, a bit of harmless fun they’ve grown up perfecting.. Only now, I’ve found a way to let them play with more of a purpose! GaMe On!! As we’re really about find out who truly has the better shot! (Before its all judged on a “feeling”..as you can tell they take their game very serious!)

Hits like a golf ball, nothing wobbly or lopsided. Without activation it looks/feels in texture, weight, feel and sight just as a golfball should. One wouldn’t know these had magic powers.. something I do wish was marked by word or symbol, bc it’s too easy to mix up with regular balls- I’d hate to misplace or lose bc of this. *can easily mark with permanent marker to avoid losing- I highly suggest doing so! Fun unknowing surprise.. just be sure to reserve time on course at dawn/dusk to have glow be in full effect- Either that or come over for “night games” at our house!!

Great option for those who have back yard putting green.. or even golf gadgets/mobile units one sets up to practice form and such in the in/outdoors of home- ball is easy to find if rolled into bush or under furniture. Great idea to use at the local putt-putt golf galleria.. we usually do those at night time to avoid the heat! Glow lasted well over 5min. bright enough to glow ground around it.. see photos above. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.. “four!”

title: Good Quality Pullover
text: First of all, I wouldn't call this a jacket. In my opinion, it's a pullover. I think of jackets as being something that's full zip, not quarter zip. As far as athletic pullovers go, this is pretty good. It's mid-weight and will provide adequate warmth in the fall/spring, possibly even enough for mild winters in the south. The outer material is a polyester waffle weave type fabric. The inside is a soft fleece material. The zippers are heavy grade and zip well. The chest pocket is the only pocket on the garment. It is not large enough to accommodate most cellphones. The Tennessee logo is made of cloth and is embroidered onto the pullover. My husband is 6'2" and weighs about 195 pounds. He wears mediums and larges in shirts. This fits him fine with a little bit of room so he could wear a layer underneath. The sleeve length is fine, too. His does not have the large manufacturer "C" on the lower left front, but there is a smaller "Crable" tag on the back of the collar.

title: Not ugly black tire look.. Pilates ball included! Best $ ever!! text: SOO PRETTY!! Pearlescent sapphire blue is awesome… And yes I’m talking about a yoga ball!!? I love it’s not “the ugly black spare tire look that accidentally got left out in the living room..!!

The ridged ball serves a purpose which is something some don’t know! This has “small ridges” (a few inches apart) that circumference the ball. These help keep a person in place when using (sort of like tread on a tire but, it’s not grabby!) I see this very beneficial for any who may need a little extra help ie. hindered with Injury, pregnant, elderly or, just need or lack natural balance..

Although supplied with a foot pump- be prepared for this to take a lot of effort/time to inflate- the better part of an hour.. This has a thick outer surface to keep it from puncture or bursting- which is nice to give user peace of mind (it just has to inflate a lot!) *This has an internal air bladder in case exterior puncture takes place.. made to “break ones fall“ to the ground and let you down slower so to speak. Slower = 1.1 sec to deflate so it breaks up the impact if popped vs. hitting ground hard!! (trust me, it still can scare you but, 1.1 sec. makes all the difference!) **Bc of time to fill- we used an electric pump to make quicker work of the task in total 20min.. Those younger with more muscle may not find this as tedious. *Just note: this IS compatible with an electric pump and definitely worth getting it out for the job!!

Bonus: includes Pilates ball! I am not skilled how to use 100%.. but, I found a few stretches this helps s much with and YouTube videos are perfect to show “how too” used properly..!!

Overall, this is a solid yoga ball- it has the look/feel of quality and built in safety, Im impressed. Sold at $15- with the extra Pilates ball.. is the best price I’ve seen for the quality and aesthetics! Hoping this info can help your decision- Stay healthy.. stay safe!

title: securely packaged, loads of calories, high versatile food staple, soak & cook, directions inc text: Lid is on tightly and securely as expected. I buy from Augason Farms when on sale, and slowly build up my stock. Even when not on sale, I tend to find that this company often has the best prices. I normally dont have any issues with regular bags of beans just left in a storage cupboard, but I wanted to start adding in some emergency packaged supplies. Kind of a buy it and forget it. More as insurance than anything. Yet sometimes I find stuff from Augason that is less expensive than a similar product that isnt packaged for long term storage. I wouldnt say this fell into that category, but really close to it (when on sale).

I like black beans (and lentils) because they are incredible versatile and can really bulk up a meal, and can easily be a meat (like beef crumbles) replacement if need be. Or can be swapped in a little to help reduce the cost of a meat based meal. I recommend experimenting with cooking with foods you plan to store so it isnt a complete mystery on what to do with it once the need arises. At the very least, get a few good solid easy recipes down, and then figure out ways to get creative. Definitely learn to make a loaf, burger, balls with beans (or lentils). Will definitely give a satisfying mouth feel if used to eating meat.

If you think you will be eating a lot of beans in the future, might want to add it in on a regular basis now to let the body get used to beans (gas, cramps, etc from sudden increase in bean consumption)

Plain, uncooked beans will need to be soaked and/or cooked for a long period of time to become soft and edible. The same as buying a bag of dry beans at the store.

I may be a little more picky on my food source and country of origin etc when buying my day to day foods, but when it comes to emergency supplies, I am more concerned with simply having something to fill my gut. I am paying for calories, plain and simple. I am paying for a variety of calories. I am paying for calories that I can rely on (ie well packaged). I have no problem with Augason Farms products, and am happy to be adding to my reserves.

title: Love this stuff!
text: This stuff is amazing! I've used it for many year, and for many different purposes. It dissolves hard to clean substances like glues, grease, paints and inks. I've even used it successfully to repel spiders from my letterbox. And it smells great. (Not that you should sniff it too closely: it will make you sneeze and your eyes water.) I keep some in a couple of small 3 ounce spray bottles. It's great for recycling glass jars and other containers. To remove the labels, you can soak them in water, peel off the other layers, then spray them liberally with orange oil. Let it sink in for a few minutes and then scrub off under water with a suitable scrubber (e.g. stainless steel for glass, nylon for plastics).

title: EXACTLY What I Was Looking For When Talking Long Rural Walks text: One of the most frustrating things for me is if I want to go for a long walk in a rural area and I have to have a phone near by. I prefer to walk without a phone and such, but at times I can not escape the need to have a phone for an important phone call. I really don't like a fanny pack, as it is really big, but was looking for something handier.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This stash belt is very thin. It is deceiving, however. The belt itself is a good quality stretchy elastic. It is heavy duty but not so heavy that it is bulky. There is a black clip in the back, and a slide to make the belt longer or shorter. The pack itself is 2 inches by 9 inches. However, it has a pleat in the top and bottom which make it bigger.

There is a water resistant lining in the pack, a front zipper, and a very thin reflective strip on the front. At full length, the belt measures 34 inches unstretched, and 41 inches stretched. The shortest is 24 inches stretching to about 32 inches.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
When using this, I can put my smart phone into the pack, a set of keys and a few cards. I can also stick in a tissue or two folded small. A huge set of keys will make it a bit tight, but a reasonable ring of keys with several keys on it should be fine. The pack does stretch a little bit so that things will fit.

As far as use, I found that this is very handy. I have to stretch it a little tight so that it does not bobble around as I walk. That is okay though, because it holds it in place. Otherwise, the phone and things can make it sag a little bit. Finding the right tightness takes a bit of trial and error. I really appreciate having this as it makes it the closet to walking without anything that I have been able to get.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I really like this stash belt. It is handy, useful, and makes it so that I can go for long walks without bulky bags or packs. Safe and with decent capacity, I can carry what I want to have with me yet feel free and lightweight at the same time. With a range of sizes it will fit, many people would benefit from this, but if you are a big and tall man, it might be a bit tight.

RATING
Five stars for this. I really like it. It is handy and easy to use. I will update if I have anything else important to add in the future.

title: Great value for a complete kit. text: I ordered the 'Viper Defender Backboard & Sisal/Bristle Steel Tip Dartboard Bundle' for review some time ago and would like to share my thoughts.

I hadn't played darts since I was a kid and had been looking to get back into it, so this kit looked like it would be perfect. When I received it I have to say that initially I was very impressed by everything that it came with and the quality of those items. The Dartboard itself is a better quality board than any that I used as a kid at home and even better than any I had used publicly. This kit would make a great gift to anyone wanting to get back into the game of darts or anyone wanting to even up their game of darts.

Now with all that said, I am not familiar with other brands of darts or boards but in my opinion this seems to be of great quality to me. It has everything you need to get started. Everything included is well made. It's easy to set up and hang, and the darts beat out the cheap plastic steel tip darts I used to play with back in the day. Overall I am impressed with this kit and have enjoyed it now for several months with zero issues. I hope that this was helpful.

title: Caution bike hold down will loosen and allow bike to fall!! text: At first I thought this was a very sturdy bike rack and still do. But it has failed twice and if it wasn't for the included safety strap my electric bike would have hit the pavement at 55 mph. The padded hook hold down bar came loose from vibration and allowed the bike to come free of the hold down allowing the bike to fall away from the rack, but I had the safety strap around the top bar on the bike and around the frame of the bike rack keeping the bike from hitting the pavement. The bike did fall away from the bike rack at a 45 degree angle. Imagine my surprise.
The problem is, no matter how tight I tighten the nut on the hook it still loosens. I would like to be contacted with a solution to resolve this problem. Other than this problem it seems to be a good bike rack. If you buy this please use the safety strap provided and place the strap over the hook to keep downward force on the hook. I'm trying to find a second safety strap before I use it again.

title: VERY Hard Time Finding Chairs I Can Sit In- This One FANTASTIC! text: WARNING- IN DEPTH REVIEW. If you prefer a brief summary, see section marked THE BOTTOM LINE
---------------------------
I have a lot of issues with my back. Quite some time ago, I was in a few car accidents (all someone else hitting my car) and I have a really difficult time finding chairs I can sit in without pain and frustration. I almost didn't get this chair due to some frustrated reviews, but I am SO glad I did.

HOW THIS COMES
This chair comes all in parts in a really nice compact case that zips shut.

HOW TO ASSEMBLE
-First you just snap the shock corded poles into place. You will have a chair frame.

-Second you put the top of the chair back onto the upper poles and ease them on together. It is a tight fit, but take your time. It is worth it.

-Third, lay the chair on its side with the back in place on the frame, and then put on the lowest bottom of the chair into the pole. Press your body weight slightly on the upper pole facing you until it fits into the pocket on the lower end that remains.

TIME TO ASSEMBLE?
This took me literally 5 minutes.

COMFORT?
This chair is absolutely wonderful. The angle that it is takes the weight off of the tail bone and allows the back to be cradled with support, but not too much that it hurts. It also has the perfect height for my legs.

NECK PILLOW
Even the neck pillow is perfect. It hits my neck like a neck roll and helps me to stay comfortable when I want to put my head back for a bit.

CAN HOLDER AND POCKET
There is a detachable can holder that clips on one side. There is a pocket where I put glasses or a book on the other side. It is big enough for a tablet.

MY SIZE
I am about 5'7" tall and am a size 16 misses US. This chair is perfect for me. It is not too tight or upright.

GETTING OUT OF THE CHAIR
The interesting part of this chair is that although it does not have arms on it, this chair is taut enough that I can easily press on the sides and get right out of the chair without a struggle.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This chair is FANTASTIC. It is easy to put together (if you follow my instructions), comfortable and the perfect height (17 inches at the front lip) from the ground.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I have another chair similar to this which everyone in the family loves. I was hoping for another and this is it. I am really thankful for this chair.

title: Simply amazing text: I had no idea that an 80/20 poly to nylon blend could be so absorbent. This 'towel' works out of the shower, and is light and compact enough at less than five and a half ounces and folded to a scant 7x5 inches to be negligible in a backpack. I am currently carrying mine with me in a gig bag for hot, sweaty performances.

There are a few things that I truly like. One is the zipper pattern stitching around the entire towel. That seam reinforces the towel. The other is mine has already gone through two wash cycles without any issues. I had initial concerns about durability due to the thinness of this towel, but those have been assuaged. It holds up in actual use.

What I love most, though, is how soft this is. The hanging hook is a nice feature, but frankly I do not use it. And the bleed free feature is moot since the towel I have is gray. I toss it in with colors and have not noticed any issue there. It has not faded one iota, so I am guessing that the no-bleed claim is valid.

Basically, this is best for folks who camp or want a compact and lightweight towel that actually absorbs. For home I use a regular towel because weight and size are not issues. For my gig bag this is perfect.

title: We laughed about ordering an "oversized" chair, but we laugh no longer text: This chair is COMFORTABLE. My partner and I laughed about ordering these oversized camping chairs but once they're set up alongside regular camping chairs everyone fights to use them. You can really slouch and get cozy in this chair. You don't have to sit in it in a traditional sense, throw a leg over an arm, recline way back diagonally, you've got the space to! These things are beefy, they can support you in any position without flexing or making you fear they're about to collapse. It's like having a camping recliner, you can sit in multiple positions and don't feel constricted like in most camping chairs. These are TOUGH chairs, we've been using them for years now and they still look like new!

The cooler in the arm rest is genius, every chair should have this. Most of the time we don't even use it to keep our beverages cold, we just use it as storage since it has a convenient zipper top and deep cavity. Holds anything you need while camping, fishing, or watching the game. When you're done it all packs up in it's travel sleeve that is the same size as any camping chair. Perfectly light and transportable, these chairs go with us everywhere and boy do we love them!

title: Amazingly light! soft + airy- thinner than expected. Torn between 4-5* text: Surprised at how soft and inviting this is- does NOT feel like a sleeping bag.. this has more of an airy silky feel and feels amazing against the skin- total comfort 5*. You won’t believe how lightweight either, not even as heavy as a Coke can- it gets another 5*..!! I had no issue folding down and getting blanket back into its sleeve and that was done on first attempt- 5* for packing. (trick is expelling the excess air prior to inserting!)

Ordered in the rocky mtn. print.. it seemed a little less detailed than expected- but, comparing side-by-side to photo.. it’s just bc of large size photo- best viewed laid out flat I’d give it 4*. Overall size is more than adequate for x2 to either picnic or lay sleeping bags on. Ample room to totally engulf x1 adult with ease.. 5* for all size aspects..

Surpassing all of the above expectations- I was surprised in amount of fill.. it was less than expected, especially if to bring added cushion and comfort for sleeping upon. I find this has solid quality, craftsmanship and all attention to detail to be sturdy + withstand wear/tear. Just know.. this won’t be a surplus of cushion on lumpy ground- unless it’s doubled over and used by a single person.. this I’d rate 3.5* for amount of fill or, lack of. Having said that- I do understand the reasoning to why it has the amount it does. So to be fair it was more of my own missed expectation.

This has merit for giftability use- its one that will be around for a long time.. greater for campers, hikers, outdoor enthusiast, etc.. Definitely a higher price point… You’re paying for its on the go abilities. Along with quality materials and craftsmanship used. Not so much a dense or full bottom layer. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Don't count on solar to operate, it doesn't charge. text: With hurricane season here, I had high hopes for this solar-powered fan, but if you need to rely on solar power to charge the battery, and operate, you will be disappointed.

I've been using it to add ventilation to my outdoor garden greenhouse. I thought it would be perfect and thought it would self-power using the sun. It doesn't.

It's been cloudy outside, but there is plenty of light to charge the battery within a reasonable amount of time. After four hours, the fan ran for less than five seconds. It also won't run as it is charging.

That pretty much defeats the purpose of having a solar-powered fan when electricity isn't readily available.

Also, the hook doesn't allow for many hanging options or fan positions.

title: Perfect For Picnics in the Mountains text: I live in an area about equidistant from the beach and the mountains. I like going to the beach but I much prefer the mountains, particularly in the autumn when the leaves change. One of the simple pleasures in life is having a picnic in the mountains, and this particular beach blanket is a good accessory for those trips.

This is not a blanket in the traditional sense. There is no padding, no fiber, no fringe. This is a very thin cover made of parachute nylon and it is very lightweight and thin. It will not provide any insulation from hard ground, nor will it provide much in the way of drying off after getting wet, but it is very water resistant and it will keep you from getting wet from wet ground unless you put it down on standing water.

Because this is such a lightweight blanket it means that it can be caught up with a good gust of wind. Provision has been made for that. There are pockets on the corners and they can be filled with sand at the beach or with stones when farther away. There are also loops on the corners for securing with pegs. Unfortunately there are no pegs included with this blanket and that is the one thing I would suggest for improvement.

I have a special use for this blanket. Along the Blue Ridge parkway there are picnic areas and my family and I like to go there for a nice picnic lunch. The blanket makes a perfect (although very large) tablecloth for the picnic table. When we’re done, it is very easy to clean and it packs up for the next trip with little effort.

I love the fact that this blanket compacts down to a size smaller than a football. It folds up very neatly and compactly and it fits in a pretty blue nylon bag with a pull tie. At that size it is small enough to fit in a shoulder bag or in just about any space in the car when traveling.

This is a very well-made blanket, too. I have found no issues with the stitching, the seams are straight and there are no nicks or cuts in the nylon material. I imagine that will change over years of use, but so far it still is pristine.

I am very happy with this beach blanket. It serves me well on picnics in the mountains, which is really all I could ask for. It is made well, it’s plenty large, and there are some thoughtful features that went into it.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Great size for a family of 5 text: My husband has the Osprey 22 daypack, which we have used a lot and love, but it isn’t quite big enough for our family of 5. In the 22, we could fit a light jacket for both of us and our three little kids, a water bottle for each of us, a couple granola bars and our phones. It was packed to the brim, bulging, and had to be packed and repacked strategically to get it all in there.
This 34 is the perfect size to be able to fit all of the stuff previously mentioned, but also give us extra room for additional snacks, cold weather or rain gear, or extra water. It still feels very manageable on my back and not overly heavy (especially after trading a kid carrier backpack for this one!!). The quality is great and the material is durable. The adjustable straps are also awesome for fitting the pack comfortably to my 5’7” frame. The only thing to mention is I do prefer the zip top entry of the 22 to this top flap, but it is not a deal breaker for me.
I had a very similar Osprey for day hikes that I purchased 15 years ago and that one is still in great condition after hiking national parks and local trails. I expect this one will last the next 15 plus years with no problem!

title: Better than the Average Lighting Kit text: There are a number of lighting kits available for biking. Most of the ones I have used and seen have included a tail light and sometimes a headlight, and these lights are somewhat limited in the functions they have. This kit is a little more capable than most. It still has just two lights – a headlight and a tail light – but these lights are more advanced than most and they also come with a harness for mounting the headlight on a helmet.

I’ll talk about each component separately.

The headlight is the most impressive component in the whole kit. It is a rechargeable light with two very bright LEDs though it is very small, maybe 2”x1.5”. It has three brightness settings and on the brightest setting it is sufficient for lighting a room. By itself it is very lightweight. The weight comes from the rechargeable battery to which it connects, and oddly enough the battery is larger than the light itself. The battery can be charged up via AC power and the adapter is included in the kit. Note that this battery cannot be charged via USB.

The tail light is bigger and is about the size of a silver dollar. It takes two AA batteries (not included in the kit). There are two buttons on it, one for LED and one for laser light. The laser light shines a stripe of red light on the ground on either side of the bike. I have not seen this feature before and I am learning how to use it to my advantage still. The LED function is another story entirely – the light has multiple modes, including a solid-shine and several flash cycles. This tail light has more modes than any others I have seen or used. Choose the cycle that makes you most visible from behind (or distinguishes you from the rest of your group). It comes with a plastic harness to which it simply clips into place once the harness is attached to the bike frame.

Also included in the kit is a pair of rubber straps for attaching the tail light.

This is a very nice kit and it offers a lot of features. The tail light is impressive in the number of modes it had and the headlight is far brighter than its size would suggest. This is a great kit for the serious biker and has almost everything you might want in a kit.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Small size perfect for stashing EDC gear text: I purchased the small cube for the purposes of stashing my EDC gear in my pack while hiking. This includes a smartphone (in a padded sleeve), a wallet, notebook, house and car keys, knife, and multitool. It fits all of this with a little space to share, pretty much perfectly. Seals tight - I'm not using it to resist total immersion, just perspiration and rain, but it is totally waterproof and will protect your sensitive gear even if you dump the pack in the river.

Material feels durable enough that I'm comfortable putting in in my pack without additional protection. Translucent top is very nice is allowing you to tell at a glance what is inside of it. No extra material or bits to take up space, this feels very secure in general.

Even better, I was able to buy it "used" for only $25, which is a great price compared to the $39 they wanted new. The used one arrived in, from what I can tell, perfect condition.

Caveats: My smartphone, which is about 5 7/8" (~15mm) long, fits nicely in its sleeve, but you won't fit something too much longer in there. -Maybe- another .5".

The material feels a -little- soft. Not enough to be worrisome for my purposes, but if you are more rough-and-tumble and have a lot of sharp/pokey/hard objects or tools, you may have a problem. If you are just throwing this in your beach bag to protect things, though, you should be fine.

Would recommend.

title: Nice piece of equipment for $30 text: I use a BodyBlade at home, which is too long to pack for air travel. So, I shipped this to my family's home to use while visiting. Great price @ $30 and a nice substitute piece of equipment. I was able to perform my BodyBlade routine with the TotalBar, with minor adjustments. Gave it to my nephew when I left and he loves it.

I personally prefer the BodyBlade, but if cost is an issue for you, I would recommend the TotalBar as a very nice alternative.

title: Exceeded My Expectations!
text: This inflatable paddleboard has exceeded my expectations. I love that it's versatile and can easily convert to a kayak. It's much sturdier than I would anticipated. This is not your swimming pool float quality. Once it is inflated, you can see how sturdy and firm it is. I was able to set this up on my own for the most part. It does take a little bit of time to inflate. It took about 5 minutes to get it looking like a paddleboard, but it took at least another 5 minutes to get it to a PSI of 12. It took a little longer to get it up to 15 PSI which is the recommended minimum. My husband took over after my 5 minutes because I was getting tired! We will definitely want to invest in an electric pump. A manual pump is included and it's also recommended for deflating it as well. I tried to deflate it without the pump and it did release a lot of the air by just sitting there. But it wasn't enough to pack it back up so we used the pump again. It comes with a paddle that can be converted to the 2 types of paddles - kayak & paddleboard. The seat is easy to install with clips/D-Rings. There's a repair kit. Everything stores nicely in a backpack style carrying bag which is nice and that bag easily fits into the trunk of my daughter's Honda Civic.

title: WORST PIECE OF GARBAGE I'VE EVER ENCOUNTERED IN MY LIFE. text: Don't waste your money. Run far far away from this horrible, horrible piece of garbage. The whole thing is made of thick, bulky, cheap, SLIPPERY junk material that has no business being around horses. Not only is the lead too bulky and slick to *safely* hold on to (seriously, it's dangerous-- it'll slip through your hands and cause severe burns), but the darn halter is too slippery to stay even tied! I know how to tie a rope halter correctly (knot goes on the bottom/back, not top/front) and there's no WAY that should slip, never in my life had another halter slip like that even with a big ornery horse tied solid-- yet this joke of a halter I had to tighten up every few steps while leading a yearling pony! God's honest truth, every few steps. I hate this thing, viscerally, from deep down in my being I loathe it, with every fiber.

This halter/lead is literally dangerous and an accident waiting to happen on several levels, and it shouldn't be on the market. It's garbage, and the absolute worst piece of equipment I've ever bought. I halfway wonder if it's not some Chinese fake, as I can't believe any actual tack company would green-light this piece of junk. Please don't waste your money on this.

title: Great little fan for tent or gazebo text: We have a gazebo on our deck with screens and I've been using a floor fan to get some air movement. The problem with the floor fan is that it needs to be plugged in, it's big and it moves too much air. When I saw this I thought it would be ideal.
The thing somes nicely packaged with two fan blades a remote and along USB cable for charging. I put the blades on the motor and turned it on. I didn't have to charge it up, it came with enough charge to use it for a while, which I always appreciate. There are two lights on either side of the motor which are bright enough for what I need and also has 3 levels so you have options.
It moves a lot of air. Of course, not as much as an electric floor fan, but that's what I needed. The battery life is also good enough for what we need. I don't sit in the screen room for 8 hours, so it has plenty of power for my needs.
It's a cool little fan and if you are looking for someting for a gazebo or tent or even an RV, this would work well.

title: LIghtweight, soft, attractive and gender neutral, what's not to like?
text: The Gaiam Yoga Duffle Bag or DUFFEL BAG, as the label says on the bag itself, is much more attractive in person than in the photos because the sensation of the soft and lightweight fabric enhances the appearance.  I was expecting it to have more pockets, so was surprised to see one inside that also houses a smaller zippered mesh compartment, one on the front of the outside just behind the section that is designed for holding a rolled up yoga mat which also has a small zippered exterior pocket, and one open pocket on both ends, both having a slightly elasticized upper edge.  There is really no hardware to weigh this down, just three light nylon zippers.  This is not designed to carry loads of heavy gear because the two handle straps are simply sewn into the fabric, not reinforced with anything other than the machine stitching, and there is nothing to protect the base of the bag from wear.  Because the fabric is lightweight and easy to clean, it is also crushable, so it is a good option to take with you for travel inside another suitcase for excess gear upon your return.  As for its intended purpose as a yoga bag, I find that by putting my mat inside a nylon bag I received with another yoga backpack, I can more easily slide it into the carrying spot in this bag.  The photos of this product appear very similar to the Gaiam Metro bag, which also is rather inviting.

title: A Nice, Thick, Comfortable Yoga Mat!
text: I don't do much Yoga, but I do like to play Wii Fit a lot and I prefer to use a mat for some of the activities that don't involve the board. I purchased an inexpensive Yoga mat a couple of years ago that has been destroyed by my cats, so when I came across a promotional deal for the Ashram mat, I thought it was the perfect time to purchase a replacement mat! I compared my old mat side by side with the Ashram mat. Both are about the same size, but the biggest difference was the thickness. The Ashram one is significantly thicker and more comfortable. I also LOVE that it comes  with a shoulder strap. As much as I like it, I don't know if I would purchase it at full price since I am not into true Yoga. However, if I was a serious about Yoga, that would be a different story.

title: All ages and capabilities can benefit from hitting these balls with a bat text: I love the feel of impact when hitting these balls. It's fun having them smash in and then pop out and it's fun for the ball retrievers who don't have to run all over the field since they don't go as far as a baseball. I can't help thinking about bumble bees when I look at the [[ASIN:B00N0NGUCG SKLZ Impact Heavy Duty Plastic Baseballs (Pack of 12)]], but that's irrelevant. With a solid black half and slotted yellow half, when my dog tried to grab one outside, she couldn't get it at first with her small mouth. Once I showed her the slots, she was hooked and it was pretty funny to watch her go after the balls after they were hit. Getting them out of her mouth quickly prevented destruction and I expect that the dozen balls will last a long time. We have no major sluggers in this household, just casual players, but neighbors who showed an interest were as impressed as us.

Just a hint -- my first reaction was to get into the bag of balls quickly, so I grabbed a knife to cut an opening like I do with bags of oranges or avocados. Fortunately, I stopped before the slice because I suddenly remembered that the balls came in a net bag with a drawstring. Don't make the mistake I almost did if you want to store the balls in a nice bag. You can even wash them all with a hose while in the bag should they get muddy, then hang it to air dry as a whole.

THE BAD:
-----------

title: Great camping table, super light and sets up in seconds text: We love to camp but as we've gotten older we've transitioned more into car campers and less backpack campers. This table makes our campsite a bit more like the outdoor home we've come to expect when camping. It's incredibly light and packs down into just over the size of a camping chair in its travel sleeve. Set up is a breeze, just unfold the legs and roll out the slatted top over the horizontal trestle theb lock the end pieces into their tension grooves on either end, that's it! Once assembled it remains a table until you take it apart, it self locks into place so it won't accidentally collapse or come undone.

The overall height and length are perfect for a travel table. We can move it around our campsite easily while already assembled to bring it closer to where we need it. It is very sturdy and doesn't flex or distort when we're cutting vegetables or even running a two burner camping stove on it. We throw our loaded cooler on top without worry, it can take the weight. The size is large enough to sit around comfortably for a meal or card game but mainly we use it as a work/prep surface for cooking since it's a good standing height table. This goes with us everywhere, it's very transportable and clean up is a breeze since it's all aluminum and simply wipes down before going back in it's travel sack.

Very well designed table, the best I've ever seen for camping. We bring it with us on just about every vacation since it's nice to have an outdoor table wherever we are with friends or family. Doesn't rust, perfectly weatherproof and tough enough to get knocked around without being bent or broken. This has changed the way we camp and I can't imagine going anywhere without it, you NEED this table! 10 stars.

When more forward on my head (and just touching forehead) I can move around all day and it stays totally in place.

I often wear my hair up, and I like a little colorful flair. I also work hot jobs, and always wear a sweatband, so if I can combine my two needs then bonus. These wont really cut it for heavy sweat days (but not many do), but they are fine for light to moderate sweat, really just better than anticipated.

The multi pack offers lots of pretty mottled colors. Individually wrapped. Stitching looks good. I assume a cotton AND spandex blend. They are comfortable, and feel kind of cool on my head. They add no heat or weight. BONUS? they wrap around the wrist nicely, without adding bulk or weight. So now I have a sweatband, headband, or HAIR TIE whenever I need it. It makes for a good hair tie elastic in a pinch.

2" x 8" (well, 16" doubled) with plenty of stretch, so it fits my 23.5" head easily.

4.5 stars

title: Always Hydrate text: 9/26/2020 update.
No rust or other problems with this water bottle. I’ve used it extensively and exclusively with just water, no problems keeping water cold and it has not developed any issues. I assume whoever had rust issues was aggressively scrubbing the stainless steel which is a big no. Never use abrasives or harsh cleaners with any stainless steel product. Use mild dish soap do not soak let it air dry or better yet after hand washing and rinsing just add more drinking water as we need lots of it ! I keep mine topped off with water throughout the day. Why would anyone want an empty water bottle ?

Well I’ve read a few negative review but I’m going to see for myself the price is good.
As far as stainless steel goes I’ve read that it can indeed rust If one where to (Expose it to corrosive process such as fluids and cleaners, high humidity or high salinity) which I take it to mean you should be careful when cleaning it do not use anything abrasive because it can scratch the coating on the stainless steel and promote rust. I suppose people put coffee in this bottle day after day and then have to aggressively clean it because of the coffee residue. Or put in powdered flavors in their water which may contain sodium. Sodium is salt and salt can promote rust even on stainless steel. I’m gong to use it exclusively with water and ice, if rust does start to appear I will document it and post pictures here in a future update I don’t want anyone getting sick.

In my state, we do not have a helmet law, but I wear one anyway. The photo I have shows the visible damage to the helmet. If I wasn't wearing the helmet, my injuries would have been worse. title: Lacking Safety Features
text: The bag is nicely padded and there's a semi stiff divider between the section for your weapons and the place to store magazines and ammunition. My chief complaint is there are no straps, which could have easily and cheaply been added, to hold the pistols in the pockets designated for them. If the bag is turned upside down for any reason the pistols can easily come out of the pocket they're stowed in and if you're carrying two as the bag is designed for, they can then bang into one another potentially causing damage to one or both. The divider will keep them from striking the magazines but not from hitting each other. The magazine pouches are, at least now while new, quite tight and hold my 10 and 12 round Sig Sauer P365 magazines tightly in place. Even vigorous shaking didn't dislodge them. The outside pocket had a good size gusset and expands to hold a box of 100 9mm rounds and my Uplula loader with room to spare. It also has a large velcro area for membership patches, flags, etc. The carry handles are comfortable. I wish there was a more secure way to hold your pistols in place and I plan on trying to modify the bag myself to achieve this. It should be fine for casual trips to the range just be careful when opening to ensure you don't drop a weapon.

title: Difficult to build, and very much temporary text: Let me start off by saying it IS functional and we had a blast playing with it at a family get-together once it was up. The problem, however, is that we found it really difficult to follow the directions. That, and I believe there is a design flaw that keeps it from standing very long. I'll get back to that in a moment.
For starters, it is pretty much impossible to assemble yourself. You need at least a second person to hold one side in place because nothing will stand until every part is finished (basically, the tension of the net and cords pull against each other and keeps it standing- if one part fails, the whole thing comes down). Second, the instructions are visual with very little printed wording so I found myself constantly staring at the diagram trying to decipher what, exactly, it was telling me to do in this step. I eventually found paragraphs of text in the instruction manual, but they were explaining the rules of volleyball... I'm wondering why they couldn't have spent some of that explaining the setup. Don't get me wrong, I've assembled things from visual instructions without any words before, and sometimes it is really intuitive and creative to do it that way. But this wasn't- it wasn't always clear we were holding the right piece or doing what they were describing to do in that step, and we ended up redoing some of it when we realized we had done it wrong.
The good news is that once it is assembled, it not only works great but I'm fairly confident we can put it up again quickly, now that I understand what needs to be done. I guess if you've built a similar net before, perhaps it would be easier to assemble the first time. This was a first time for us, so I guess take that into consideration.
Meanwhile, I found a very frustrating problem that I believe to be a design flaw:
The screw bolts have a plastic wing fastener on the other end. You heard me right- plastic. See the uploaded image. This is a metal bolt that needs to hold the tension of the ropes to the ground as well as one connection to the net on the other side. So basically, it is being tugged in both directions. It stayed up long enough for an afternoon, but the next day it had come crashing down, the plastic fastener yanked right off, taking the rest of the thing down like dominoes. I put it back up and tried twisting it on more carefully, and within 24 hours it came down again. I wanted it to stay up for the weekend, but it doesn't seem to want to stay up that long. I know it not supposed to be a permanent net, but it's even more temporary than I expected! I eventually used a little metal nut I found in the garage of an appropriate threading size to twist on next to the plastic wingnut and hold it in place, and that seemed to help... until one of the other plastic wingnuts gave out. Right now, as I'm writing this, it is down on the lawn as I'm not even going to attempt putting it back up until I find three more metal nuts to help keep the plastic ones in place.
In a nutshell: If you want to play Volleyball for an afternoon, it works well, but you'll need to familiarize yourself with the instructions first and I strongly recommend some metal reinforcements for the wingnuts if you want it to stay up for a weekend. I'd give it another star if those were made of metal instead of plastic.

title: Fantastic design!
text: Initial impressions:  I  bought a few of these to experiment with as I was more used to the HKS design with the twist knob.  I think this speedloader is ingeniously designed.  The reviewers that are griping about the difficulty of use?  I don't get it.  You literally put it upside down, seat your bullets, push and twist to lock into place.  When you expel your rounds you simply push the speedloader into place, when it hits the ejector star the rounds will release.  Viola!  Close your cylinder and you're reloaded for the next round of targets.  I just received these, so I'm reserving them at a 4 star with a potential updated review once I've used them a while.  My only concerns out of the package are the build material of plastic used in the locking "mechanism".  This could potentially cause a longevity issue but I'm reserving judgement until I actually see it fail.  I had also hoped these would work with my LCR line of 38's, but they do not unfortunately.  I had read mixed reviews of guys using these speedloaders with the LCR brand.  I'm not sure how they're doing it.  I even tried taking off the grips to see if it would work.  Possibly it works with the .357 framed variety, but most certainly will not allow seating to unlock the bullets in the .38spl LCR revolvers.  It will not permit the speedloader to clear the frame.  They do work really well with J-Frames and my SP101, so I'm keeping them to use with those revolvers.  If they hold up, I'd buy these over the HKS line as the actual funciton is more intuitive when reloading and most certainly faster.

title: Nice, bright, lightweight, easy to charge, well-made, I like it text: I collect flashlights, so lanterns just naturally go along too. I have several lanterns, from big to small. This one is impressive. When we had the rolling blackouts last winter, our home was the only one on the block that was lit up. I used many flashlights as lanterns and now have added several lanterns to my collection. She often asks me, how many lights do you need? She did not ask during the blackouts.

This lantern looks and feels to be well-made. I am impressed with it.

Someone complained that they did not get a cable. Come on man. It is just a USB micro plug. Doesn't everyone have extras laying around? I certainly do.

I like this and am happy to have it.

title: Works perfectly - no hard copy instructions text: I received this bag/pack as a review sample. The only thing that needs improvement is hard copy instructions should be included.

As it is, the instructions that are in the product images (at the time of this review) are invaluable and will save a great deal of frustration. Specifically, if you look at steps 5 and 6 in that instruction photo you will see advice for using a hair dryer to expand the seal when you are trying to separate the edges for the first time.

Since others have exhaustively described the physical characteristics and potential uses, I will stick with personal observations and a few notes that are easy to miss from the instructions. First, this pouch works as advertised. Second, it has a depth limitation - two meters - after which it is not guaranteed to be waterproof. If you plan to use this when diving heed that because if you go below the two meter limit you risk getting the contents of the pouch wet.

For me this is perfect for harsh or wet environments and I doubt if I would ever need to use this to the limits I mentioned above. It' s also perfect for prepositioning emergency gear in a bugout or emergency kit. Note the product dimensions in the product description on this page to ensure that your personal belongings or emergency gear will fit. And also take the time to read the instructions image before ordering so you are not frustrated when you receive it.

text: I recently started dying my hair so the swimming cap is no longer a luxury but a necessity to not only prolong the color vibrancy and color longevity of my hair coloring but also, to prevent the hair dye from washing out in the pool especially with the chemicals acting as a conduit in the pool.  Compound that dilemma with the fact that the potential color dye in the pool would no doubt be gross, embarrassing, and inconsiderate for my swimming companions.  What to do, I pondered...since, I have long hair almost to my butt and have found in the past that the standard one-size-fits-all swimming caps do not work for me and the cap literally slides right off my head from no doubt my excessive amount of hair in the swim cap. While, I have not used it yet, I tried the swim cap on and it fits snugly and securely so I tossed my hair/head from side to side and it stayed in place with no slippage whatsoever unlike the normal, standard hair swimming cap I "tested" in the past in this way (which consequentialy slipped right off my head - poof). title: For work and play. text: [[VIDEOID:db927eaa4577cb4b5a89571a0decd25c]] Great light, its the best I have had & I have had more than a few over the years. Though never something, I would consider high end like this. Bright is really bright, and sure lights the way for you. Just be prepared as it will draw some power. I find medium works best for me, and low would be reading in my hammock.
I am using this for work/personal (90/10%) of the time. Being on highway work, late at night, you need a good dependable light source, and this is it. Even with light plants, nothing beats a great personal light.
I did not purchase it from Amazon. I went to a brick and mortar store, mainly due to the quick need. I was fed up with using countless batteries, so I bought this.
I will be replacing the other replaceable battery type headlamps the family uses with this. I am very pleased with the money I spent vs. the product I received. If I had only took the plunge earlier. This is especially true being a 50 year old man, and having sight that's not as good at night, as it use to be.

The pictures were taken somewhere between 0300 and 0400 about 20 miles away from town, on an early morning hike, on an utterly cloud-free night this past weekend.

A note about bright, it is really bright, and you can undoubtedly hurt someone's eyes behind you if you turn around abruptly.

I purchased an additional battery pack, with two rechargeable packs it typically lasts me from 6 pm top 6 am on my work shift. https://www.amazon.com/PETZL-Rechargeable-Battery-Compact-Lamps/dp/B01L328L72

title: Great Safety Light For Bike Riders- Beats Cords of Christmas Lights In The Hair text: My daughter has to ride her bike sometimes on dark roads at night. We needed to find her an alternative to her strands of lights woven through her hair and hat like light up circus (yes, I am serious) and this seemed to be just what we needed.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This little guy is really tiny. It does not seem like it would do anything, but it does. The front has a light on it that is narrow. It has five settings. One is patterned blinking, one is one and off blinking, another is constant on , another is fading on and off, and of course off. There are two rubberized loops that you can fit onto your handlebars or stem of the seat if you like.

RECHARGING
This took us quite some time to figure out. FINALLY we figured it out. The top cap pulls off and the light itself plugs into the USB port- there is not a USB looking receptacle. It plugs into the USB port directly on your computer or outlet. It took some time to recharge- but not more than a few hours.

WARNING
BE CAREFUL WHEN PLUGGING THIS INTO USB PORTS ON COMPUTERS/LAPTOPS. If you are not careful, you can break the port due to tight fit on some of them.

IS IT BRIGHT?
This is surprisingly bright for how small it is. It is nice to have this on the front of the bike to draw attention with blinking or fading on and off. Having it on constantly helps too. We think that it does a decent job of helping provide safety riding at night. It beats the consternation that someone might feel with a moving christmas tree hair do coming at you not knowing WHAT to make of it.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For an easy to use bike light that is rechargeable, this is a nice choice. It is small but provides decent light in several patterns to provide more safety when having to ride in the dark. It is easy to recharge, but you have to work with the USB port carefully to avoid breaking it on computers.

MY RATING
Five stars. Hey, it got my kid to stop weaving Christmas lights into her hair, what can I say?

title: Great to Have on Hand
text: I wasn't really sure what to expect with these packets of water.  When it arrived, I wasn't sure what it was because the box was big and heavy and I didn't remember ordering anything big and heavy. Alas, 100 packets of water does have some weight to it! The packets are small and hold 4 ounces of water. Each packet is about the size of a taco seasoning package for reference, maybe a little bigger. The size definitely has some advantages. You can easily slip a couple of packets into a waist bag (fanny pack) or other backpack without adding too much weight. They have a 5 year shelf life. The directions say to gently squeeze the packet before opening to make sure that it hasn't been punctured. The water tastes okay. I'm pretty picky about water. I dislike a lot of tap waters. Whenever I visit my Dad in Indiana, I bring my own bottled water. I found it to be palatable. title: SOUND IS GOOD ENOUGH FOR OUTDOORS! text: This is quite a handy device. Not only for camping, but recently, I had a power outage for 3 hours. Having no sound in the house is eery. title: Attached with plastic clips! text: Of course these side frames are attached with a bolt through a plastic clip, and it breaks. The plastic part is used as a spacer to set-off the wire frames from the beam rack. So the attachment bolt is in tension and the plastic spacer is in compression. The plastic spacer also clips over the flat chevron-shaped part of the side frames.

Topeak could have engineered this without the brittle plastic clip, but now I have a 2-penny broken plastic clip that holds together a $150+ rack and pannier assembly. Sorry, but the easiest thing is for me is to return it all.

title: Trial Run Went Good, Will Update After Several Weeks Use text: We are setting up camp in our yard next month. We have company coming and it is going to be interesting. One thing I wanted was some spiral stakes to hold the canopy and tents into place.

HOW THESE COME
These come with four stakes and a bar to turn then into place with (through the circle).

DO THEY WORK?
So far these have worked pretty well. The ground was not hard, however, so I am not sure what will happen if we continue in drought status and the ground gets really hard.

DO THEY PULL OUT?
I had to remove them as my husband has to mow the lawn and keep things nice until it is time to set up camp. They did not pull out in our trial run.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Hopefully these will work out later this summer when we set up our little tent city.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS so far. I will update later in the summer when we try to use them again if anything changes.

title: Good for horse work text: I just received a wild horse saved from the kill auction and destined for the Mexico slaughter house. He's never been handled and is around 6 years old, so getting close to him is a slow, quiet, soft process.

That process requires long, soft ropes and endless patience. These ropes are excellent for my process. The end with the handle loop is lightly weighted and the rest of the rope is very light and easy to maneuver.

It tosses true and straight from both ends and is well made. The length is good for desensitization work from a safe distance as the horse learns being touched won't be painful or dangerous. I'm really pleased.

title: This is GREAT For Guitar Training text: I have been playing the guitar for a while, but had to stop and found my fingers were losing their strength a bit. This is the perfect way to get them back into shape.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
There are no in depth instructions with this. The idea is that you have five pads for fingers to press. You put the thumb on the bottom pad for balance of pressure. As you work your fingers, they get stronger.

ARE THEY ADJUSTABLE?
There is a small metal disk on the bottom of each spring in each column. To make it a bit harder to press, you turn the disk until it goes upward a bit. That makes it harder to press.

DOES IT HELP?
I start some electric guitar lessons next week for a few weeks and I wanted to get my fingers back into shape quickly. I have to say within just a few days of using this for a few sessions of 5 minutes each, my pinky and fourth fingers have grown much stronger which is my weakest areas. I am even seeing it in my typing.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Quick to use, easy to take with you, this is a great way to strengthen fingers for playing guitar.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I love having this. I am already seeing such a difference after just a few days. I plan to keep using this and watching my chord abilities grow when playing guitar as well as other benefits like typing, etc.

title: Decent for lifting now and again text: I use these while lifting - specifically while doing overhead lifts with about 70lb dumbbells, which for me is a lot. I do a little bit of a squat during the lift cycle. This is rarely an issue, but a few years ago I injured my knees and while they have almost fully healed, every once in a while they act up on me again and I will wear these as a preventative measure. Just that - nothing else, and for this purpose they work fine. Maybe it is mostly peace of mind, but I feel better knowing that I'm not straining myself without necessity, and they really do help take some of the pressure off those ligaments/tendons, I can feel it. However, the support is fairly minimal, so it works best as a preventative measure, rather than a protective one.

I don't use them while hiking or running, so I can't speak to that at all.

In terms of feel; well they aren't great, but they aren't bad either. They fit tightly but they don't cut of circulation. I feel very "spring" while wearing them, due to the elasticity, and I think if I were running or hiking it would make some but minimal difference in the energy needed to keep moving. They have two zig-zag beads of silicone-like gel that run along the upper, inner hem of the brace which prevents it from sliding down. This does actually work - but if you have leg hairs, you are going to feet the pinch. Putting the braces on is tricky - you are either going to have to do it before you put on your pants or while wearing shorts. So if you are hiking and wearing rolled-up nylon pants, it can be a bit tricky to manage it.

In terms of fit; I am a 5'10" male, 183, athletic build, inseam ~33". The measurement of my thigh where this overlaps is about 21" or so. I purchased the Medium that that suits me fine, I don't think I'd want to go up or down a size at all.

All in all, would probably recommend them as a lightweight support.

title: Not great in the desert, better in other environments text: This is really well constructed and put together. It's feels heavy/solid but not bulky in the hand or in a backpack.

We've been using it to spot wildlife on hikes and horseback riding in the Chihuahua Desert. I find the optics easy to adjust and use. I like the overall portability and long battery life.

We have noticed that the distance can be off a fair amount in some circumstances. It seems like in the desert flats, there's a problem accurately measuring - I think it's because everything out here is essentially shades of the same colors and sized/shaped similarly. (Like boulders, shrubs, cactus etc) In town, where the buildings etc have distinct shapes, we find this gives correct information. For our primary needs, it's fine to see jackrabbits, javelina, big horn sheep and eagles as long as I don't need an accurate distance.

title: Rinse mugs with boiling water Prior to use!
text: I have yet to have it out in the woods. But I was instructed by other reviewers to rinse/wash the mugs/cups with boiling water prior to use. Was informed that there's some type of film on them that you don't want to discover first time out. So I've cleaned the set. Brought water to a boil on the stove, in the pot. And the set is ready to go. The handle stays cool when the pot has boiling water in it. And the handle pressure closes to hold the lid on tight.

title: The best cold drinking cup I've ever owned.
text: I purchased my first two at Walmart a few years ago- they were the most expensive ones Walmart sold.  I needed one that absolutely would not spill,(my cat likes to knock things over)  held plenty of water and kept it cold and came in cool colors.  Well after a year or two I lost my first one (a beautiful shade of teal so I bought one in the navy which is also really lovely.  I'm buying two more to keep on hand so I can rotate cleaning the lids in the dishwater.  Unlike other people I haven't had any problems keeping the mouthpiece clean.  The paint on the cup - after several dishwasher washings - did start to come off.  So no more dishwasher for it.  I have dropped these bottles countless times, I would have had to replace so many keyboards and other electronics by now if it wasn't for the seal on this cup.  Makes a horrible metal sound when you (or the cat) knock it over but you'll pick it up and notice that not a drop of water has spilled.  It even seems to tighten close in either direction but underfill just a bit to fit the lid on top.  Overtime it will be a bit leaky when you first fill it but that will go away quickly.  I guess the other complaint about these is that they do not handle hot drinks.  If you've ever taken a sip of McDonald's coffee right after it's poured - and burnt yourself, you probably would want to buy a cup that lets some of that steam out and lets the coffee slowly cool.  This is NOT that cup.  I will fill it with ice and water about 10 pm, and unless I drink it all there will still be ice and water in the cup in the morning - and this is with no special insulation - just the metal cup.  I live alone so I'm the only one using these cups.  I also have terrible dry mouth problems (I'm on oxygen) - so I take one with me to every doctor's appointment and if you open the little handle you can hold the entire full cup with one finger or pinky.  So I can carry an o2 cannister, purse and cup of water at the same time.

title: Perfect For What I Need, But Wish More Exercise Ideas Were Included text: I have been through a lot this last year and having the ability to do quick exercises on the go is important. I have to go slowly and work up again to build up my body due to some issues and getting these strength bands is just the thing that I needed.

WHAT ARE THESE STRENGTH BANDS LIKE?
FILA strength bands come in a pretty sturdy box (significant because you can store them in there if you like). There are three bands that are color coded so it is easy to quickly identify their strength resistance when you need to grab one. The purple is light, the blue is medium, and the gray is heavy resistance. Along with the bands which each come individually wrapped are two paper fold outs. One has tips and warnings, and the other has a few exercise ideas of what you can do with these bands. I did notice that there is not a huge offensive smell with these bands either, so I wanted to point that out for anyone who might be concerned about that.

HOW DO THESE BANDS PERFORM?
Because I have to build up slowly, I have only been able to work up to the light resistance band at this point. At first the band seems as if it will not stretch that long as I am about 5ft 7in tall. I was particularly interested in doing the exercises which use the foot and require the arms to stretch above the head extended all of the way up. As I keep using the bands, they loosen up, however, and then they are perfect for whatever exercises that I want to use them for.

MY IMPRESSIONS OF THIS PACKAGE
To be honest, although I love the bands so far, I am a bit disappointed in the lack of exercises ideas included in this kit. I really would have like it if they included more ideas of what exercises to do with this band. I do realize that it is possible to look these up on the internet to find more exercises, but I would have liked it to be included in the set.

As for the bands, so far it is easy to hold and use, and I am finding my arms and shoulders are getting stronger which is just what I wanted.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Easy to hold and work with once they are broken in, these bands are a great way to do quick exercises to build strength. Color coded for easy identification, the quality of the bands seems to be solid so far. I only wish that more exercise ideas had been included in the box.

If I could, I would give these four and a half stars, but I can't so I am giving them five stars with the statement that better insert included with more exercises would make this much nicer than it is. But the bands themselves are great, so I plan to look up more exercises.

title: Smooth Operation; Bail Does not Close on Retrieve text: Note: There are multiple products attached to this listing. I am specifically writing this review for the Size 85 spinning reel.

One of my favorite pastimes is fishing, and my brothers and I have made a point of scheduling an annual gathering to go fishing. Usually, that means a saltwater trip, and when we have not rented a charter we have had to provide our own gear. I do have a large saltwater reel that has served me reasonably well but it is not particularly good (I’d call it sufficient). My experience with Quantum has been freshwater spinning reels, so I know it’s a decent brand but I hadn’t worked with their saltwater-ready reels at all before this one. This is a brute of a reel and is a smooth operator, though I have encountered what I consider to be a serious issue.

Please note, there are several different sizes of this reel. If you are looking to do freshwater fishing in a quiet pond or lake, the 85 is a beast that is probably more reel than you need. Consider one of the other choices. However, for going after saltwater fish, either from a pier or from the shore, this is a good choice if you expect to catch anything of good size.

This reel is solid and has a smooth retrieve and zero-reverse clutch that doesn’t give even a little bit. The drag is easy to set and seems to work very well, though I do wish it was a bit louder.

I’ve encountered on issue with this reel and I think I have a defective one. The bail does not close by itself when I start cranking, I have to manually flip it myself to lock it back into retrieve mode. I cannot tell if I have a bad unit or if this is a design decision. Regardless, it is different and unexpected behavior than I have had with every other spinning reel, whether saltwater or freshwater. I plan to reach out to Quantum to determine if this is right or not. Though it doesn’t render the reel unusable, it does make it more work than it needs to be.

I like this reel, but I hesitate to rate it higher because of the bail issue I am seeing. Once I contact Quantum and determine the reason, I will return here and provide an update. If the bail closed as expected, this would be an easy 5-star product.
