title: 5 stars. Classy looking gym or personal bag, durable, PLEASE see note on measurements text: TAKE NOTE that THE SIZE: is 17" wide, 15" long, and 5" deep.

The product description shows the measurements in two spots, depending on where you look it will be smaller or larger than the measurements I took. In the written headline, the sizing is listed as 15"x13"x3.5". In the PICTURE portion, it says that it is 20.5" Long X 14.7" Wide X 15.4" deep (lol, it is not 15+ inches deep!)

The third spot, for "package dimensions" is closed to my measurements.

So for the big discrepancies, I down rate to 4. Product is otherwise a solid 5.

---The straps for securing a yoga mat (or roll of towel, clothes, etc) is well designed. I was concerned about placement of those straps. I couldnt tell where they were anchored. I didnt know if they were anchored outside, and that there would be flopping straps when not in use Or are they anchored inside, and I would need to have the bag open to access the straps. But in fact, they are anchored in the bag, tucked away, and can be accessed by pulling them through open ports. So this means that the bag can be fully closed, and the straps can be pulled out from side holes, and then used to strap whatever you want onto it.

---The REALLY COOL feature of this is that they aren't limited to strapping something large on. They have press hooks- so you can hook your keys, or hand sanitzer bottle, etc. Pull the strap through to have it as a hook on outside of bag, or keep it tucked inside for a hook inside the bag. The other side is a D ring, so if you have a carbiner or other press hook, then you can use this to attach it to. Really good design in this regards. Makes it a more versatile tote.

---Interior is like a purse. Instead of interior side pockets, there is an interior center panel that has a zipper portion (with additional swivel pressure hook) and a wide open pocket which begs for a water bottle. Remainder of tote is open. Not sure if I like how the interior panel is attached. It is just in the center and doesnt run length of bag. It could have still be attached to the side with ability to put a water bottle in. Maybe with more use I will figure out if this is a good design or not. It doesnt really hinder use, and it might in fact add more options for someone.

--Exterior on one side has a zipper pocket and an open pocket. Opposite side has an open pocket.

---Material is sturdy, durable, and I am assuming water resistant, if not waterproof. It has a flat bottom, like a narrow rectangle. Lies flat when empty/not in use.

---Nice long adjustable shoulder strap with padded shoulder portion. Long enough for cross body use.

---The shoulder strap is also optional. It is attached via D ring and pressure clip on a swivel. (similar to style of the yoga mat straps). Very durable feeling. Cant tell if it is a thick heavy plastic or is metal. Either way, I feel confident in its durability, strength

--Also has comfortable hand straps, that are just long enough to get up on the shoulder.

OVERALL: I like it. It is the size and style that I like for an everyday carry. I dont go into stores or other places with big purses, but I do like to carry a variety of stuff. So I have my main items and then the items of the day. I then keep it in the car as I go about my day.

Whether you are using it for gym stuff, personal stuff, or switch back and forth between the two, I think you will like it. I dont rate on price, but I do comment. I am currently using [[ASIN:B07WT75VTZ baggallini Avenue Tote Top Handle Bag]] as my every day "carry all". I own several bags, all similarly priced. Excellent quality, so I rarely stray. I am familiar with Gaiam products, and this price for their quality is within reason.

Its a mediocre copy at best, nearly non functional at worst. The zippers stick and can be difficult to open - from day one my other pack had smooth, reliable zippers. There is plenty of rom for multiple magazines.

However, my pack has no velcro or holster attachment inside for my pistol. That's a recipe for disaster. I wear a gun fanny pack when I'm on horseback. I need my weapon secured and riding safely, not banging around loose in a pouch on my hip or waist. Additionally, the sticky zippers mean that I cannot reliably and safely draw my pistol in a crisis. Keep looking.

title: I am so sad and disappointed text: I live in Colorado and it was been record breaking cold and the elk, moose and deer are not able to get their food given it is feet under snow and ice packs. I have the block outside to supplement their nutritional needs. Even with the lack of food, they are not even touching the block. I am so sad and disappointed, let alone upset that the beautiful wildlife is not getting any benefits. I finally put out cracked corn and daily, there are deer in my yard. I put the corn on top of the block and guess what? nothing is touched on the block. They eat the corn and walk away.
I broke it up in case it was too cold for them to get to it and no help at all. Some say it is mushy. Not mine. It is literally "hard as a brick"
Sad.

They do supply two allen wrenches and a metric tool, but having a set of metric wrenches would have made it faster and easier on the hands (I need to get some metric tools). title: I love this umbrella for the following reasons text: I love this umbrella for the following reasons:
1. It's super sturdy and strong. It's actually double layered: top layer with black cloth and the inner layer with color print and small holes that allows wind to pass through. Super cleaver design!
2. It folds the opposite way as regular umbrellas, and makes all the wet water on the inside so it doesn't get on your clothes or make a mess so easily.
3. When it is folded, it can stand on by itself, and all the water will drip down without making a mess on your wall.
4. I get so many compliments about how beautiful this umbrella is.
Overall, I cannot say enough good things about the smart design and the quality of this umbrella. I will never go back to my old umbrella again.

title: Man what a find. Read full review for details text: I work as a Service Tech and Head of Maintenance for a few restaurants. So I have ALOT of keys and I do mean ALOT. Honestly the jailers keep ring would be great for me but I just don't see me using that for my needs.
I have a company ride and one day I panices when I realized I didn't have my car keys. My old key ring I was using had a really bad habit of releasing keys off of it when I would snap onto my belt or pants pocket. So of course I worried my new rides keys were gone. Thank God I just left at home but that moment I swore I was spending what ever I needed to so I could make sure I wouldn't loose not 1 key.
After a hour or so looking searching I finally happened upon this contraception.
Looked cool seems very useful and I honestly could see why I should trust it not to just release my keys.
I was right 💯 right on the head with these.
The double slide makes sure there can be no accidental key drops. You have to manually remove them for the keys to come off. This was perfect for my uses and needs. I can remove the set I need per store and keep the rest safe. The clip on very easily but I can't say that for removing them. Which is exactly what I wanted. They are made of a good sturdy metal, no plastic. No plastic locks no cheapness at all. I love the entire idea and give the inventory a pat on their backs. I love Mt key ring and wouldn't change it for the world. Best I've ever used and I've been through a few different ones.
Thanks alot guys, I haven't worried about loosing keys since the day I got this in my box.

I have NOT been paid for this review nor any other review so far. (I wish I would though).
This is, as always, just and only my opinion thought my own eyes and felt with my own hands. I take reviews serious, as I rely on them to make my decisions before any and all my purchases. So if you have found my review helpful please vote and let the other Amazonian Browsers get a better judgment of what to expect and how the product works. Thank you for your time and happy buying.

title: Excellent! text: A perfectly put together bike tube repair kit! Has everything that's needed to fix a flat. I used it to fix my hybrid bikes front inner tube. Took me a little longer than probably most, but it was my first time. Has all the items and also a handy guide on how to use them. Came with enough extra items that I think I am set for at least a dozen or more flats. It comes in a handy plastic box that I have put inside my bike saddle.

Very happy with this item!

title: Many hours of fun!! text: This table is just plain fun. The family has enjoyed it immensely, and this table has taken a lot of use in the past year.

Pros:
- good build quality for a low price. Have had this for over a year, and holding up nicely.
- table is easy to set up and level
- air hockey jets allow the disc to move smoothly all around the table
- table tennis surface is smooth and flat- no warping or uneven seams.
- everyone loves it! Have had many hours of enjoyment... family tournaments, challenges. It really provides some quality family times
- stands up to some pretty heavy teenager use, so that is a great testament to the quality of this table.

Cons:
- the table tennis is smaller than regulation. Nor necessarily a con, and it is still plenty of fun, but we had some trouble playing doubles on it.
- table tennis surface lays flat, but there isn't anything to keep it in place. It takes some adjustment to get it straight, and is prone to get out of whack if you bump the table. But this has really been far less of an issue than we initially thought it would be, and you can't beat the price.
- the net for the table tennis had to be replaced already, so just expect a 5 dollar cost after about a year. A minor issue, at best.
- the air hockey discs and paddles work great, but the table tennis paddles are garbage. We replaced them with real paddles almost immediately.
- air hockey has sound effects and automatic scoring... but my kids don't like the voice, so we just turn it off... easy enough.

All in all, we could not be happier with this table. It iui s just a ton of fun for my family and you can't beat the price.

If you are even considering this, I would highly recommend getting it. (It even gets my teenager off of his phone and actually interacting with the family)

title: Great For Winter Fun text: These are a nice pair of show shoes that can be used by kids, or adults in mild conditions. Show shoeing is a terrific sport that allows you to get out into nature. It also provides a tremendous workout and your children will be worn out and calm after exploring.

The 19" measurement is from the inside of the frame, the point to point measurement is closer to 20". These are a perfect, nimble size for lightweight individuals. The binding includes a clip for the heel, and a tooth binder across the top of the foot that is inserted and ratcheted tight. To release the top binding you push the white button and the strap slides right out.

Also included is a nice carrying bag that is large enough to fit the snow shoes and leave additional space. Every kid deserves to play around on a pair of snow shoes. It becomes a hobby for many and a passion for some. This is a great set of affordable starter snow shoes.

title: Classic for a reason
text: Each year, I give these little classic knives as gifts to an assortment of people.  With the restrictions on knives on aircraft now, they are always appreciated.  Since owning and using these on a daily basis for many years, I have yet to have one break or be problematic.  I do oil the hinges every year or so at least, more when the knife is used often.  It's the most basic knife without bells and whistles and I love it.  They are offered in a wide variety of colors and patterns and usually can be found for $10 or less.  The Victorinox Swiss Army Classic Pocket Knife is the best in it's class and at the low cost, it's not heartbreaking when one is lost.  It's also nice to have a couple on hand in the gift box for the times when someone compliments mine -- I give it away and know that I have a replacement at home.

title: Its a life saver!
text: Hi everyone who reads this. In my line of work my back almost always hurts, or stress, etc. I saw this on social media who uses the same thing. Blogilates. Meds didn't cut it to fix my pain & massages usually are costly & don't work. So I found this, saw 50/50 comments. I got the 2 piece grey colored one. When I got it it's VERY hard. But its supposed to be. When youre a beginner to it, it will be uncomfortable. Ive been using it for 2-3 weeks now & I LOVE it! I place mine on a yoga mat so it doesn't slide around. It really gets rid of the pain in my back & since im in my early 30s it really works! It takes some getting used too thats for sure. A massage for my back pain would take months to get all that pain out. This product I can do 10-15 mins worth & it gets rid of my pain. I also use it on my legs & lower back. Hope this helps u out

title: Does a nice job of keeping the mosquitoes away text: Does a nice job of keeping the mosquitoes away. I use this in addition to bug spray and very rarely get bitten while sitting outside. Five stars for effectiveness. It was't made the best, but it serves it's purpose. The wax portion fell out of the bucket during shipment but arrived in tact. Now that it has been used, the wax portion is fused into the bucket. It also gets difficult to light the wick after a few uses. We've found that you have to let the flame hit the wick for a few seconds otherwise it will go out within a minute.

We have used this product for roughly 10 hours and it is still well over half full, so the 30 hour estimate seems to be accurate.

title: Caution on Size - Decent for Price text: Word of caution on the size of this ball, it is much smaller than anticipated. I am 6'5" @270lbs and ordered the 75cm based on other reviews and the size chart I found online. I purchased this ball to sit on to work core and back strength but I am going to say this 75cm is only good for people up to 6'0" in height. I was expecting a size comparable to something I've used and seen at local gyms and it's not.Will be using this to sit at a desk and replace the office chair, so it may or may not work for someone my size based on how you plan to use it. I am going to be sitting a little low unfortunately.

The quality of the item I felt was on par with the price. Not heavy duty like the balls you use or see at a gym but adequate for home use. If you have kids around who may be tempted to use it for other things, it may not last as long as you'd like it to.

The hand pump is probably the weakest part of the product. Although it does the job well and using it is almost exercise itself, the tube doesn't appear that it will last very long because it's so thin, especially at the end that attaches to the pump itself. It's thin enough that I thought it may split or crack when I put it on the pump.

All in all, ok for the price. We'll see how it goes with future use!

title: Great hat
text: I started hiking & wanted something that would work well that didn't cost a fortune.  Have since used it in Africa, & was great. The ventilation really helps to stay cool in the heat and you can squish it into anywhere & still comes out looking good. I really abused it in Africa, & it held up very well. I wasn't sure of my size, but what I ordered works fine for me, but be sure of that before you order & if in doubt go the next size up as the heat does make your head swell & you may need that extra space.

title: This hat is for small heads only, so it fits me perfectly text: This review is for the denim blue hat.

I like that this hat is foldable and comes with a thin cinch pouch. The denim is malleable so that I can wear the rim up on the sides or out. There is a tie around the rim to cinch the hat tighter. However, I have a small head (around 7-1/8) and this fits me perfectly. I feel it would be too tight if my head were bigger.

It comes with a drawstring for the chin. It was difficult to get the hooks into the tiny loops in either side of the temple but I eventually managed.

Overall, this is perfect for summer.

title: Good product, weird marketing text: My younger kids have one of these in their school playroom for indoor recess. I've always wanted to try one, so I got excited to see this listed as good for kids and adults. The listing actually shows several interested additional uses that I've never heard of, like using it upside for Yoga or as a bridge to build toy sets. Those might be valid, but as far as I can tell, the reason one side is carpeted and the other not, is because the carpeted side is supposed to face down and protect your floor from being scratched up. When I got the board, I was even more confused as the included paperwork implies that this is only for kids with a maximum weight far below any adult in my household.
Its weird that the listing on Amazon doesn't match the info included with the product, although my kids are having a blast with it at home. I just wish I trusted it to support me like the listing states.

title: GREAT flashlight! text: For all around use, this is a teriffic flashlight! Why?
1. Uses 2 - C cells which provide much more longevity than useing AA batteries
2. Lightweight
3. Waterproof to a few feet
4. No switch to go bad... just turn the black collar at the top to turn it on and off. There is a durable "O" ring that seals the body.
5. Very bright halogen bulb.
6. How many times have you reached for a flashlight only to think, "will it work this time??". This flashlight never fails to turn on -
(given of course that the dry cells still have a charge.)

I would give this flashlight 10 stars if I could. I now have 5 of these and have given 3 more as presents. Never a failure.

title: JUNK after less than 3 mos text: I am posting a "reserved" review...After the experience buying the black one for my husband and the first one arrived, opened and not working! (BAD Amazon order fufillers sending an obviously opened and non-functioning product) I have had my Shine for about a week... I wear in on my wrist most of the time.. I chose to remove it before bathing. If I were swimming I would leave it on, although the propoganda states that if you wear in "treated" water it reduce it's life - odd to me. Also, it doesn't auto sync. You must sync it to your phone each day. The upside is that you don't have to charge it, just replace the battery. It seems to be fairly accurate. I will update if there are any use/wear issues. It arrived quickly (I have prime) and in good condition.

UPDATE 10/15/2014..... So... I've been using the Shine for about a month... it hasn't failed, to my knowledge. It syncs when prompted to, although I have found sometimes it takes longer than others even though I set it right next to my phone each time. It has survived one system "update" without noticeable issues. I chose to remove it when bathing. I do wish it auto synced rather than to manually prompt it to do so every morning. I have learned that if you are interested in following your sleep pattern one night at a time (it doesn't provide a graph of experience, however you can review night by night - would be nice to have an over all view), you must use the wrist band. Using the magnetic clip does not provide sleep info. Also note: when using the magnetic clip, be aware that it is HIGHLY likely to detach from you and attach to something else magnetic if it gets close and you may not even notice that you've left your Shine on something else. The "watch" band seems to be very durable. The time option of the Shine is interesting and maybe entertaining for a short while, however, it is not as "obvious" as you might think. It is very easy to misread. I found myself double-checking my phone a lot because I would think... hmm... my Shine says 5:30 but I KNOW it's 6:30. I eventually chose to "turn off" the watch function. Which is another thing.. to change anything you must be attached to where ever you downloaded the progam, not an option on the Shine itself. All of this is just information for those of you who are researching options. Honestly, the best part of the Shine for me is the battery and not having to charge it each night or every few nights. I didn't think I would mind the wrist band, but I am bored with it and it's look now, which sometimes interfers with my jewelry options. I considered the necklace accessory, however, the reviews of it were overwhelming not so great, so I stuck with the wrist band and the clip that comes with it. Over all it seems to fairly accurately record movement. However, when this one fails, I am probably going to search out the next option unless they do the subtle upgrades mentioned above... but even then, I think I'm still looking for the device that works best for me. Hope this info helps you in your research!
UPDATE: NOV 18 2014.... Sooo...about 2 months in and now it sometimes doesn't sync the sleep info. Randomly it just fails. And it would be nice if it would provide a graph or chart or some analysis of your sleep and workout info... but nope. It does now sync with My fitness pal, which is a free easy way of keeping track of your food/calories. Honestly, it's still disappointing because there are so many others that offer you more for about the same amount of money.

UPDATE: 12/4/2014.... Ok... the shine has officially stopped syncing... it's been "sputtering"... not recording data... taking a really long time to sync... etc.. I tried replacing the battery just in case. So... in less than 3 months.. it has stopped working. I would NOT recommend this pedometer at all. You would like to think it work for at least a year! I have the first gen fit bit... I just wanted one I could wear on my wrist. Honestly, I think I will try the wrist model of the fitbit.

title: What a complete utter disappointment Everlast! text: What a complete utter disappointment Everlast!! Since my KickBoxing gym closed last Saturday, I bought this standing heavy bag to work out with in my garage, til I find another suitable, close by, affordable place to kickbox again. This bag is a let down.

For starters, it takes a good several minutes to "roll" to the center of the garage (I park my car inside when not boxing) to the point I'm done by the time it's in its proper place. LOL I am used to a 140-170 lb hanging bag, but can't have one in my garage, as there'd be no place to park my ride.

Even with 200 lbs of sand in the bottom, it's not strong enough to withstand a front or side kick, I can only do round house kicks. And when I punch it, the bottom piece lifts off the ground/floor, while the top (foam) continues to pop up, as I've never been able to make it lock into place successfully.

Don't get me started in trying to use a timer on my iphone6 (Siri, you suck!). To use Siri's voice activated feature, you must have the phone plugged in to power, you can't listen to music and Siri still didn't follow my commands. Thus means having to remove your gloves EVERY TIME you finish a round.

Deep sigh. Any suggestions y'all?!
Thanks, in advance.

Thanks in advance!

title: Mixed Feeling on These, Too Many Basic Problems! text: [[VIDEOID:b5a53a0c1b472799ef4d5a2d386537bd]] I like certain things about these and can't stand certain other ones. I cannot stand the location of the pockets. They are way too high and closer to the center. They could have cut it at more of a slant but it still is too high. You got to put your hands almost straight down into them. While this is good for stopping some pick pockets they are still open, There should be a zipper secured side pocket inside the main pocket. These don't even have side pockets at all.

Now that;s out of the way it has a lot of pockets almost too many or they are not quite big enough to hold what you need them too.. The zipper in the front doesn't stay up unless zipped all the way and locked, so you;ll end up with your fly down if your not careful and don't make sure to get the zipper all the way up, This is waste time,. in my opinion, at least. The belt loops are too small to even accommodate an 2 inch utility belt.

These are very comfortable and just about the proper warmth and cooling so they are good year round unless you live in Alaska , Siberia or any place that get below -10 degrees Fahrenheit on a regular basis. I never really got uncomfortably hot or cold in these. Some of the stitching is top notch and then there are others that are terrible. The inside of the pocket are horribly stitched and I have never seen poor stitching on any good pair of BDU's or any other military or law enforcement pant types called "tactical".

I really like the ties around the legs that allow you to tie the legs tight either around your leg inside your boots or over the outside of your boot. This is good for limiting bugs crawling up your pant legs and various other things. Now they should've used some elastic ropes with a little fast tightener in place of the cheap ribbon. There is also no loop on the waste back close to your pocket to clip anything to.

So I have decided that these are just not very good the more and more I try them out. They just feel like everything is slightly out of place. One more thing the belt loops will not accommodate any decent utility belts or even a thick well made gun belt. Not to mention I wouldn't trust the stitch-work either over any amount of time and duty. I usually wear 5.11 or Backhawk for civilian purposes and they never caused distractions. One of the two no longer is making gear and the other is slacking so I was looking for a new supplier. This was definitely not it. I think these are trying to be fashionable instead of tactical and you just cannot mix the two. Same goes for combat boots! If you are trying to look cool and have no real reason to need to wear BDU pants then go ahead and enjoy. If you require something that actually provides performance and functionality then these are not for you. I couldn't wear these to the range let alone any real situation.

title: I Should Get Paid For The Work I Had To Do To Make This Work text: I know. There are some people out there who will get this item, have no issues with it and think it is marvelous. I am not one of those people. I had high hopes for this lounger, but my God, the stress I had to go through to make it work..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This comes in a very tight bag. It is wound up tight and it has a clip to it.

CLIP
The latch on the bag that you have to undo has a special button on it. This button was turned around to face the rolled up bag, so I had no idea how to get it undone. It took me 10 minutes to get the latch to work. Finally it did.

BAG DESIGN
This is a weird couch to be blunt. All it is is clear plastic encased inside of ripstop nylon caseing. There are two channels of plastic which need to capture air and a piece of mesh in between.

On the end of the bag are flexible pieces encased in the ends which are supposed to be held open as you run through the area holding it up like a giant wind sock. The idea is that these channels fill with air, you roll up the end and it is a beautiful thing.

Yeah, if you like sweat running down your face and the neighbors wondering what the heck you are doing with this demented looking kite in your yard running around flapping like a sick bird.

HOW IT REALLY WORKS
I took a HALF HOUR to try to get air into this thing. It would twist and turn around itself every time I tried to fill it with air. I could NOT get it to fill with air no matter what I did.

My husband saw me struggling with this and came over with that knowing look that his stupid wife could not possibly understand how something this ingenious would work. I gave it to him.

A half hour later with all sorts of words I can not repeat, he said, "How the heck is anyone supposed to do this without high winds?"

All of a sudden, a huge breeze came up and we both had to hold this thing in the air, pried open at the mouth to get the air encased in it. It didn't work GREAT, but at least we got it somewhat inflated.

HOW TO SHUT THE CHAIR IF YOU ARE LUCKY ENOUGH TO CATCH AIR
Once we got some air into it, I rolled up the back as tight as I could. My husband sat in it and flipped over. He was very irritated and tried again. He started to sink to the ground.

WHAT IF IT IS NOT FULL ENOUGH?
I rolled this thing up four more times and then tried it. It was full enough to lay on it without being ejected cartoon style on the lawn.

IF YOU GET IT INFLATED HOW IS IT TO LAY ON?
After over an hour of work with this stupid thing, I finally got it tight enough where I could lay on it and have it not be sinking. Then it happened. The stupid thing began to sweat under me. Yes, there is mesh in the center, but within five minutes, I was sitting in a pool of sweat. After about 15 minutes I had to get up and wipe off the chair. It was 77 degrees out and the sun was in and out a bit.

STAKE
This comes with a stake to make it not blow away in wind. If you plan to use this on a beach, good luck with that. The sand won't hold this tiny spike.

SEAMS
Another thing- once the chair had been sat in for a while, I noticed the seams were coming out- and pulling TERRIBLY. This thing would not last if you tried to put up to 600 lbs in it- heck not even under 200 lbs would it last a really long time.

COMFORT AND ELDERLY
There are two other things I want to rant about with this chair. It recommends that it is supportive and comfortable (once you get it inflated) and it is good even for elderly. Let me tell you this. It is not that comfortable, and getting out of it is horrible. If you have an elderly person you want to embarrass, this is the chair to use. You might find them laying flat on their face unable to get up from their prone position once they manage to get out of this marvelous chair.

PUTTING IT AWAY
Then my last rant is about the storage bag. Trying to roll this monstrosity into the small roll that fits into the tight bag is yet another frustration with this thing.

THE BOTTOM LINE
As you can see, my experience with this chair is anything but stellar. After working really hard with two people to get it inflated enough to use, the thing makes you sweat, and it is very hard to get out of. It is not any kind of chair I would want to try to use without a high wind. Then if you had high winds, you would not want to be laying in the thing, although it might blow your sweat away.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. This experience was not good. I think this is WAY overpriced for what it is. It might be portable and small for storage, but the amount of work it takes to have it useful, it just is not anything I would ever buy again. About the only thing that did NOT happen is our cat trying to jump on it with her claws.

title: Solid, easy to install, ingenious design!
text: I have a long Electra Townie, so comfortable, but heavy. It has a rear rack, with a Niterider LED/lasers taillight at the end of the rack. (I ride home from work at night in total darkness. Cygolite headlights rock!) This SKS fender fits under the rear rack and extends under the taillight. It gives me and the taillight added protection from slop thrown off the back wheel. It took me two minutes to install and adjust. I trimmed the sides with wire cutters so that the lasers shoot the "bicycle lane" lines onto the ground, especially the one on the left side of the bike. It hasn't moved around at all! It weighs much less than the loud, rattling rear fender that came with the bike. It looks great, too. Great product.

title: Just what I needed

title: The EKG charts produced by this very satisfactory EKG machine match what I get from my cardio.
text: Can I read an EKG? No. Not clinically. But I have good clinical EKG's and insofar as my CardiaMobile PDF charts look just the same, then I am reassured. So suggest you get a "real" hospital EKG as a baseline (HIPAA requires that you be given the chart) and just compare. Look at the pattern of voltage spikes? Note the timing and pulse height. Same? Good. Note all the tiny waves between the spikes. Same? Good. If you had no afib as this is where it would show up. Net: absolutely empowering technology that is absolutely a blessing. Of course, if you are young and healthy and heart issues are only for us oldsters, then save your money. Otherwise...

title: A little thicker than its shrink-wrap and about as durable text: Bought this to replace a similar off-brand mat that had seen near daily use under my cycling trainer setup. Product is VERY thin for something designed to hold the weight of exercise equipment. The UP surface is closed (shiny) and easily cut, the down surface is open, but seriously it's so thin as to be useless. First time mounting the bike wearing cycling shoes with cleats the surface was cut nearly through. Having a shiny surface does make it easy to clean.

I'll wear this one out in less than a month compared to the mat it replaced that lasted over a year before finally beginning to wear through due to cycling shoes. Live and learn....trying to return this to China isn't worth the hassle.

I would NOT recommend this product

The wide waistband stays in place even when doing burpees. The fit is true to size.

title: SImply the best
text: Esstac's the only one that has the proper pull loop - braided rope. So yanking it off to quickly reload is a breeze. I have three of these, in different colors - ESSTAC's my #1 choice for shotgun cards. Period.

title: FINALLY What I Needed! text: I've been going from store to store and searching on Amazon and other sites for lights like these and finally have found them. I have bought the white and red lights that dangle from small cords that have sorta done the job, but they are inadequate. This is because I don't want them for a bicycle, I want them for my husband's power chair! This year everything's been cancelled, but we usually go to several science fiction conventions a year and leave long after dark, risking traveling through dark parking lots and also, for DragonCon, Atlanta streets with their maniac drivers. We also, of course, have to take the chair other places at night, and sometimes places where it needs to be lit up. We can carry a flashlight, sure, but I wanted to light up the chair without my husband having to sacrifice the use of a hand, and especially wanted it to be illuminated with red on the back.

These are superior to most I've seen in several ways. First, none of those stupid teeny batteries to reload. These recharge! Second, they are a larger diameter than the smaller lights on the cords, and contain three LED bulbs instead of one, so they can easily be seen. Third, they do not have that inevitable type of plastic fastener that ONLY fastens on a bicycle handlebar. I've found a lot of prospective good lights, only to find they have a fastener that will only enable the light to be put on a handlebar. The clip will enable the white light to be fastened in some manner on the front while the red light can clip to the carrier on the back of the chair.

The only problem with these lights is that, like everything that charges USB these days, they send you the cords AND NO ELECTRICAL PLUG. C'mon, guys, this should be a given.

title: Nostalgia at its Best! text: Nostalgia... Priceless! Love this sign! Seeing it puts me right back at Woolworth's 5 & 10 cents store and at the counter having a hot dog in a toasted bun with a Coke. Okay, I was a kid then, but some memories are just too good to forget.
Every time I look at the sign it brings a smile to my lips as I recall the 50's and the innocence experienced at that time.

title: Great lantern, charges your phone also!! text: We are loving this lantern. It is so easy to use, has a lot of features and emits a great glow of light. Soft silicone base that doubles as a small storage container. Solar panels on the lid to charge the LED lights, and also to power the USB port. Use the port for a cell phone or small camera. The handle is also a nice soft silicone. Twist the top on and off. Three light settings, I consider them low and then high, press a third time for flashing emergency light and a 4th to turn it off. The light is bright but the silicone and colored base make the light soft and not beaming in your eyes. (This also came with a USB cord)
This lantern is so easy to grip, my toddler loves that he can carry this around like a big boy. I love that it is easy to transport. You can even remove the silicone base, smoosh it down and re lid then pack it away in the backpack. Great for camping but just a good for running to an outdoor building or shed at night. Roadside emergency even if you keep it in the car.
I received this item in exchange for my honest review. I really like this lantern, we even take it to the grocery store because my toddler likes it so much it keeps him busy and quiet.

title: Feeling the burn? text: With all the chemicals used to keep swimming pools in good working order and as germ-free as possible, a good pair of goggles is indispensable if you're going to the pool to actually get wet. If you only venture poolside to lie on the deckchairs and soak up the sun, you need to stop reading this, and go look up "sunscreen", "sunshades" and "rum cocktails with little umbrellas."

However, once the top of your head is going below the surface of the water, you might want to invest in a pair of good quality goggles, and Speedo is the most trusted brand name in the swimming world. This pair is comfortable and fits securely through suction. It has a special headstrap system that makes adjustments in seconds, and the lenses are anti-fog with UV protection. As a former competitive swimmer, I can attest that these goggles are functional, and not just another pretty design.

I don't know if Jimmy Cliff ever used goggles, but I'm thinking that his version of the song "I Can See Clearly Now" is extremely applicable to this product.

I can see clearly now the chlorine's gone
I can see all obstacles in my way
Gone are the red eyes that made me cry
It's gonna be a bright (bright) bright (bright) sun-shiny day

Oh yes, I can take it now the pain is gone
Now that the eye-burning has disappeared
These are the goggles I've been waiting for
It's gonna be a bright (bright) bright (bright) sun-shiny day

Amanda Richards, June 3, 2008

title: My Husband Laughed When I Got This. THEN Guess What Happened.. text: We have this horrible habit. Every year my husband and I go for a hike, and we take a carefully planned route so we can make sure to return to the starting spot within a reasonable time, as I sometimes have difficulty walking due to injuries from the past. Every time, the path ends up not being marked correctly and we wander round and round looking for a way home, usually with me crying and in pain. I saw this stick and thought it would be great to take with me for my insane future journeys..

My husband laughed when it came in the mail. The very next day I fell and hurt my foot pretty badly. He isn't laughing anymore.

WHAT IS THIS WALKING STICK LIKE?
This stick is realy nice. It has the wood shaved off of it to look almost plastic in nature. There are no rough edges or grooves to catch clothing or skin on. It seems to be coated with a coating to make it water resistant too. There is a metal inlay with the company name on it, a leather strap through a drilled hole, and a rubberized cane tip on the bottom for good grip.

HOW DOES THIS WORK?
Well, I have to say, I have never been so glad for anything like I have this walking stick the last few days. When I am going up our narrow basement stairs, I am happy to say that this stick grips the stairs well and allows me to walk up and not fall in places where I can not reach the railing. I also have had some issues in parts of our home where I needed an extra boost to get up from the floor. This has helped me a LOT.

STORAGE
What I love about this stick is that it stands up behind the door we have in between the molding around the door and the corner. It is not at all in the way and easy to get to.

CAN YOU MAKE THIS SHORTER?
I am pretty tall, so I appreciate how long this is. For a shorter person, all you do is take the rubberized cap off, saw off how much you want, and then replace the cap again.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This walking stick is easy to store, grips well, and can be shortened if you need it to be. It really has helped a lot with my injured foot.

MY RATING
FIVE ENTHUSIASTIC STARS. I will be taking this with me a lot on my crazy walks this spring and summer. It has already become a trusted companion as my foot heals.

title: Everyone Fights Over This Chair If That Tells You Anything.. (Beware of Low Weight Limit) text: Our family has started a tradition every summer of attending various camping activities, including a music festival. It has become quite an undertaking with friends as well as family in attendance, picking up and extra person every year it seems. Having enough chairs is always a concern. Let's see how this one measures up.

WHAT IS THIS CHAIR LIKE?
This chair folds into a small piece which fits into a bag. When open there are some really great features. I am going to outline all of the features one by one in its own section.

PADDING AND COMFORT
First of all the padding is minimal, however, the angle of the seat was comfortable for three of us- THAT ALMOST NEVER HAPPENS. We all have different chair needs, and rarely do any of us agree on any one chair.

WEIGHT LIMIT
225 lbs it says on the label.

SIZE
This is an XL chair and it is perfect to sit comfortably in. It is big enough for our teen to sit cross legged in (a deal breaker on every chair or couch EVER for that teen)

SIDE POUCH
There is a side pouch with netting on it for a book, or other pamphlet, even lotion to keep on the chair.

DRINK HOLDER
This is a round holder which fits cans of carbonated juice (their drink of choice) such as Izze and even a larger bottle such as they sell at Chipolte restaurants of Izze

COLD PACK
This is the coolest thing- it has double zippers which are connected by a pull cord. you pull on it with your finger/thumb and both zippers open, allowing you access to the insulated pack which is part of the chair! When you are done, you close it and secure it with a velcro type closure.

STABILITY
So far this is really stable and easy to set up as long as the ground is not too uneven.

WEIGHT
This is heavy, but not as heavy as some chairs I have used. It is easy to carry to a picnic or camp site, but not appropriate for hiking long distances.

CLEANING
My big concern was if something got spilled in the insulated pack it would be hard to clean. However, a wet cloth used to wipe it out good and left out to dry, it seems fine.

THE BOTTOM LINE
With plenty of room to sit comfortably (yes, even if you insist on crossing your legs and are not too tall or over 225 lbs) this chair has some great features that are easy to use. A medium weight chair that is easy to pack, we all are fighting over sitting in it today. Considering that almost never happens, I would say that is a good indication that this chair is a winner here! The one member of the family that is too heavy for it is kind of cranky about not being able to use it, but he has his own chair.

MY RATING
This rating is FIVE STARS. Although the weight limit is rather low for the size chair it is, I still really like it. It is comfortable, has very convenient features, and is stable too.

title: Waterproof; Holds Water or Ice Without Leaking text: Before working with this water bag I was unfamiliar with the concept of using a nylon bag as a way to hold water, and I struggled a bit to determine how to use this bag. As it turns out, I found a very good use for it that is similar to holding water but is a variation on a theme. In short, this makes a fantastic ice bag.

I was a little surprised when this bag arrived as it is a little smaller than I expected. When unfolded and filled or just stood up it is a little bigger than a basketball. I had an image in my head that it would be bigger, like the size of a book bag or similar. This is not a very large bag but it does hold more than a gallon of water at a time, if you are so inclined to fill it with that much water and try to carry it.

The whole bag is made of nylon though there are three different types used. The outer shell is a parachute nylon which makes it very strong and also water resistant. The inner lining is a microweave type that holds liquid very well and is also very lightweight. The handle is a heavier type of nylon and is strong enough to hold the bag when it is full.

The product description says this bag will hold water so it can be transported from a source to a campsite or similar scenario. I found another good use. It is not a huge bag but it is larg enough to hold several soft drink cans and ice. So, filling this bag with ice and then putting in drink cans, you can keep a small number of cans cold and not drip water all over when the ice melts. This is a good option for when you are cooking out or you are having a small gathering and need to keep a few drinks cold without digging up a cooler.

This is an exceptionally lightweight bag and it compacts down very small. It is small enough to fit in a large pocket when it is completely folded up and packed in the little bag in which it comes. I have not put the bag on a scale but it definitely weighs less than a pound.

This is an interesting little bag. It is definitely waterproof and while it is marketed as a bag for carrying water it does serve some other uses too. It is small, lightweight and well-made.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: A little small for my needs, but works great! text: The stainless steel insulated vacuum cup works as advertised but it doesn't hold enough for my personal taste. 17.6 oz isn't enough to bother with me carrying it with me. The little green piece in the picture was already off when I got it, but it snaps back into place on one of the hinges.

It works great with hot and cold beverages which is a big plus. It's too small for my water but works great for a hot drink to take with me on a cold day. Only problem is I don't really like drinking hot drinks out of a straw. The internal part of the straw is detachable for cleaning which is really helpful. Some people will truly love this and some will hate it depending on their exact taste in thermos's and drinking habits. Personally it's a little more then I would like to have paid but it's stainless and that always costs a bit more for good reason.

title: Love it! text: Great light! It's really bright and the various mode are very useful. I live in CA so I can only use the red color. I can tell it really gets peoples attention because people making right turns over the bike lane actually waits behind me on a red light. :-)

Battery lasts for about 4-5 hours (my ride is 1.30 hours/day). Charging is simple. I use a regular charger base (not the fast charging) because I am not sure if this unit can deal with high charge rate. I had bad luck with other things like usb headphones that just couldn't handle fast charging. The regular charging speed is about a few hours. So I usually charge it after a few rides for 2-3 hours.

Mounting is easy. I ride on city streets, so I cannot tell if the thing with stay on after a very bumpy ride. The latch seems pretty solid.

The unit itself doesn't feel very sturdy (light plasticky feel), so I am not sure how it will fare if I dropped it on a paved road. So I am careful when I take it out or put it back in the mount.

title: Paddle Your Way to Fitness and Recreation text: If water sports are to your liking, then the Sevylor Mesa Paddle Board is something to consider. It can be used on any body of water- including the ocean- for a hours of fitness and recreation.

A paddle board isn’t something many people have ever heard of, but it’s like a cross between a surfboard and a paddle boat. You stand on the board, like you would with a surf board, and then paddle like you would with a boat. Paddle boards are designed to accommodate the needs of a person who is standing and rowing, making it unique among non- powered water craft.

As for the Sevylor Paddle Board, it is made with beginners/intermediate users in mind. The board does not come in a long box- it is folded up in a square box and has to be inflated to use. I was surprised at how heavy the box is, but it’s because there is a lot of material inside and the board itself is very thick. Once inflated, the board measures about 2.5 feet in width, which is wide enough to allow for comfortable standing and maneuvering. The fact that the board is inflatable makes it much easier to transport and carry around. Just deflate, fold it up, and you can take it or store it almost anyplace.

A flat board would not seem like something that would be stable in open water, but the Sevylor Paddle Board is quite remarkable in this regard. On a lake with few or moderate waves, it’s as steady as a canoe or paddle boat- perhaps even more so. The surface where you stand is slip- proof and with the three fins, one is removable, for better handling when you need it. I cannot comment on how this board would be in the ocean because I haven’t used it there, but it seems like it is well suited for that purpose.

Water sports are great for fitness and recreation and paddle boards are a nice way to experience the water without much worry. Sevylor Mesa Paddle Board is a very good board for the needs of most people, excluding perhaps the more advanced paddlers among us. It has the features you need for an enjoyable day of water recreation.

title: Well Made and Works Great text: One of the things I enjoy is using a monocular or a pair of binoculars to look at distant objects, whether I am birdwatching, looking at a mountain feature or stargazing. I was very interested in trying out this spotting scope and seeing how well it would improve my ability to see things in the distance and I have been more than pleased with it. It works very well and it is a very simple to use and understand device.

I should mention that this is a much larger scope than I expected. When measured from end to end it is about 13” long which is a lot bigger than the monocular I use. I was expecting something 6”-7” long so when it arrived it was quite a shock.

This is a sealed and nicely waterproofed scope, covered in a smooth no-slip coating that actually feels somewhat velvety (I am not sure how else I would describe it). It has a cap on either end to protect the lenses and it is comes in a nice nylon bag that keeps it free from dust and water when not in use. Overall, it is a nicely packaged unit.

The cap on the larger lens merely pops off, but the cover for the eye piece is a large cap that screws down over the whole eye piece assembly. I like this, as it provides additional protection for the eye piece assembly. The larger lens is already protected by the barrel of the scope.

This scope comes with a small but very sturdy tripod. It is suitable for use when on the ground or when the scope is on a desk or windowsill. If you want, this scope can be mounted on a photography tripod as the mounting shoe is the same for both. So, with the exception of not having a view finder, this scope can be used as a telescope.

The focus adjust is a knob on the barrel and it is easy to fine-tune the focus and get it perfect for objects that are not too close. In playing with the scope I was unable to focus on something across the room but I was able to point it out the window and get a very clear picture of the tree line behind my house. The eye piece has a further adjustment for magnification and rotates to give more or less magnification as desired.

I took it to work with me as I work with a couple of people who are very much into optics and would be able to give me a quick assessment. One of them looked it over and tested it a bit and finally came back with “that's a very nice scope” which is a big compliment coming from him. Working on the fourth floor of an office building I set it up on a window sill and pointed it out across the parking lot and focused on a car somewhere between 200 and 300 yards from where I was standing. Once I had it adjusted properly I was able to read off the license plate of that car.

Encouraged by that I decided to put it through a real test – I pointed it at the moon. With my telescope I can see the moon's craters so I was hopeful I could see the same with this scope. Not only could I see the craters, but I was able to see them a bit more clearly that with my telescope.

I am very pleased with this scope and I look forward to using it more. I have family that lives in the mountains and I think taking this scope with me when I visit will provide all of us some really nice views of the surroundings as we hike and explore.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Perfect for the home mechanic text: This isn't a pro's or true mechanic stand by any means, this is for the home mechanic who is knowledgable enough to work on their own bike but only has to do so occasionally. It is conveniently collapsable so when no in use it fits into a nice narrow crevice somewhere out of sight. But when assembled for use the three prong base locks securely to hold your bike aloft at whatever height you need while servicing.

The adjustable arm can lock and swivel to tilt your bike forward to keep the front wheel from turning or move the frame to a more comfortable position over the splayed stand feet. The tool tray on the stem is pretty small and sort of useless but I find when changing between allen keys or other small tools I do use it. The locking mechanisms are just plastic knobs you can hand tighten but for most of the work I'm doing I find they are enough to hold my bike aloft and securely in place. Mostly the stand is just holding your bike aloft so you can get at it, it will still sway and have some motion while locked in place but not an absurd amount. Will you have to readjust or retighten the knobs while working, probably, but again, this is an affordable and occasional mechanics stand, not a pro's stand.

Changing my bottom bracket, swapping a derailleur, threading a new brake line. I've done all of these things with this stand and it's served me just fine. I live in an apartment so having a stand which collapses and stores easily is essential and this stand allows me to work on my bike while also saving me space. A good home mechanic stand, I recommend.

title: Love my fitbit one text: I've had my fitbit one for 6 months - it was a Christmas gift. I love the dashboard on the fitbit website - and love how my fitbit tracks my every move. I use myfitnesspal for tracking calories eaten and love the way fitbit & myfitnesspal synch. Also love seeing my points rack up on earndit. The fitbit adds ooomph to what I was trying to do before I got it. I like seeing my badges earned and on days when work or life keeps me sitting for too long seeing my "stats" is just the push I need. The sleep bit has interested me much more than I'd anticipated - again... more data. I like being able to keep track without spending a lot of time trying.

The only imperfection is the little holder thing. At six months it is starting to give out. The tip on the metal piece popped off, and two days ago my daughter found my fitbit on the patio (it had been in its usual place - in the holder - on my bra).

I would absolutely recommend this product - and have recommended it to many of my friends. I'll figure out a replacement holder or something - it is definitely worth it!!!

My kids struggle with their low cross country ski boots because the elastic snow cuffs on their snow-pants won't seal on the low boots. Even duct tape is futile. Unfortunately, they just orient kid's NNN boots for on-track skiing. So I got them some small gaiters. title: Totally Overrated text: Now that I have used this Fitbit for a few weeks I feel like I have an idea about it. I've wanted a Fitbit for years, I've heard nothing but amazing things about it and how great they are. Well, to be honest, I am not seeing the greatness of them now that I actually have one. Maybe it's because this is the newest one, maybe there are still bugs to fix, and maybe it could be my phone that just hates everything about the Fitbit app. Honestly, I don't know but either way, I am so unimpressed with this Fitbit.

The pros I have found out is that it was easy to set up and make an account with Fitbit. Everything downloaded, updated, and whatever else perfectly. It was easy to change all the settings and personalize everything the way I wanted it. I love that you can customize the face so that it matches your personality or the types of apps or stuff you want it to show first right on the face. I like that you can control your music and pay for your watch too. Those are great ideas and honestly if I got out more and whatever else I can see where tons of people would totally get so much use out of it.

My biggest beef I have with this though is the fact that I wear it constantly and I want to keep up mainly with my steps, how much I move, and my sleeping patterns. It doesn't have any problems keeping up with all of that and so much more. The problem I have with this watch is the fact that it disconnects from the wifi and then becomes difficult to sync to the app, if at all. I've already had to reset to factory settings once to get it to reconnect to the app, which also has its own set of challenges because once the watch goes the app doesn't want to do much either. I can't remove the watch to re-add it in the app and I'm unable to view the wifi connections to change them or re-add them. It's like everything stops and becomes completely unusable. It's a real pain, to say the least.

Being completely honest, the watch I replaced with this Fitbit was way better and I never had any issues with it syncing to my phone, the app, or anything else. It did everything that this one does but just not as pretty, which honestly I'd much rather the watch to work and do what I want it to do than to have the cool face and whatever else.

I am so unimpressed and honestly bummed about this watch not living up to the hype. I am hoping that everything works out and the bugs are fixed soon if these are bugs, but I've no idea. Right now the watch is acting up again and honestly, I am thinking I am about to have to reset it again. If this happens I am going back to my old one that I know works just fine. Honestly, don't waste your money on this one just yet but wait to see if the bugs are fixed in a few months.

title: Strong and easy to use text: Who knew such a nice stretching band existed? Well, I am guessing practically everyone except me, but that matters not because I have found it now! As I enter my dotage, it is increasingly important to maintain muscle strength and flexibility. This stretchy band has comfortable loops along its length that are very comfortable.

I use them whilst seated for flexing, flexibility and to help support the muscles that support my knees. I have already noticed an improvement is my stability when walking. Such a simple tool for better health. I really love it.

One of the nice features is that I can toss it into my purse and take it with me. I have used it at a friend's house and whilst waiting for a doctor appointment. Using it is unobtrusive when stretching my legs, and even though we are not going out and about unnecessarily, it is handy and convenient to use anywhere. Great product. Oh, and the band is sturdily constructed, and looks to be able to last a long time.

title: The quality is impeccable!! text: I ordered the following for review:
JOOLA Infinity Balance - Advanced Performance Ping Pong Paddle - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for High-Level Training - Designed to Optimize Spin and Control

JOOLA Infinity Edge - Tournament Performance Ping Pong Paddle w/Pro Carbon Technology - Black Rubber on Both Sides - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training - Designed for Speed (Blue Handle)

JOOLA Omega Speed - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training with Flared Handle - Tournament Level Ping Pong Paddle with Torrent 33 Table Tennis Rubber- Designed for Speed

JOOLA Infinity Edge - Tournament Performance Ping Pong Paddle w/Pro Carbon Technology - Black Rubber on Both Sides - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training - Designed for Speed (Red Handle)

JOOLA Omega Strata - Table Tennis Racket with Flared Handle - Tournament Level Ping Pong Paddle with Riff 34 Table Tennis Rubber - Designed for Spin .

It’s been years since I played Ping Pong and back then I never had the opportunity to use, and was not even familiar with the Joola brand unfortunately. As I have had time to use and play with these 5 different Joola Ping Pong paddles, I must say that they are all incredible compared to any other Ping Pong paddle I have ever used. The quality and performance far exceeds my previous experiences.

Each of these paddles have been designed for a specific purpose which include speed, spin and control. Now not being a professional, I can not “honestly” say that I notice the difference between any of these five different paddles, in any of the different design aspects while using them. However, I can honestly say that visually I can tell the difference by the different rubber padding (sandwiched between the inner and outer rubber) used in each. Some have a slightly different thickness, weight, color and I assume different “springiness”. With that said, each and every one of them have performed absolutely stellar in every way for my, and my family’s play style. Personally they all have incredible spin, speed and control capabilities. They are all built with beautiful build quality, and designed with comfort and balance in mind. I especially love the resin looking inlaid logo at the end of the handles. I realise that it doesn’t make a performance difference but it just ads to the overall beauty and gives each paddle a quality looking finish.

Overall I feel quite privileged to have had the opportunity to use and experience the Joola brand and share my opinions, though I feel absolutely unqualified to have done so. Just know that if you have never used or played with a “quality” Ping Pong paddle, you are truly missing out, and this Joola brand will be the only brand I choose from here on out! The quality is impeccable!!

title: Nests all around! text: edit 12/28/2017
Well since the original review the boys, and one of our huskies have made the transition to outside hammock-ing with under quilts and all. In the updated photos I have included you can see the new hammocks outside in a carport. Great place to test them sleeping externally while having close access to the home should they wish to go inside. Yes dear old dad slept outside with them. We even slept out side on xmas eve looking for Santa. Luckily he was smart enough to wait till they had fallen asleep. Which honestly took less time than there beds inside. Even with an outside temp in the 30's

With the appropriate gear you can use your hammock year round. We do!

Original :
I absolutely love this/these hammocks. They have a wide range of colors to choose from. We purchased 4 over the last year. A single, Double and Double deluxe.
The singles were for our kids and the double and deluxe were for the wife and myself. Truth be told I didn't realize I had a deluxe till after the purchase was complete. Oh well. I love the extra fabric of the double and the deluxe. The double safely held myself and my bouncy husky with no problem. One just bedded down and slept another well he wasn't having anything to do with it.

We purchased the wall hanging mounts and setup ours for use while indoors too. What better way to introduce 2 kids to hammock-ing slowly. Lets just say they slept better in their hammocks than in their own rooms.
I found out rather quickly why even a slow gentle breeze cools you down. So, we added in our sleeping bags and were toasty all night. Our next adventure the outdoor test with the kids. It will be their first outdoor sleeping. Heres hoping that goes well for this dad.

When out doors I would highly recommend a set of [[ASIN:B00MX4FZ9M ENO Eagles Nest Outfitters - Atlas Straps XL, Hammock Suspension System, Black]]. They are used to string the hammock between trees, its much easier than anything else like rope. I look forward to many years of continued use out of all our purchases.

title: Comfortable text: This yoga bolster pillow arrived all compressed in a space saver type bag. Once I opened the bag, it gradually expanded to its full size. I put it in its pillow case before it was fully expanded. I figured it would be easier that way. It’s a pretty firm, but comfortable pillow. I haven’t been using it for fitness purposes yet, but my family has been using a lot for other reasons. I was helping my husband build an outdoor bench recently and he needed my help putting in the screws. I wasn’t excited about sitting on the floor, so I sat on this pillow. It was so comfortable and didn’t cause any back pain like I might get had I been sitting directly on the floor. It also helps me to sit straight up which is more comfortable in the long run. My husband has been using it when playing video games. It’s durable and well made.

title: I've been using this mat for 10 years, I still love it
text: I wouldn't say my yoga practice is that advanced.  Most of the time I simply use this mat to exercise on (push ups, sit ups, laying and gazing at the ceiling trying to motivate myself).  But I really like this mat for it's thickness and length.  I'm 6' 1" and when I start doing my sit up reps I move around a lot (because my form is horrible) and wherever I end up at the end of a set I'm still on this mat.  It's a great size and after 10 years of exercising on it it still is in remarkable shape.  It hasn't deteriorated or peeled away in areas, it still provides me with enough firm resistance to go through shavasana without sliding and enough comfort that when working on my back or side I'm supported.

title: Excellent for kids text: Our three year old LOVES this! He glides down the block alongside his older siblings who can balance on 2-wheel ones, and beams with pride that he can ride his own too. The brake system took him a little while to understand, but surprisingly after showing him twice, he understands how to use it to slow down, and can easily tilt the bar left or right to steer in that direction. We had another one previously that offered a sit-or-stand option, but he likes this one better, even though that one also had light up wheels. This looks more like a traditional scooter which he likes, and the lack of a folding seat makes it smaller and lighter too.
Really a great value and we recommend it!

title: Manageable Weights for Toning, Strengthening Leg Muscle Groups text: Ankle weights are a valuable, versatile addition to anyone's exercise routine. Weights add resistance to repetitions, helping to further strengthen and tone the specific muscles targeted by repeated simple exercises. These GAIAM WELLBEING ANKLE WEIGHTS (5lb Set) are extremely well-made, with solid stitching, and plenty of good, heavy-duty Velcro that makes them easy to strap on and holds them firmly in place.

I use mine in a rehab routine that rebuilds muscle strength in a repaired broken leg. The 2.5 lb. weight on each ankle is quite manageable for an active woman in good health. These can also be used as hand-held weights (instead of soup cans) in arm-muscle-strengthening exercises.

title: Exactly What I expect from Amazon Basics text: These are very decent gloves. The quality seems pretty good, the fit and style are good but not stellar. So all in all a very good set of gloves but nothing to treasure. But I expect they will stand up well and serve us very well in this upcoming Minnesota winter. The inside lining is soft and warm. There are warming packet pockets and good coverage up the arm, past the sleeve. The are flexible and fit a wide range of hand sizes. i.e. mediums fit large hands pretty well. They really are good gloves.

The Proof is in the pricing which is currently unavailable, but under $20 and these would be pretty darn nice gloves for the price.

title: Good mate for rack. Works fine so far but feels cheap. text: Lacks the feel of really high quality luggage, but it has worked okay for me so far. It is a very good mate for "Delta Mega Rack Post Haste Quick Release Bicycle Seat Post Rack" for which it seems to have been custom fit. As a whole, the marriage of those two items feels well engineered and cheaply made, so you can look at it as a good value or a higher risk for failure on the road. I only use this on in-town rides - never more than 50 miles - so I'm not too worried about roadworthiness. E.g. today I rode my old school MTB - AKA the grocery bike - to my favorite chinese restaurant and took a spoon from home, a tupperware, and a plastic grocery bag for my leftovers. This bag/rack combo is perfect for that kind of thing. If I were planning a trans-continental, epic trek I would aim higher, just because the brand is unfamiliar and the feeling of the materials and construction is budget-minded.

BTW the rack I mentioned needs modification to work without snagging shorts - the stock length bolt sticks out too far and needs to be trimmed - but it's an easy fix with seventh-grade-level shop skills.

title: BEST Water Bottle Ever For Picky Users
text: I ordered four of these in 2015 0r 2016. Over time, I have lost a couple and/or left them on the roof of my car and pulled off. :-D I just ordered four more. I'm VERY picky about water bottles. I expect them to be easy to fill with both ice of any size and, of course, liquids. I expect them to fit easily and well into auto cup holders. I expect the spout that touches my lips to be thin for easy drinking. I expect to be able to put them in the freezer half filled with water to make an ice base for my drinks. I expect them to be lightweight, even when filled. This is the only water bottle I've ever owned that meets all of my expectations. No, it is not insulted, and yes, it does "sweat" sometimes. But I live in Las Vegas, so I use these CONSTANTLY. I've never had any problems with leaking, breaking, or anything else, and since I'm a community college prof, I put these through some pretty heavy use between carting them in backpacks, totes, and luggage and knocking them off desks. (I'm also clumsy. :-D) I was so glad Amazon still offered THIS bottle because these are my constant companions and in Vegas life savers! :-D

title: Crazy bight light, but needs spendy LiON batters with a smart charger to get full benefit. Nothing I have seen is brighter! text: This lamp is so insanely bright it will blind you if you're not careful. Use it for search in rescue- even at 50 fit it makes a strong beam. Also stun an assailent with it as it will temporarily blind someone. Also, I love that it seems dim when you turn it on, making an attacker think its a lame light, but then turn it to the next level and BLAM! Blinded!

Seriously, my LED headlights which go at $1200 a pop are only marginally brighter than this thing. If you want the most absurdly bright flashlight you can by that isn't absurdly priced, this one is it. 3600 lumens if for real!

title: Good Day Pack text: This is an excellent pack. It is VERY lightweight. It does have an 18” tall frame inside, so it is a hard pack. There is a rain cover that stores in the bottom of the pack that covers the entire pack during rain. That cover does take up some space in this small pack, but it is removable if you need the space more than the rain cover.
The straps are ventilated padding. Very light, but also breathable. The frame holds the pack away from your back, so there is also ventilation behind your back and it keeps the pack a little off of you. There is a thin waist strap and chest strap. Both are on the thin side, but this pack isn’t going to be heavy enough to need to to be thicker.
This is not a long trip pack unless you happen to be an exceptionally light packer. And I mean exceptionally light. This is more of a day hike kind of pack. It is sized to be considered a “personal item” on an airplane. So, smaller than a carry on.

title: A Decent Bottle With Some Clunky Features
text: The bottle itself seems solid and durable. It also does a decent job of insulating the liquid inside. The cleaning brush is a nice touch, though it does feel flimsy and cheap, in contrast to the bottle itself. The lid is what seems clunky to me. The handle is rigid and locked in place. If you insert your fingers through the top, as seems natural when picking it up, you will be banging your knuckles against an upright fixture on the back of the lid. The lid is also unnecessarily complicated to get a drink out of. On the product page, they've included directions on how to open the top to take a drink. That's something I don't think I've ever seen with another water bottle. So, while this product performs its basic function well, the clunkiness of its lid design makes me give it 4 stars instead of 5.

title: New favorite water bottle ... text: Saw this on an episode of Cook's Country, where they compared water bottles, and this one was the winner. I've been a Nalgene user since 2003, so I had to try this to see how it compared.

Bottom line: nearly identical in terms of the bottle, but the real difference is the lid. This lid is just so much more "user-friendly" -- it has a wide-mouth base lid which makes it easy to fill and add ice, and a narrow-mouth opening for drinking that secures with a screw cap. No leaks that I've been able to detect so far. I wash all my water bottles by hand, and this one washes just fine.

Based on cost and performance, I plan to stick with the Nathan bottle.

title: Too short/tight! Even for little shoes. And can be a pain to install. text: First, these can be a pain to get in. I tried on my sneakers and a few holes were REEEEAL tight. I used a pencil to help get them in in a couple places. Pulling them out felt like I'd break them, though I was careful and didn't.
After trying the smallest 3 straps on my shoes and trying the shoe on, I realized they'd be too tight and uncomfortable for me. (I do wear a 12 in women's, so I'm way above average there.)
So next, I try my 4 year old's shoes. You'd think I could use the smallest straps, being that he's in a toddler size 10. They were still too tight. I switched and used the 4th and 6th-8th straps (meaning the longest/largest straps) and I think they will work on his shoes. I got the boot on with a little work and I know I won't be re-tying, so that's awesome.
Overall, it's hard to believe these work for any adult shoes, especially when needing more than the longest 3 or 4 straps. Look at the pictures to see how tight it pulled my son's boot- again, this is using the largest straps.

title: Bright, light weight
text: You never know when you'll need a headlight in a pinch. This is a nice option. The light is very bright and really worked well at the barn when we blew a fuse at 2am. It stayed bright for an hour til I got things fixed and no longer needed it. I used it again last night for twenty minutes and there was no dimming, so the battery holds a charge longer than expected. Being rechargeable means I'll get far more use from this than a regular flashlight.

title: Everything Needed is In the Box; Smaller than Standard Size text: My family loves family game night though most of the time we have kept it to board games and (occasionally) air hockey. We've wanted a ping pong table for a while as well as foosball table but have lacked the space for those. This table is the answer. However, there is an important consideration when choosing this (or similar) multi-game table.

This is a mostly pre-assembled game table; just fold out the legs, drop in the foosball poles, add the handles for the foosball game and you're ready to go. Change the top tier for the game you want and you have multiple games at the ready. It has seven games available - foosball, air hockey (more on that in a minute), shuffleboard, bowling, ping pong, backgammon and chess.

I was curious about how the air hockey function would work since this is a non-electric table and there does need to be air to make the puck float. As it turns out, the magic is in the puck. It's USB-rechargeable and it generates enough air flow around itself to glide sufficiently on the table to work. We have an air hockey table that plugs in in the basement; I haven't tried this puck with that table but want to try it to see if it works good with that table too.

All of these games are great. There is one important consideration though. The games are smaller than a standard table. That is, this is not a full-sized ping pong table, foosball table, or air hockey table. I am not sure about the bowling or shuffleboard games - I have never worked with these before. And the backgammon and chess table doesn't have a "standard" size unless you're playing in a tournament.

Other than the size we have been enjoying this table quite a bit. It has brought out the competition in all of us and we have really appreciated having the variety without having to chew up large amounnts of space. The size is actually an advantage in one distinct way - because it is smaller, the table is lighter than if it had been a full-sized one and as such is a lot easier to move when we need to put it in a different room.

Everything needed to play is in the box - ping pong balls and paddles, a foosball ball, full set of chess pieces and more. This is a complete set and requires nothing else.

We're very happy with this table game set and plan to play heavily. With the variety of games it provides, and all of the equipment included, this is a good bet for the competitive family. Just keep in mind that the size is smaller than standard.

title: Thick, sturdy, great quality! text: These hip bands are super sturdy and feel like they'reade to last!

title: Work well for non-fishing related monofilament work text: I am working with monofilament for reasons unrelated to fishing, using fishing line to suspend objects in a UV light bath. Rather than tying each individual one off, I instead used these to create little loops at the end of the strands and looped them over hooks. Quite effective, and quite secure, testing revealed that the line would likely break before being pulled out of the crimp.

I was using .9mm line and so used the 1mm crimps. Would recommend, at least for non-fishing applications.
