title: Lower profile that can sit at waters edge.. text: Nice quality materials used and made to feel solid. The idea of fold and go is there.. almost!! In order to fit into storage/carry pouch- you’ll need to undo a few moving parts.. not ideal! Especially if your hands are full and kids are tired, cranky, hungry, sunburned… and less then helpful in readying to go!! (sound familiar.. or is it just my cranky crew?!) I want fold and carry, sort of one and done! Last trip I decided to carry back to car and fuss with folding later.. (Hmm, yes I was that girl!) heaving a heavier chair back to the car I found it wasn’t easier.. and the weight isn’t the lightest!! Next time I’ll fold it before I go- I promise.

Heavier weight equates to the solid foundation and materials used. This has integrity and doesn’t field to give way under weight of user- at 140lb. I had 28lb toddler on my lap climbing.. and chair was a solid 10. Husband used as well- he’s 210lb. and had same results.. just note the integrity is there.

Loved the extra perks! A functioning drink holder.. able to hold hydro.. cushioned arm rests.. and sleek colors with matching bag- better price point under $50. Being of lower profile I appreciate ability to set at the waters edge and let h2o lap onto feet to cool you off. Height is great for kids and shorter peeps (being only 5’1” I qualify!) But, as low as this is.. it may be problematic for elderly or any knee or back issues- something to keep in mind.

Overall- it’s a solid with far more perks vs. quirks.. If configured more user friendly/easy to fold up with total ease.. this would be a total home run!!! Planning to use a lot this summer- so I’m sure I’ll perfect my skills.. Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: UPDATED after beach week, real world use. Best cooler for $$ Read full review text: UPDATE AFTER VACATION;
the best thing about this cooler for longer trips, its dry ice ready. We spent 15$ on dry ice, used the divider (frozen) and our ice didnt start to melt until day 6 on the way home. This cooler worked as well as the Yeti for 3x less money. I'm so happy and proud of my cooler I use it almost everyday. Our beach trip was a total success and we saved 6$ a day on ice at the minimum. Perfect cooler for everyday use, beach, river, lake and just about any time you need. Plenty of room and easy to clean. A must buy

Update, 1st use breakdown.

Did NOT precool cooler, Used Grizzly Brand ice divider (owns Kenia coolers), and my cans were pre chilled in fridge.
I only used 1 half of my cooler using the frozen divider. The other half stayed empty.

10lbs ice 1st day ( rd side ice machine which isnt the best ice and melts quick) after 36 hrs I only had around 2 cups of water because the divider was refreezing the water as it melted against the divider and along the bottom of cooler.
Day 3 I added 20lbs of frozen ice. Still only half of cooler. Didnt have but a quart or so of melt off by this point and divider was half melted. The ice last 2 more days before I drained 1.25 to 1.5 gallons of water from cooler and had maybe 7 lbs of lightly frozen ice left.

This cooler is awesome from my use and my experience with using it. Today I've added 20lbs of ice NO divider and using entire cooler and I still only have a cup of water. Temp is 80 degrees constantly and 15 hrs have gone by already. This is still the rd side machine ice, as I said before in a normal cooler 20lbs will melt within 20 hrs for sure by next morning it's all water. With the Kenia cooler I have easily doubled my ice time if not almost tripling it. And I'm not freezing the ice in a freezer before use. If you freeze this crap ice before use, it can last 4 or so days. If u freeze ice in deep freezer I'm sure it will last even longer because of the - temps with deep freezer.

Well worth the money spent and saved vs a 600$ equivalent yeti. This cooler will pay for it self over 40 total days, 5$ or more per bag ice, 1 bag per day 200$... paid for that quick. At least with my old coolers this is what I was having to do, either 6$ bag ice from store or 2 rd side bags @4$ per day. Every day and during our Southern 100 degree days I was having to do this twice a day. So by far this cooler out last most on market.

Now I added 20 lbs of frozen freezer ice to that 10lbs, didnt drain the water. The ice lasted 4 days. I hope this helps someone make the right choice for the money.
We have a beach trip planned in few months and another updated test results will come after that trip. That test will be outside in middle summer outside 16+ hrs a day in direct sunlight. Will update after words to tell the world.

Look 5 stars even though ITS LOOKS TO BE USED!!
yes it is scratched on top and scuffed on side and bottom and it does not smell like a factory cooler smells when purchased. With the way its wrapped and boxed this shouldnt happen if it was brand new. I could be wrong and issues arise from warehouse worshipping problems. But it seems to be a returned item that has been used at least once.

Overall this cooler is huge, thick, and very sturdy! Cheaper by almost 70% from yeti brand. I'm very pleased with purchase.
The color is absolutely vibrant and eye catching. I love the stapdown handles and the thick rubber feet on bottom.
The inside is just amazing you can tell it will hold heat or cold very easily.

I wish there were more accessories available with the 65 quart coolers.. that's my only big issue besides the used look.
I bought a rack from yeti hoping to bend it the .1 inch to fit (judging by measurements provide by companies). I have also bought the 5lbs freezer divider so we can keep usable ice seperate from used ice with the dry ice.

Camping trip in next few weeks will give a good idea of how well this cooler cools. Will update at that time and let everyone know how this cooler works in real world settings.

I have not been paid for ANY review I've ever left. (I wish I did though) This is, as always, just my opinion through my eyes to help others.
If you find this review helpful, please vote, so Amazonian browsers can better learn, research and understand how products work for them.!. Thank you and Happy Buying

title: Your only decision should be selecting a color text: Microfiber towels come in assorted shapes, sizes, textures and weights. The [[ASIN:B00HBR41LY #1 Rated Travel Towel and Sports Towel - MICROFIBER - Guarantee Bleed Free - Includes Hook]] is different than any other microfiber towel I've seen and I now understand what the hype is about. The Pebble and Stone color is lovely and gender neutral, soothing to look at. The medium size of 24" x 48" is ample enough to take on a trip around the world, weighing in at 150 grams or 5.29 ounces without adding bulk. It is absorbent, quick drying after a gentle wringing, and has a centered fabric hook perfectly sewn into one of the long edges at dead center position. Most importantly for me, this towel is s-o-f-t and s-m-o-o-t-h, so for delicate skin, it is a winner. Washable in cold water, it's ideal for a quick wash in the sink and hang over the rack for drying. Not ready to wash it yet? You can just hand it for an air out, but I like to keep it clean and not carry around old memories. I'm quite surprised at how impressed I am with this towel, but there you have it. It is a good size, feels good, is easy to maintain, and it can be used over and over again without deteriorating. The Morning Sky and River Blue colors look equally as soothing as this one and I'd be hard pressed to select a single color. There is a molded Shandali logo impressed into one corner of the towel that in my opinion finishes it off. This towel was made in China of an 80% Polyester and 20% Nylon blend. Even the satin label sewn into the edging is quality.

I was sent this towel in exchange for an honest review.

title: Great for less slope-friendly hills!
text: This is great! We love snow tubes and this one is exactly what we wanted for our shallow hill in the yard! Tubes are some of the best sleds in my experience. We've tried plastic and wood traditional style sleds, and they're great when you have a steep decline and a lot of snow, and are much more durable than inflatable tubes.... but on less dramatic slopes and very fine snow (which is often what my backyard has), they get stuck. This is the ONLY type of sledding toy that consistently picks up speed and makes it down the hill. And, this one is big enough for multiple people, so dad + kid can enjoy the snow. Sure, you have to be careful not to tear it like our old one on some sticks or rocks, but I still whole heartedly recommend this for fun in the winter.

title: Golf cart dream item.. if only it could work!!! text: Who wouldn’t love some great tunes on their golf cart..?!! As a family who owns a golf cart yet, has never golfed a day in our life - we’ve spent the last decade doing nothing but, fun rides and adventures all around our planned community with our kiddos on this toy. Music would only enhance this- and give us golf cart karaoke?!!

Problem is.. this is a one size fits most. But, it didn’t come close to being “most” for us! How.. when we have the same speaker used in the sellers sample photo description- see photo I included..??!! Right from start when trying to attach we had issues.. this has 6 velcro straps coming out of the sides- (picture a big bug with legs!) Zero instructions included and you'd think this would be straightforward.. Trust me, we tried straps forward wrapping around pole and then, backwards just the same- we even went back to description online.. studied the photo and still had no success.

Problems we incurred:

•Straps are not long enough to wrap around the pole and speaker- and have enough length to close on themself. (this is placing the speaker in same spot as advertised!)

•2 of the 3 sets of straps were sewn in backwards- so, if wrapping around the direction they’re attached- The Velcro teeth on x2 straps are on the wrong side. (Equivalent to getting two negative signs together..) hoping this is an error!

•From photo description it appears we are missing a middle extra strap? Photo shows x1 in brown strap thru middle but, we don’t have anything of the sort...??

•This has no bottom support or “shelf” for added protection.. this could lead speaker slide at the bottom if it were to become a loose. Golf carts bounce around a bit and vibration may cause this to slip. So, bottom support would be helpful if not, necessary to protect the speaker from falling down and give the user peace of mind.

•This is missing a simple but straightforward set of instructions.

overall, this may work with a much smaller size speaker- one with hardly any girth.. Even then, it may be hit/miss to get the securely fastened. I’m afraid a smaller speaker may not produce enough sound to be heard over a motorized golf cart and will it stay safe? In leui of listing this “one size fits all/most..” this would be beneficial to list the actual length and dimension of straps so, one can verify speaker sizes that would work! Listed at a price point of $10- this could be a great find.. if, it could be successful. Tbh, It may be safer to invest more solid option to ensure it will fit/function as expected. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Fantastic Hydration Pack text: This is a fantastic pack for bicycling, running, or hiking. It is large enough to carry plenty of water and other supplies for a full day of activities, but not so large that it becomes heavy or unwieldy. The back of the pack is both padded and ventilated so the weight of the bag is comfortably distributed and you don't get overly hot. There is a convenient top pocket for things like keys or energy chews, and there are two deep compartments that keep your gear secure.

There is also a vented, extendable front pouch which is ideal for storing a jacket if you need to strip down during the day. The tube clips onto the front strap with a magnetic clasp so you don't have to fiddle with snapping it in and out of a clip. The tube also has an off valve so you don't have to worry about your bag leaking during transport in your car.

This is a highly-adjustable, comfortable, and practical bag that will keep you well hydrated no matter how intensely you train.

title: Better than some more expensive options! (but bumpy- expected for the price, read for explanation) text: I've owned and reviewed a handful of electric scooters, some nearly double the asking price of this one. This is actually quite good, and was more-or-less ready to go right out of the box (very minimal assembly required). It is also very easy to fold for storage and carry, and the clip looking piece on the handlebars is for locking the scooter in the folded position (see photo). There actually isn't any mention of that clip in the manual, so I wasn't sure what it was for until I tried to fold it.
There are some things that I like better about this one vs some of my others I've tried. For starters, it is lighter and hits a faster top speed than others in this price range (In real world usage that is- most of these claim to be the same 15mph speed, but in use some are faster than others).
I found the speed level settings odd: rather than saying 1, 2 and 3 like other "gear" settings, this one uses Eco, D, and S. Honestly, using numbers would have been more intuitive but that doesn't detract from the experience at all. The one thing I really DO wish they did, however, is have air-filled tires for some bump smoothing. You see, one of the big problems with small wheel scooters is that every crack, bump and pothole is exaggerated. I have 2 scooters with traditional inner tube tires that I can take down a certain bumpy road that this cannot easily. To be fair, those scooters cost quite a bit more than this one, so for the price that can't be expected. In fact, this seems to be an excellent value for the asking price right now, so I'd go ahead and give it 5 stars. A quality product for the money. Just know what you can or can't do with it.

title: Great for Wheelchairs text: These are exactly the same as the Bictmitc brand gloves I previously reviewed back in October. The only difference is the brand name and color of the name on the wrist strap. From the word GEL on the palm to the number of dots on the grippy bits they're identical.

Here's that review:
"I'm currently confined to a wheelchair and being a big guy I needed some grip and protection when I'm scooting myself around. These gloves seemed to fit the bill and once they arrived they did. Fit was great. Tight enough to stay in place no matter how hard I'm pushing the chair around but not too tight to be uncomfortable. Finger holes are right sized as well. The palms are incredibly grippy and would work as well on a bicycle handlebars as they do gripping the big wheel of my chair. If I had one complaint it's the palm material is tacked onto the glove and are a bit. . . the only way I can describe it as bulky. title: Smart! text: This was very quick and easy to set up. It didn't take very long at all before it was up and running. When it first arrived, the weather was extremely rainy, so my husband played around with inside the house. We had never ridden hover boards before, so we didn't have any prior experience. It requires the use of an app to control it. My husband and my 17 year old daughter have both downloaded and are the primary users. When riding in the house, they were riding on tile, hardwood, and carpet. The Segway moved over all three surfaces easily and without any hesitations. It went over the transitions smoothly. I was surprised at how fast they were able to go inside the house.

Once the weather was nicer, they took it outside. We live in a small neighborhood with minimal traffic. They have enjoyed riding in the street as well as the driveway. The app limits the speed based on how much driving you've done. The more experienced you are, the faster you are permitted to go.

It has headlights and rear colored lights. You control the hover board with your balance and leaning. My husband says if you think too much about it, it's difficult to control. Instead of thinking about how to control it, he finds it easier to think about the direction instead and has more success with it. I tried to ride the thing once and had difficulties with my balance. I haven't tried since then.It will go for about 25 miles before you have to recharge it. But my husband and daughter love it! They are considering splitting the cost of a second one so they can ride together.

title: Nice, Compact Backpack text: My husband just used this on a trip to Las Vegas as his personal item. He flew on Spirit airlines and they charge for carry-on items. Passengers can take one personal item as long as it fits under the seat in front of you. He was looking through the house for a small backpack to use, but most of them were too big. He's 6'2 and he wanted a little room under the seat for his feet. This pack had just arrived at our house, so I offered it to him. It was perfect. Since it's made of a thinner material than typical backpacks, he was able to squish it easily to fit under the seat and allow himself some foot room. He was able to fit his over the ear headphones, an inflatable travel pillow, a spare outfit (in case his luggage was misplaced), a power bank, his tablet, and a few other items. The material is pretty thin, but durable. All the zippers moved smoothly. He was very pleased with it.

title: Handy for self defense n tight spaces. Fits in the hand comfortably text: I have a concealed carry permit and I typically carry a pistol all the time - have someone attack you and you quickly understand the need for real protection and you never forget. I wanted this little stunner for my barn office as a backup. When I'm working with horses, I don't wear my pistol unless we have a very specific need. (Like wild hogs)

This is small and fits in the palm of my hand comfortably. The flashlight is handy for dark corners, blinding a bad guy or figuring out what that drip is. The stun action is very fast and it definitely makes some noise and throws a bit of sparky light. I'm certain it would show down a bad guy at least long enough to let me get to my real firearm. My concern is the contact prongs being a little flimsy - one or two strikes will be fine, but if you used this a lot (can't imagine those circumstances!) the contacts will probably bend and malfunction.

title: Great Bottle text: The assembly of this cup was weird. The instructions were completely lacking as to which direction to install the filter. Hope I did it correctly. It seems to work. (Plastic tab side down, if you're wondering.) Other than that issue, the assembly wasn't bad.

title: Compact and effective text: This is a little revolutionary as it is a mix of pilaties and weights with cardio. A a tool for women and this corebody equipment keeps the pieces in one single cylinder. Allows up to 10lb of resistance. I love that it is so compact. I am looking for core strength training that is low impact, not muscle building and not clutter my home with heavy equipment. This is it! I am also looking at the Physique 57 training that is pilates centric too, that creates a leaner look and weight loss too!

This pack includes:" the core trainer, a dvd that has 45 minutes and an 30 minutes express plus focus on core training; a set of cards for 8 workouts to focus on lower body, upper body, core and stretch/renew; a food diary; recipes and workout chart! That is a lot of goodies and use what your level of knowledge and guidance needed.

Workout: very effective and I love that fact it is low impact and I had a great work out. I Love running, spinning and various workouts, but wanted something that is low impact with pilates that is core focused. Instructions on the DVD is very good with one person who focuses on modifications if you are still building your reflexibility and cardio. There are three level of resistances that you can work up to, and for me, I am generally weak on my upper body and this workout will really make me focus on this area, whether i like it or not! The workout works out both core, heart and strength training! 3 in 1!

There are not a lot of extra dvds with this tool: 2 so far, so it will be good if they can provide a few more for people like who needs a lot of variety when working out. Great value and I like this tool a lot.

title: Clever & useful basket, dismal mounting brackets text: The basket for this is very useful & clever design. The basket is large. It detaches easily by folding up the handles & can be carried into a store or wherever. When the handles are folded down, the basket is locked to the bracket, when they are extended up, they unlock. We added the small carabiner to keep the handle from being jostled by bumps allowing it to detach.
The mounting bracket attaches to the bike with nothing more than gravity & a lot of faith. We put the zip ties around the handlebar brackets to keep them from coming off on bumps. The bottom bracket uses a flimsy piece of velcro that broke immediately after the picture was taken & was replaced with yet another zip tie.
Once we got the mounts firmed up (mostly with a bunch of zip ties), the basket holds well & is useful. The handlebar mounts have rubber coating but the bottom bracket inexplicably does not & will beat up the paint on the stem.

title: Great Size for 7y.o. Girl w/ Slim Build text: I was looking for a replacement for a Garmin Vivo Fit 2 after it failed. We've only had it in service a few days, but my daughter really likes it (she likes the ability to switch to the Minon watch face, and we've had some "steps" competitions). I purchased this watch as some of the other kids watches are extremely oversized in my opinion. I also like the simplicity of this watch's design and functions. My daughter was intuitively able to understand how to navigate through the functions right out of the box.

The watch connected to the smartphone app right away and syncing has worked every time without issue. I think this is one of the best options on the market based on compact size (sized appropriately for smaller wrists), functions (we didn't want a true "smart watch", or even one that pretends to be a smart watch), brand name/durability, and price.

IMO kids of this age don't need additional exposure to screens or games. Make them go do physical play and use their imaginations. The main features we wanted were something that could show the time, a step counter, and a timer. My daughter uses the timer to make sure she's getting her daily reading minutes in and this allows her to be more autonomous when doing this.

I do wish there were more band styles available though. For example, I wish there were stretchy silicone/rubber bands like there were for the Vivo Fit 2. Maybe they are available and I just haven't found them yet.

title: Great set of exercise bands.. get the job done at a decent price point! text: I liked this set of exercise bands. I appreciate the carry bag they come with but, I do wish it was a bit more accessible (easy to get into) and sturdy. Why can’t they make these just a tad bit bigger- why is the struggle always needed to get the item back in its case?!!

I also loved the “cheat sheet” card insert as well, *reference a closer picture included above. This shows drawings of a few exercise options to help you get started and from there.. you can branch out or, tweak use to best suite your personal workout. **you can google 100’s of workouts using bands and also.. get helpful tips and information that way as well. The cheatsheet will also remind a user which band is what strength/resistance. These are color-coded and marked… However, overtime marking looks too fade and with colors being so similar, it may be harder to keep specifically identified. The card will help! ** FYI- these do increase in resistance in the same order as color scheme (they increase light to dark... just FYI! Adds the best helpful feature for identifying.)

I’ve used these daily for about two weeks and they seem to hold elasticity quite well- of course, they get more stretchable like any rubber band mentality.. but, still offer plenty of the resistance needed. So far so good, I haven’t had any of them snap/break and this was my biggest concern!

I do recommend using over clothing material vs. bare skin- these can pull at any hair on skin (downy or, otherwise!) and it can hurt!! Certain stretches don’t involve skin contact.. and those are by my favorite by far!!
I haven’t used the small mat that set comes with- and Im not sure I would - it feels like it’s made of “papery plastic”..I’m going to stick to the yoga mat I already have!!
I’m not 100% certain they’re is a noticeably large difference between the levels of the middle bands.. But, there definitely is between the first and last amount of resistance in the band.
Overall, this is a nice set of exercise bands that has held up and done it’s job without any complaints and at a decent price point.
I hope this info helps… feel free to let me know!

text: For something designed to be squeezed, you can do just that with ease.

title: Wife loves it! Keeps her accountable for drinking water! text: My wife loves this water bottle. Not only is the color combination so pretty, but it’s large enough to last all day, without being too big. She tried a gallon one in the past and liked it... but could never finish it. This is a more realistic goal!

It comes with a convenient carrying strap attached to the bottle, and also a straw and drinking nozzle. The lid pops up easily to take a sip and closes back up securely. You can drink with or without the straw and nozzle... your choice! It’s also BPA free, so it gives some peace of mind. 😃

The motivational quotes keep her chugging all day!

title: Give it a try
text: Got it all hooked up the spokes were too close to bottom set up so had to angle it but works fine. Seems to be like a great fit for what we needed.

title: Recommend this
text: This helps get my pulse up. It’s a great workout and not too difficult. You can change the levels. It’s great to do while watching tv or before bed to help you relax and snooze off. Great price too.

title: Fantastic product
text: Love this band. I wear it around my right ankle and often forget it’s there. It tracks my steps so I know it’s registering (I have previously worn my device on my wrist like a watch but I hate watches so this is the best way to wear it for me). Highly recommend this ankle strap.

title: Too much fun!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:22780788f3d674f5d9eb4f6bfac486a7]] A father and son day!  This was a great day of shooting.  I can’t believe how much fun this is.  Next we will be sitting up some 2 liter bottles to hit.  The slingshot has a strong stainless steel frame.  And comes with everything you need on the slingshot.  You even get an extra sling, springs, and an arrow bracket assembly.

title: Very good quality

title: It's OK
text: It's roomy and the material is durable, though it feels a little cheap/coarse to the touch. Doesn't have much structure to keep its shape either. Not bad, but sort of entry-level, as far as pouches go.

title: coleman 62 quart wheeled cooler
text: LOVE this cooler - mostly because of the wheels.  Once you've loaded it with ice and drinks (or whatever) it's too heavy for me to lift.  The handle is just the right length and makes moving it a dream.  I put 5 bags (7lbs each) of ice in with various drinks - stayed iced down and cold for well after 12 hours - Lid opening and closing as people used it.  Coleman is the best brand in my opinion.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful in some way.

Great value thanks Amazon.

title: Lens slid out text: Within 20 minutes the lens popped out and when I tried to slide it back in, realized it slid out due to an improper fit.

Was light weight and sun protection was great for the few minutes I was able to wear….

title: SHAMEFUL. Shipping 3 ounce containers for 6 ounce price. Been doing this for years, hmm?!! text: If I would have received the amount that I paid for, I would give this 5 stars. BUT, I received 3 ounces, half the size that is shown. They show 6 OUNCES in the picture, AND the price per ounce reflects this too. But no, I got HALF THE SIZE. I would not have purchased this. I saw some OLD reviews saying this (recently and going back 5 years).. and same story. People spending their good money for a 6 ounce container and getting 3. COME ON. So SHAMEful. Fix it.

That being said, if you want to chance it, know that this is a decent product. Nice size flakes, works well in soups, casseroles, meat loaf. I've been trying it in some soups, rice, and mixing it into meatballs, meat loafs. I bought this primarily to make sure I have some shelf stable vegetables. I go through a lot of various veggies, and now adays items are low in availability (I'm not driving all over for groceries), look sad, or are too pricy. This just helps assure me that I still have my staples. I've been meaning to do my own hydrating for a few years now, but haven't taken the plunge. In the mean time, I stock up on what is commercially available. I like this brand, and may consider more but it can't be from Amazon.

Spinach is a favorite for amping up the healthy aspect of a meal. I really like these dehydrated flakes as it is still close to looking, tasting, feeling like spinach but just in very small pieces. Another option I use is powder form. I normally will get out one of my [[ASIN:B08FF4C5HX Healthy Journey spinach powder]] or [[ASIN:B097KRPDYP XPRS Nutra organic spinach powder]]

title: Five Stars
text: Worth the money.

title: Nice quality text: I was surprise by the quality. It's very nice.
1. The case is made of nice quality wood. It looks very nice. Nice finish. Quite sturdy
2. It hangs on the wall securely.
3. The board itself is heavy and durable and nice quality. My wife thinks the numbers look funky, but they are as I expected.
4. The dart board hands in the case securely. It doesn't want to come away from the wall every time you pull out the darts.
5. The darts are pretty nice, but not great. We replaced the stems and the flights because they flights kept falling out. But the barrel and tips are nice. Fairly heavy, and fly nice.
6. I would have preferred a chalk board. The writing surface is smooth and uses a weird white-out marker. But, it works well enough.
7. There's a little typo, we're all play "01". But who cares.
The instructions are clear, and it has all of the correct measurements and hardware.

All in all, we are very happy with it.

title: Techie Teen Approved
text: As summer is almost upon us, we've been trying out different camping lanterns both for actual use in camping as well as for emergencies like power outages. Out of all the different lanterns we've looked at, this is the one that really caught our teen nerd's fancy. It's very small and compact. It's durable. It's easy to hang from something or attach to any metallic surface. And it can give a very bright light, enough to light up a large area when needed. Our teen will be keeping it in his room against camping or emergency needs and he happily gives it a full five stars.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Cushiony, compact, and comfortable. text: Obviously I don't wear this in the summer, so at the time of this writing is not the time I wear these socks. But I found a pair while doing laundry (oddly) and thought to write my review on them now.
They're perfect for when I go for a late-night jogging or to the Y. I wouldn't recommend wearing these to work or on casual Fridays. Because they compress the feet, there's not much cushion on the outside to fill the space of shoes. Therefore, it's best to wear these with athletic shoes, which are more form-fitting. They stain like normal socks, but at least when they do the stains look more like rubbed dirt after a wash.

The only issue is that they attract fuzz a lot. I'd suggest spraying them with static-removing spray. Otherwise, you'll get a lot of fuzz and hair showing on them.

title: Three Stars

title: Same quality at lower price.
text: The only thing I don’t like about this bar is the anti slip ribbing on the weight slide. It is extremely noisy adding and removing plates to the bar.

title: Extremely bright, well made, compact flashlight, great belt case and cool charger ! text: I own several Olight flashlights. The Seeker 2 Pro is the brightest one I have. It is bright! They got a ton of light into a small package. I could repeat the features of this light but the Amazon order page does a great job of listing the features of this pocket powerhouse.

One feature of many Olight flashlights is the magnetic charger. This gives me the ability to recharge either at home or in the car. The included L dock is very neat. The belt case seems very well built also.

This is my first flashlight that shows both the battery strength and output level right in the button. The Olight Seeker 2 Pro has a good feel in my hand. I like the rubberized grip areas.

The 1200 lumen output on high is enough for most any need I have. If more is needed then the 3200 lumen output on turbo is very impressive. This unit can go from 5 lumens ( moonlight mode ) to 3200 lumens ( blinding ) The strobe light should be enough to temporarily blind and disorient an attacker.

This is to me, a very impressive flashlight package that I will enjoy for years to come.

Update 8/7/2019 After using this light more, I am still impressed with. It still has a great feel to it. You can feel the quality in it. It is amazingly bright, packed with features with great customer service to back up great products.

title: Perfect size
text: Perfect size. Perfect condition. I walk everyday and this umbrella keeps me very dry. An added addition is the convenient holder that comes with it. I put the strap around my shoulder to make it easy to carry

title: Cute gold set text: This was a cute golf set.

We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

We did have a little issue with one of the handles, which was why I took off a star.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: A Stylish, Durable Tumbler That Gets The Job Done
text: When it comes to travel mugs, my criteria are pretty simple. Does it insulate well? Is it durable? Leakproof? Those are the basics. An attractive appearance is frosting on the cake. This mug scores well on all three basic questions and I really, really like it's royal blue look. The 360' drinking thing is new to me but I like that too. All in all, this is an excellent travel mug.

title: Works well. Costs little. text: Works well. Costs little. Don't know what else to say. I guess it would be helpful if they printed on the package a QR code that linked to an instructional video. I wasn't 100% sure how to read the tool because I haven't had one before. I just searched for chain wear on YouTube and found someone using the exact same tool.

BTW both of my bikes' chains are fine, so that's one less thing to worry about. Now if they could just make a tool to TRACK DOWN THAT NOISE! LOL

title: My husband LOVES them!
text: My husband always "borrowed" my crocs (even though they were way to small for him).  So I figured I would be able to get him into these since they had the Texas Rangers logo on them.  He just LOVES them!  Uses them everyday!  Great product!

title: Adapters
text: Several of the 5 adapters leaked air when you put them on the presto valve.  Could be a bad o-ring inside or just a defective adapter.  May try to replaced the o-ring when I have time to play  around with it.  That is why I am only giving it 3 stars.  You get what you pay for.

title: Good quality
text: A good all around basketball.  We are using it outdoors and it has the fell of a top quality ball.

title: Fits decent but the strap loosens text: My kid loves this. Color is bright and likes being a baby shark.

The strap comes lose a bit. I had to keep tightening it. Worries me but obviously you keep a close eye on a toddler in the pool, so you can be there to adjust quickly.

title: Ok, but not the best option text: We have an almost identical chair from Cabela's that has held up really well for 5 years now and cost half of this chair. I thought having this one with the arms would be an upgrade for our Chihuahua Desert horse camp.

It's ok, but not as good as the smaller, armless Cabela chair. This was a freaking nightmare to set-up. Literally none of the pieces that needed to unfold or turn worked out of the box. My husband actually had undo all the leg bolts, position the frame and legs and rebolt everything. He was not amused.

The feet settle into the gravel and rock in our driveway, but they are still wobbly compared to the Cabela chair - and that chair has smaller feet! The arms on this one do make the chair more comfortable overall and it sits up a little taller. We'll have to wait and see if it holds up for years out in the elements or not.

title: 5 stars
text: Works  and it is loud.  Good to have in rescue situations.  I recommend all household have at least one.

title: Great product for campers! text: My family loves our annual camping trip, but heating water for coffee is something we just deal without usually. I was excited to try this on our trip as I've heard good things about alcohol stoves. I'm impressed, and now I can't believe I've gone camping so many times without anything like this!
To be clear- this isn't something you heat over a camp fire, but rather it requires its own fuel (it uses alcohol, which burns cleanly and efficiently). It is really easy to use, and I have to say it boiled water and gave us great coffee out in the woods! I love that we could even use it for hot oatmeal and other things that we normally wouldn't consider having on a camping trip. I'm very happy with this product and would gladly recommend it!
